Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL IN A GOOD LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: dennisD08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Easter/Spring break, so traffic was very busy. Having stayed in many Orlando hotels over the years this rates as one of the best. The rooms are large (Two Queen beds)very clean and we could not here any. noise from any other rooms. As our room was at the rear of the building so we did not have any problem with road noise (I4 very close) The staff were excellent and very helpful. The hotel is very well placed for Downtown Disney (appox 5/10 mins drive) there are plenty of eating places around the hotel, some within walking distance. Comments have been made regarding getting in and out of this hotel. I found driving down (Towards Tampa) and exiting at 68? the entrance is no more than 100yards from the exit road, very very easy. The entrance could have a larger sign. Coming out of the hotel you have to turn right (Dual carrigeway) drive towards the traffic lights, u turn and back to the I4. If you cannot manage this very simple task you should not be driving. Remember I was there at a very busy period and had NO problems what so ever

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Disney”
Reviews.Author: ElioWolff
Reviews.Content: Very good standard, comfortable rooms, very good service, well located, close to Disney parks and to the highway. Good to go with family, we will certainly go back. Excellent experiencefor us. Be carefull only with the disney sale tickets outside the hotel, close to the parking, small house/office, we had a VERY unpleasant situation, would not recommend to buy tickets there ever! Anyway the hotel was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Such High Hopes Dashed to Bits”
Reviews.Author: gslink
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before picking a hotel, but sometimes you have your hopes crushed. It happens and I hope I can steer you away from making the same mistake I did. First, don't let the high rank on this hotel fool you. YOU DON'T WANT TO STAY HERE! Here's the list, draw your own conclusions: 1. This is an old Radisson and the walls are barely there, I could here multiple conversations going on at the same time, all night long. 2. We asked for a feather-free room (my son and wife are very allergic) which we din't get so I called for some different pillows and we waited 30 minutes, I called again and still no pillows, they called me back to ask if I got them (there one positive point in the whole stay) but still nothing, an hour later, pillows but we forgot to mention the bedspread which we checked and was feather as well. We just put it in the corner of the room. 3. The street just outside the hotel is a nightmare. We drove to the Uno's (see map for this) which is within walking distance but it looked like it would rain pretty hard so that's why we drove. From the Uno's back to the hotel took 50 minutes (I am not exaggerating this). We had to turn left on to the road which took a few light cycles to do this then wait on the street until we could move past the hotel, down the street to the next possible place to do a u-turn, wait some more and then finally into the parking lot....50 minutes, let that sink in for a moment. 4. Beds are old, small, and worn out. We were planning to stay there all week but I didn what I have never done before, I made the call down that night and cancelled that rest of our stay and we went to Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando Near Universal Orlando Resort which is a very good hotel, see my review of that one for more information. I like Radisson's and I had such high hopes but this old relic of a hotel needs to be torn down and turned into a restaurant or something.

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Shaun H
Reviews.Content: Pretty tip top, great hotel within a walk of Disney village. Beds massive and very comfy, staff brilliant and have a very friendly helpful attitude. Manager extremely approachable and on hand. (Nice guy too!) breakfast is a highlight 10 dollar buffet! Amazing value. A great start to our tour of the states, looking at using this hotel again at the end of our holiday. Shaun - Hampshire uk

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel! Warning-Elevators can be slow!”
Reviews.Author: senior_traveller_10
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here on previous trips and were very impressed with the staff, the location (right off I-4) and lots of restaurants in the area. Rooms are large and comfortable. The only complaint was the elevator service. There seem to be only 2 elevators for such a large hotel, and we must have waited 10-15 minutes to get an elevator down in the morning. Not good if you're in a hurry. People were getting very upset!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room- only 1 pick-up/dropoff bus shuttle daily to parks”
Reviews.Author: jabogus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Radisson for three nights and booked the king room with the jacuzzi tub (which was very nice) and enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean. My only complaint was that there was only 1 pick-up and dropoff daily for the shuttle bus to the parks. The pick up times for the parks from the hotel was pretty early in the morning and my husband and I didn't want to get up that early every morning so we had to choice but to drive to the parks instead. The sleep number bed wasn't very comfortable and the remote for it was extremely finicky. My back was killing me by the last night. All and all the hotel was nice and rooms were clean. Probably wouldn't stay there again though. I've always stayed in one of the hotels on Hotel Plaza Blvd (downtown Disney) and thought this hotel was part of the shuttle service that left every hour. My fault for not asking about the shuttle service before I booked the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night”
Reviews.Author: asmith91303
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night upon our arrival to orlando because we could not check in to our disney resort until the next day. It was perfect. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Our family of 5 had plenty of room and beds are super comfortable. The staff at check in was very friendly and helpful. It is right off the expressway, right across the street from downtown disney and next to a area with lots of restaurants and a grocery store. Very convenient and a great price. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Radisson usual standard”
Reviews.Author: Deborah C
Reviews.Content: Good job we're all different. As a travel agent I am lucky to travel quite extensively and have stayed in other Radisson hotels. This one is the worst ever. Hotel itself ok, it was quite clean and modern looking. Situated in the middle of a triange of 3 major roads. The traffic noise was unbelievable. The sign on the door to the hotel says 'NO SOLICITING'. This speaks volumes for me. We checked in a little dubiously. At 10am hotel bar was already busy with scruffy people. Looked like the local 'watering hole'. I was told that this is normal in the USA, that hotel bars are used by locals. These people were loud and already drunk! I have never come across this before. However, we dumped our bags and went outside where my partner and I were approached almost immediately by a man asking for money. We immediately went back indoors, having decided this was not the place to spend the last two nights of our wonderful holiday and checked out. We stayed for less than an hour! There are far better hotels in the same price bracket as this.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of every attraction in Orlando! Disney Resorts are literally across the street. Hotel offers free transfers to all major attractions, but aren't necessary if you have your own car. Rooms are more than adequate and the staff is very attentive. For the money, you would be hard-pressed to find a better deal in the area. Room service food is kind of meh, and lack of food warmer/eating trays that they bring food in make it difficult to eat. There are plenty of places to eat within minutes of the hotel. I was impressed with my overall stay.....so much, that I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Orlando and close to major attractions”
Reviews.Author: EJG-DT
Reviews.Content: We chose this for our stay in Orlando and was a great find, great size rooms, Good small gym and a nice small pool with hot tub and the staff very friendly. picked up some tickets for EPCOT at a discount as well. Good room facilities with fridge and microwave. the free internet is a bonus in the USA and the free parking. Good resturants locally with walking distance and a supermarket.Early risers(5am-6.30am) have a free mini breakfast! A delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Tracyb215
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for the second time at his hotel. This time we stayed for 6 nights. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, they go out of their way to make you happy. The rooms are very spacious, much larger than a typical hotel room. The rooms and the rest of he hotel are very clean and fresh smelling. They have delicious cookies offered each day after 3pm. My only complaint is that it is located on a busy road, so if you a staying at prime time (like we did at Spring break), you will hit some heavy traffic trying to get to and from the hotel. However, the affordable rates, the friendly staff, and the exceptionally clean rooms more than make up for it in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “dumpy rooms”
Reviews.Author: TrustMe789
Reviews.Content: Rooms were dumpy. Service was average. We paid for the first night but didn't make it until the following morning because of flight issues. Even though we'd paid for the previous night and they wouldn't refund the money, our room wasn't ready for when we checked in. The pool area is pretty nice. The restaurant onsite is basically fast food, but not even good fast food. Location is okay, but still a $30 cab ride to the parks. There is a shuttle, but it was rarely on time.

Reviews.Title: “**nice clean hotel great area**”
Reviews.Author: tonycigars00
Reviews.Content: we stayed here a few nights this is a good hotel close to all the parks, we usually stay at the other radisson on us192 its property is a little nicer, but this hotel is a little newer and they offer sleep ## beds this was an added comfort and very nice, the pool is slightly small for this place although it is adequate and they do have a heated spa, staff was very nice but we could not get them to open the room safe for some reason they dodge the bullet on this cant figure out why, its a minor issue but it would of made things a little easier for us to secure our belongings, i recomend this hotel there are a lot good resturants right next store at the crossing mall you can walk there if you like, plenty of parking they do have a resturant in the hotel we just didnt get a chance to try it..

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare to Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: On arriving in Orlando from the UK, after travelling 23 hours as a party of 8 we found our original hotel had released our rooms ! The receptionist tried approx 15 hotels in the area and after about 30 minutes found the Radisson. Initially they could offer three rooms for 1 night only but eventually managed to accomodate us all for the week. The staff were all fantastic, rooms excellent as were all facilities. Not only did they save our holiday they made it. BRILLIANT !

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OttomanCitizen
Reviews.Content: Easy check in and out. Helpful staff. You feel the "welcome folks" continued at the hotel. The location is nice. There are couple restaurants around. You can drive to them. And it takes 20-25mins to airport-we learned that on the way to miss our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to all parks!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinHartland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter Weekend. Location is close to everything. Lovely pool area. Great value and nice modern hotel and rooms. Would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: adrianro10
Reviews.Content: We were there for three nights. They have a free shuttle to Disneyworld (to each park). The rooms were very nice and clean. There is a washing machines and dryers room that you can use whenever you want. Its located 15 minutes from Disney. Very recommended, you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!!”
Reviews.Author: NCSFrankfurt_Germany
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a place to start out at, because we found an incredibly cheap online deal. Unfortunately we only stayed those booked three nights and our hotel after this was a disaster. The Radisson is clean, in a super location for all attractions and the staff are super friendly! Well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: fumaca
Reviews.Content: Good location, great staff and rooms. You don´t need more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "off-property" Hotel near Disney!”
Reviews.Author: bflyjodi
Reviews.Content: We were well taken care of a the Radisson hotel. Room was large, clean, modern and in excellent shape. The beds were even sleep-number beds, just like home! Nicer room and better price than the value Disney hotel. Parking was free so getting to the WDW parks was quick & easy. We enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Stay.”
Reviews.Author: mcgruffs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Location is good right next to I-4. 5 minutes to Premium Outlets. Right in the Disneyworld area. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Some traffic noise if you are on the side of the hotel facing freeway. King Jacuzzi sweet is nice but not very large. Living area space is the same as a regular room with the jacuzzi in the main living area. Bathroom is somewhat small but has nice glass shower enclosure and modern fixtures.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!!”
Reviews.Author: gacia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for a week from Feb. 18th to Feb. 27th and we had a wonderful time! Room was cleaned everyday, always fresh towels. They have a lot of services available: car rental, shuttle bus to the amusement parks and outlets, fixed taxi service. They put freshly baked cookies at the front desk every couple of days and the ladies at the reception were really friendly :) There are plenty of nice restaurants around the hotel like Red Lobster, Johnny's hideaway. There's a mini-golf course which was really fun. There's a 24-hour supermarket also. Downtown Disney is a 20-minute walk from the hotel and the bus system is very affordable. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. If I go back to Disneyworld in a few years, I will definitely stay at this hotel. The only flaw is that it's right on the freeway but the hotel makes up for it by being a great hotel in all other aspects!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: JB17MC
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights. The room is very clean and the service in general was great. The staff was very accomodating and professional. The swimming pool and the tiki bar were certainly enjoyable. We took a cab to Epcot ($20 with tips), Animal Kingdowm ($25 with tips) and Magic Kingdowm ($28 with tips). There is a mall in a walking distance where you can eat at mlutiple restaurants and get some grocery/liquor from a supermarket. The Downtown Disney is a walking distance. The cab from the airport was $52 plus tips. We had some issue with their preferred transportation company but the hotel manager was extremely reasonable in solving the matter. If you are not going to stay on-site Disney hotels, this Radisson Buena Vista is definitely the one you should choose for the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Forcible entry attempted”
Reviews.Author: LittleLassie
Reviews.Content: My spouse,myself and two children stayed a total of 8 nights at this hotel. I had booked the room via Expedia, in two bookings, first 7 nights booked 2 months prior and an additional night booked 2 weeks before we arrived. Upon registering it was acknowledged that we would remain in the same room for both bookings. The room was on the small side but clean and functional. Getting in and out of the hotel parking lot was a nightmare. The poolside furniture has had it and needs repair or replacement, cushions ripped and worn. The remainder of the facility was fine. The tv had a channel devoted to warnings for the guests, one about persons pretending to be guests and slipping pizza order offers under your door (which happened to us several times) and using all the locks available on your door...which would turn out to be more important than we could imagine. Our stay was uneventful until our last night. Our last night about 11 pm, 3 of us had settled in bed and our daughter was showering, there was a fumbling at our door. There was the sound of someone sliding a room key but it was not accepted, gazing through the peephole on the door I saw a family standing there. I opened the door and told them that the room was occupied, they showed me their pass key with our room number on it, apologized and left. Thinking that was over, and mistakes happen, we settled back in. Within 5 minutes there was a tremendous beating on the door while at the same time someone using a master key attempting to forcibly enter our room and would have done so had the fold over bolt not been engaged. My husband jumped up and there was a man saying "housekeeping, checking if this room is occupied"...Really? Is this corporate policy to forcibly enter a room to see if it's occupied? You have a computer to check for occupancy, you have a phone,you can knock and wait for a response. We felt violated, our security and privacy was compromised. He left but we had already been shaken and upset. I called down to the desk and they had virtually nothing to say but "sorry". The next morning upon checkout I asked to speak to the manager who wasn't coming in for another 20 minutes. There were 2 desk clerks and while explaining what happened to us to one, the other one lamely says " I was here last night when it happened", and claiming a computer glitch... I left my info and later the manager called me while we were on the road, apologizing and at the same time explaining that since I had purchased my stay through Expedia that basically this hotel had no obligation to me and offered me a one night's free stay as a peace offering. This hotel needs corporate to evaluate their management and policies, this should not happen to guests regardless of how their stay was purchased. Would I stay here again NO would I recommend this hotel NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Nice Jaccuzi”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: We trusted the reviews on tripadvisor and were not dissapointed. Really clean rooms and well maintained. Free safe. Plenty of room for two in jacuzzi! Close to all major attractions. Staff very friendly. Internet good and two computers for use if no laptop/opod etc Only one downside was traffic noise from 535 major road outside. However, the pluses outweiged this and, having just spent three nights at Times square in New York the traffic was not really comparable. Would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem Find!”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: Having read the good reviews of this hotel on TripAdvisor, I decided to go ahead and book the hotel, and there were no regrets. Although the hotel exterior may require a little brushing up, its interior, particularly the room we were in was fabulous. 2 queen-sized sleep number beds, LCD TV, microwave, fridge with complimentary bottled water, it had all the works. We were pleasantly surprised by a Welcome Pack too! Our primary purpose to Orlando was to visit Walt Disney World and Universal Islands of Adventure. The hotel provided complimentary two-way shuttle buses to the theme parks (although it would have been more helpful if the timings were more frequent), but hey, it was free. Within walking distance was a good-sized 24-hours supermarket with everything you would need and lots of restaurants (especially the one we loved, Red Lobster!). The hotel lobby had complimentary desktops with internet for guests' use which came in really handy when checking in for our flights. Hotel staff were generally pleasant and helpful. For the shopaholics, the discount outlet was a short cab ride away. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and for the price we paid, it was definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, damn elevator noise lets it down!”
Reviews.Author: damiengibson
Reviews.Content: Great hotel easy to access by road from the airport. Parking lot was small but still did not struggle to get a vehicle. Check in was pain free and reasonably quick. There was a free shuttle service to the Disney World parks which was the main reason for our stay in Orlando. They had an information desk and we were talked into attending a time share brief in exchange for discounted tickets for Disney World which was worth it. Not far from Downtown Disney which was also pretty cool and there were plenty of restaurants in the area if you did not want to eat at the hotel (food was pretty plain to be honest). We were located a few rooms down from the only set of elevators and they were extremely noisy and were running at all hours. They did have a laundry room which was of use to us. The rooms were good with electric mattresses which lowered and raised at the touch of a button which was a good touch. Overall it was a good stay, but would stay else where the next time we come.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: pilotfxe
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Radisson Hotel-Lake Buena Vista. I was with my wife, and 9 year old son, and one extra room for some friends, also with a 9 year old. We got there late with two very tired kids! While we were checking in the staff offered some snacks to the kids, and gave us a nice kit filled with toiletries. The room was perfect, clean & quiet. I highly recommond this location, if not just for the nice rooms, but for the friendly staff. Great place to anyone with a family.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel conveniently located for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Jamesbrien
Reviews.Content: Some Radisson hotels are very cool with fantastic service and facilities, for example Berlin, Bucharest amd Dubai Media City and some are extremely poor e.g. Kiev. I've often thought this is where the group has taken over a property from another chain. Whilst Buena Vista isn't poor, it's not going to wow you either. I booked with points so I didn't have any idea of price. After checking I think the hotel does offer value for money. We stayed in a suite because we were travelling with a young daughter and the rooms could hold six as described. Be warned the suites are near the lifts, you can hear them from the room but they aren't too loud and it didn't bother us. The rooms were clean and fairly well appointed but the bathroom fell short of the usual Radisson decor. The rest of the hotel was very poor. I've never stayed at a hotel where I've had to take my luggage to my room using the bellboy trolleys myself. I don't know if this is temporary or permanent arrangement but over the 4 days the other guests had to do the same. The cleaners left cleaning cloths on the floor and refuse sacks in the bed?! I always eat breakfast in a hotel (at least once) but the lobby, bar and restaurant area looked so uninviting and free from guests that I didn't bother. The pool area was average and it didn't have a children's area. The gym was absolutely pitiful - a 2 metre by 3 metre room with a running machine and useless multi gym. Make sure you sort out your Disney tickets in advance if you want to save money. We didn't but there is a desk in the hotel. A word of warning though, these guys seem to work for Starwood as they pushed the time share (you can save approx $160 off the price of Disney tickets if you attend a morning session). They are completely transparent and I told them I wasn't interested because of time restraints but they still went on and on about it. Even worse buying tickets from them doesn't provide any advantage (cost or speed) over the gate as they sell you a vochure that you have to convert into tickets at the normal ticket queue. The hotel is extremely close to Downtown Disney but its surroundings leave a lot to be desired with a freeway on two sides and a retail park on the other two. Without question this hotel offers good value for money and they don't layer on the resort charges, parking etc that every other hotel in Florida does. The rooms are fine but the facilities and service are very poor. The location whilst convenient don't provide any opportunities to stroll as the surroundings are awful. If you want a cheap, clean crash pad to recover from the parks this is a good choice. If you want a little more from you surroundings you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel big rooms”
Reviews.Author: ByPast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a trip to Orlando. Hotel is well maintaned, clean and has nice big rooms. Right across the road from Disney and off the Freeway exit. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Had free wifi, free parking and a helpful front desk. The ticket seller gave us a voucher which we exchanged for a discount coupon book at the outlet mall. Made great savings. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A realy nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (Canadians) stayed here for three nights in mid March 2012. We were delighted with the facilities and with the helpful staff. Clean, modern, good restaurant for breakfast and (surprise !) a really nice laundry room. We needed the help of hotel staff several times and they went out of their way to assist us. The location right near the entrance to Disney World is great, once you figure out the somewhat dodgy entrance route. Would look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy From Beginning To End”
Reviews.Author: Tess W
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at this hotel from 3/18-3/22 we had excellent service from the moment we made our reservation by phone til we left your hotel...To start everyone was very courteous & made sure everything was ok on a daily basis. The lobby was nice & the the bathrooms in the lobby were very clean. The room was clean & well kept we were on the 2nd floor. We didn't have to deal with alot of noise & the housekeeping staff were very polite & courteous..The pool was not that big but we weren't there for that..We were able to go anywhere without having to go to far we had a great time..Thank you for the amazing service & to the courteous staff we will come again...The only down fall was that you have to deal with a little bit of traffic & didn't have left turn access you have go to the light & Uturn to get back in the hotel..Thank you again..Sincerely a Happy guest

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Eeroguy
Reviews.Content: What a location for a price like that. About 15 min drive to Disney parks. And Premium Outlet just a mile away. Friendly staff, clean room and quite new hotel. Pool nd hot tub were absolutely enough for us to take a dip after a long day in a park. There was plenty of free parking space. Room had a large fridge and excellent beds. Our room in 3rd floor was not noisy. We could hear people speaking in corridor, but no noises were heard from other rooms or the highway. Ok, wifi had it's glitches, but there were none extra fees in this hotel. 13 nights for less than 1000€ in this neighborhood - we really got more than we expected. Only complaint is about breakfast, which was a joke. 10,99 for a buffet that doesn't include juice..? If we plan a Disney vacation in future, this will definitely be our choise!

Reviews.Title: “EXELLENCE - Rated "11" out of "10".”
Reviews.Author: Kathi1
Reviews.Content: My husband Peter and I just returned from our second stay. We first stayed at his hotel in November 2011, and loved it so much, after seeing a great deal online, we went back in March 2012. And everything I said in my earlier review about this hotel being above and beyond all others is still true. The rooms are immaculate, pool is spotless, pool bar (Nathan V.) was fun and comfortable. And customer service is top notch. A special thanks to Charlene B, Front Desk Manager who is so personable and goes out of her way to accommodate her guests. She is wonderful. We also met the GM, Terry at the pool bar and he offered his services if needed. (The only need we have is to thank Charlene and Terry for another perfect stay!!!!!) Hotel is in a great location, close to lots & lots of restaurants and only a couple blocks from the Disney entrance. It also has a great restaurant and lobby bar with happy hour specials. The rooms are designed so well with everything at your fingertips, very well appointed and love the color of the rooms, the sleep number beds, flat screen TV’s, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, granite countertops and great air conditioning. We cannot wait to come back a third time.......and a 4th ......and a 5th ...etc. :) We will be back!!! Hopefully this November. See you then, Kathi & Peter B.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YLHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This amazing hotel provides - free wifi througout the whole hotel - free use of computers & printers with paper at the lobby - free simple breakfast at 5-6am, - free yummy chocolate chip cookies at night at the lobby - complimentary shuttle to disney parks, universal studio & even vineland avenue premium outlet which u can take a shuttle bus to legoland from there. i'll definitely stay at this hotel if i ever go orlando again

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay. Rooms are very nice. Very clean but a little noisy (not too disturbing). Try to get a room away from highway noise if possible. Good value, comfortable beds if you like sleep number (which I do). The shuttles to Disney were a good. They come every hour from 8:20 am until 12 noon, then have returns to the hotel from 5pm-11pm every hour in the evening. If you don't mind waiting 10-15 min. for the shuttles to come I would recommend using that instead of getting a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay - no complains!”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: The best option to have Disney, Universal or shopping in the Orlando area. Close to everything - and restaurants like Buffalo Wild Wings, Hooters and Red Lobster. Very good cheap gorgeous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: rkvalvaa
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel, last time in 2009 (found on tripadvisor). This time we stayed for 11 days in march 2012. We got a family room with a separate bedrom (for the kids). The location is perfect for an Orlando vacation, right outside Disney World and with a lot of nice restaurants and shopping possibilities nearby. What made us go back to the Radisson Lake Buena Vista was free parking, very good service and very nice rooms. The hotel is very well maintained and still looks brand new. The rooms are spacious and very clean. I have only two negative things to say about this property and that is that I have some issues with getting the sleep number beds to work for me (but finally found a setting that suited me), and that the elevators can be slow sometimes, but these are really minor drawbacks. Oh, and the value for money is great, especcially for stays more than 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “great location and suitable for all”
Reviews.Author: bigrossco
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location for all and is only across the road from the road entrance into Walt Disney! The hotel do provide a free shuttle service to Disney and to Universal Studios however this is a 'first come first serve' basis and can become very busy and you may need to stand! The hotel do have a good choice for breakfast at a reasonable price. For those who would like to eat out, there is a large number of restaurant's across from the hotel just a few minutes walk away including TGI Fridays! where you will get great service The hotel has got a swimming pool at the side. When you check into the hotel we were told there was a welcome pack for us however this is just a ploy to get you to buy park tickets from them and the welcome pack is actually just free samples of the likes of deodorant! The rooms are again of very good size and had 2 large double beds in them as well as a sofa and large tv (this was in the room we had) If you are driving around it is very easy to get around Orlando from the hotel as well with the i95 just across from the hotel! I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Week !!!”
Reviews.Author: juan t
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel again 2 weeks ago, and is the best cost effective option. Near parks, shopping centers near and the best restaurants around. Don't think, just book there....

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: F_Brz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RLBV for the first time in 2009 and it was our choice again in 2012 for our second Disney trip. Great value, friendly staff, great quality sleep, lots of space, clean rooms and comfortable "sleep-number" beds. It's located near disney parks and they also have a shuttle for those who choose not to rent a car. I made some online shopping and the packages were safely kept locked inside the manager's room. I had no problems picking them up and the staff was very helpful. If we decide to visit Orlando again, RLBV will be our first choice for the third time. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara637
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel, based on previous reviews, and we were not disappointed. We were very impressed with the cleanliness, friendliness of all staff, room size and decor (especially love the duvets, no bedspreads, yay!), delicious daily complimentary cookies, and very good restaurant. We did not rent a car, utilized the shuttle services to Disney and Outlet mall. There were also city bus and trolley options, which we used. However, even though we did not have a car, we don't think the U-turn on the highway, many people complained of, was that big of a deal. Some friends wintering in the area, picked us up for a day trip to the beach, they had no problem with access to the hotel. We had a room on the back side of the hotel, didn't hear anything, and I am a light sleeper. Not really a sleep number bed fan, which is the ONLY reason I didn't rate this hotel as excellent, but I know many people do love those beds. Bed types are just personal preference. We didn't find the salespeople at the ticket desk, overly pushy, the timeshare ones, were just trying to do their job. But we nicely stated, we weren't interested in those tickets, and the other salesperson helped us. For those wanting a good discount, it may be worth your time, to hear the pitch, we weren't interested in that part. She did her best to promote the idea, without being overly push. We really loved the restaurant dinner items, and the dinner rolls, were to die for. The brunch was so-so, but we mostly had breakfast at the fantastic Waffle House, right across the parking lot. My husband and I, split the All-Star breakfast, it was a great plenty and the pecan waffles, are fantastic. If you take the trolley, from the first outlet mall, to the one on International Drive, know there are many stops, can take nearly an hour. All in all, we would most definitely, stay at Radisson Orlando Buena Vista again, no doubt about it! Many thanks to all at the hotel, for a very enjoyable week. A special thank you to the front desk staff, ticket people, restaurant staff, and housekeeping for doing your jobs so well, it shows!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality---Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lchjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and were quite impressed. This is a new hotel in the Disney World area. Even though it's right off I-4, there was absolutely no road noise in our room. The lobby area is plush, and the rooms are very nice with the very comfortable Sleep Number beds, large flat screen TV, etc. Overall, the hotel atmosphere and rooms seem to be on a par with much pricier four-star Disney area hotels. Parking is free and right behind the hotel. All of the staff we dealt with were very friendly and positive in their attitude. There is no concierge per se, but the front desk staff were helpful in making dinner reservations for us. The restaurant is about what you'd expect in a hotel. There is a breakfast buffet which is just average, but breakfast ordered off the menu was very good. Other reviewers have noted the difficulty of getting out of the hotel heading south on 535 (there is no left turn from the hotel). However, if you don't want to dart across three lanes to get to the u-turn lane, all you have to do is drive a few hundred yards down to the first light at a shopping area, pull in there and use the light to get back out on 535 heading south. Don't go to the second light which leads into the Disney parks, as there is no u-turn allowed there. We highly recommend this hotel for a luxury feel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker22
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this hotel was the spacious room and convenience to Disney and other attractions. The extra sitting space and desk was really helpful for our our group of 4. The beds were comfortable and the updated bathroom and miniature kitchenette was great. The traffic patterns near the hotel are confusing at first, but we never had trouble getting to and from the hotel, especially after we started using the small shopping plaza next door to change directions via their traffic light. One downside was the tour bus full of teens / young adults staying at the hotel, but we rarely saw them except for in the elevator and by the pool. We never heard them at night. Overall, it was a great place for a family to sleep and recharge after days spent at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “OuTstanding”
Reviews.Author: terrydonilon
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great service. Well done. Very comfortable. Initially concerned we were too. Lose to the highway. But nota a problem at all. Well insulated from sound. If you want to be near Disney without being on Disney this is a great location. Plus there is a 24hr supermarket nearby. Pool was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at the Radisson.”
Reviews.Author: KKZim
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Radisson for our 6 night visit to Orlando. The hotel was very nice with updated furnishings. The location was very close to Disney and also next door to a plaza which had many chain restaurants and a grocery store. The room was a bit larger than typical hotel rooms, providing a nice seating area at the end of the room with a small couch that pulled out for a single bed. We are a family that does vacations economically, and I appreciated the larger refrigerator which could accommodate milk and orange juice containers. I was a bit concerned about the traffic and location of the hotel as others had mentioned, but we had no trouble at all...just used the next door plaza as a turning loop rather than attempting a u turn. All in all, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price !”
Reviews.Author: JVR2012
Reviews.Content: I got a room with 2 double beds and the location was great. I stayed with my 2 children (6 and 7) and the room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. What else can you ask for ? The fitness room was the only inconvenience (jazz music, 6 machines in a tiny room, no place to lay down and do abs). To summarize: Great !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Miamii
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and we all think this is the perfect Orlando hotel! The Location is great and really nice beds!! Close to everything but sometimes it can be hard getting out of the parkinglot cause of the traffic going to downtown Disney.. But the hotel is still great and we will return in about 5 weeks! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. As always.”
Reviews.Author: nangwynn
Reviews.Content: Immaculate, comfortable, beautiful, convenient. What more can I say. Have stayed several times, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Orlando theme park holiday”
Reviews.Author: hellojase
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff, and best of all - an excellent location right by the I4 so it is easy to get around by car as it is close to WDW, Universal and Downtown Disney, and the shopping centres are within easy reach as well. There are some good restaurants and a supermarket within walking distance. The outdoor pool / jacuzzi area is decent enough as well, (nothing special, but this was not a poolside holiday). We stayed in a family room for 4 people and it was fine - we had 2 large double beds and a sofa bed in the room, the beds had adjustable mattresses so you could change the firmness on each side. Free wifi, no extra daily rates/taxes that some hotels charge. All in all, it was great value and if we go back to Orland we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: Travelers_code
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a decent value, but the concierge was misleading. When we called to get information on passes to Disney, the concierge told us it would be $91.50 for two people. We thought this was a great price and went downstairs to purchase the tickets. When we told her we wanted to get the tickets at the price she quoted over the phone, she said we had to listen to a 90 minute presentation in order to get the deal. When we asked her why she didn't mention it on the phone, she said she was not allowed to do so. I don't appreciate dishonest sales people. As for the hotel and the staff, it was merely o.k. The cleanliness of the room was fine, but the shower was really loud and made a high pitched whining sound. The hotel is located directly off the highway...

Reviews.Title: “They should call them No Sleep number beds!”
Reviews.Author: MCO_Addict
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our recent trip to WDW. The hotel was surprisingly nice, service was good, pool area was nice. The location is good except that you can only pull in or out in one direction and then must do a u-turn to go the other way. However none of this was enough to make up for the worst sleep ever! They have these sleep number beds that are basically a fancy air matress. You add or remove air from a pocket in the matress to adjust the firmness so you are always rolling off the side or into the middle and anytime you want to increase the firmness it makes a sounds like a vacuum cleaner. If they got rid of those demon beds I would totally stay there again but otherwise I would have to ecommend a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Down”
Reviews.Author: Brett H
Reviews.Content: The Radisson finds in necessary to have high pressure time share sales people in the lobby of its hotel, labeled as its "customer service department". It is not the kind of experience I would expect when I am paying for my hotel. I did not sign up for a free weekend vacation at a time share to listen to these people and do not appreciate it when i am paying for my hotel. If you want to be left alone on your vacation I would not recommend this Radisson

Reviews.Title: “Great value & excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Sarsiom
Reviews.Content: We were originally only supposed to stay at the hotel for a week, but ended up extending our stay as we enjoyed our time there so much. From the moment we checked in, the reception staff were fantastic - they really couldn't do enough for us and were always so friendly and welcoming (Adriana in particular!) The more interaction we had with the rest of the hotel personnel, you could really see that the same positive, helpful approach was encouraged in everyone - a special mention to Luke in the Bar who make us some amazing cocktails and passed on some great tips about the local area! The rooms are a good size and have a fridge and microwave which is great when you want to reheat the boxed up remainder of the huge meals you just cant finish in one sitting! The room was cleaned really well every day - even when we left the room late. The sleep number beds took a bit of getting used to, but we found them fine. The internet in reception worked well (the best PC is on the right hand side!) and printing facilities are free .. again, another really good feature of this hotel. Wifi was great and could always be accessed in the room. There are fresh cookies availiable in reception every evening - I can highly recommend them ... we never made it to dessert when we were out for a meal, so this was a nice treat to end the evening. The swimming pool wasn't heated during our stay which would've been nice, but the hot tub was lovely to sit in and de-stress. The parks were easily accessible from the hotel (the entrance to Disney is literally a 10 minute walk away!) and there are plenty of restaurants (can recommend the Olive Garden, Ale House and Flippers Pizza!) and a good supermarket within walking distance. As mentioned by other reviews, access to the hotel could be improved as it's located on a 3 lane motorway and there is no slipway to enter the hotel from the other side of the road, so you do find yourself performing u-turns. This did not dampen our experience however and was just accepted as one of those things. The only other thing that would've made the experience complete would be if the hotel had spa facilities - a nice relaxing massage at the end of a long day at the parks would be great! From a UK traveller perspective, the car hire facility in the hotel is not a particularly attractive option as its really foccused on the American market (all kinds of insurance are added if you don't have an American licence) so we hired a car from Alamo which was located at the Palace hotel opposite Disney. All in all, a brilliant time was had and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenny S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days. I was looking for a hotel located near Disney World and Universal Studios since that was the purpose of my family's trip with free transportation to and from those two amusement parks. Room was very clean and beds comfy. Found the staff to be very knowledgeable and helpful. We were able to buy our Disney World and Universal Studios passes from them. The concierge called up a hotel taxi that took us to Orlando Premium Outlets at a very good flat rate. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. Waffle House is in the same parking lot (I don't recommend eating there more than three times though in three days though). Next door is a bunch of restaurants including Red Lobster, a very good Mexican restaurant, a family-run restaurant, McDonald's and Quiznos. The hotel is situated oddly at one side of the highway but since my group did not drive, it was not an issue. Instead we took advantage of the free shuttles. We were thoroughly impressed and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Top value and service”
Reviews.Author: Geordiejack
Reviews.Content: Once again TA contributors came good with well desrved positive feedback for this hotel leading to me booking it for our stay after much research - 4 nights early January with my wife. My request for a quiet room was met and the room size, quality of fit out were excellent for what we paid - ave £60 per night for our stay. Reception staff both charming and helpful - cleaning of rooms excellent - I spilled some red wine in our room one evening and although I got the worst of it out whwn I reported it to reception a housekeeper arrived later that day to do her magic with some cleaning solution which was finished off by machine and the stain gone - an impressive sign to me of staff "caring" about what they do. We like to have dinner out in the evenings ideally within walking distance so we can enjoy wine with our meal - the hotel is adjacent to Crossroads - a shopping mall with a number of restaurants/ diners which was ideal. Downtown is walking distance albeit around 20- 25 mins away. I managed to leave my jeans in a cupboard on checkout ! I emailed the hotel and Charlene (Front Office) promptly responded advising they were with housekeeping and arranged for them to be couriered back to our home address. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for great value good service, good location for the parks (we also used the shuttle service). Well done to all management and staff for such a well run operation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: FortnerA
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on trip advisor and called and booked my rooms on a group rate. I was put in touch with Angela, their director of sales. The process was very smooth and the staff and everyone was very helpful, courteous and we had a great stay. The only complaint we had was the wifi was a bit touchy, but they had a maintenance man there to fix it within minutes. The sleep number beds are totally ones personal opinion. Most did not like them in our group, I truly had no problem with them myself. They need to put in a median break, access is a bit tough when coming from the disney direction on 535. It is convenient to the Disney entrance and also easy walking distance to a lot of good restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Angela, Lady J, Illiana, Jorge and Front desk staff were all great, also Luker Duker at the Bar was great to us during our stay. Great experience overall, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no Internet for WIN7 PCs”
Reviews.Author: Mauricio G
Reviews.Content: I just checked out from this hotel (13 nights, Jan 12), it is a very nice hotel, the room staff are gently, clean rooms, well equipped, but Front desk staff has different atitudes one to another, when arrived the front desk lady couldnt found my reservation until I insisted (Im goldpoint member), I knew that a Fedex package has arrived to the hotel before I checked in, when I asked for the package the same lady screened a list and notified me that no package for me have arrived yet, then I insisted again and she could find it.. Maybe this is just for me but the hotel has on its beds a special system where you can inject air into your bed or you just can leave the air out, so you can adjust the stiffness for your comfort, for me this system didnt work, every day I woke up with a pain in my back. but again, it seems to be a nice feature and you may deal with. The second thing and for me it is a big issue, is the Internet connection, if you have an Apple computer you wont have any issue, but if you have WIN7 it will be almost impossible to connect, dont know why, but you cannot get to the login screen within your explorer, and once you make it after 5 or more tries the connection holds for just 10 minutes then it dropped by itself and you have to triy again to get the login screen, a technical guy came to our room and he told me that he have already contacted the service provider without answer, the Mng on duty told me and I REALLY appreciated her honestly, that they were having an issue with the internet and all the parts involved were blaiming each other about the issue but no solution so far, so If Internet is a must for you and you have WIN7, It is sad for me to say but you should choose another hotel, but if Internet is not a must I highly recommend this hotel,. anyway I think you may call them in advance to ask about this condition. sorry but english is not my mother language.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: JoyMD
Reviews.Content: My first time to stay in this chain. Arrived Thursday around 7-ish and check-in was a breeze. The rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. WiFi connection was very bad (at times, we needed to go to the lobby). The deal we had did not include breakfast. We tried the in house restaurant downstairs that offered breakfast buffet. 10 bucks per person inclusive of coffee and tea. Service here was not very good --server took around 10 minutes to take our order of the omelette (its made to order). They had a variety of cereals being offered but no milk outside on the buffet table.You have to ask the server for milk and then they will pour it on your bowl. I thought this was a very odd way of cost cutting. Seriously, is milk that expensive? So it was a good hotel, but dont eat at the restaurant downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “It's a really nice hotel........if you can get to it.”
Reviews.Author: G P
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I really liked this hotel. But reviewing this property is difficult because the property is good but the location and difficulty getting in and out of the place seriously affects your stay. I performed a couple of the hardest U Turns known to man just exiting and entering the Hotel. Its proximity to the freeway is great but sometimes being right on the exit makes it impossible to avoid unbelievable amounts of traffic. Seriously, if you think I am overdoing it on the traffic thing you should google earth the location and look for yourself. The price was good, the service was nice, breakfast was cheap and the shuttle would have worked if I was there for the Theme Parks. Please pick up and relocate and I will rate you a 5.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay, FREE SHUTTLE TO DISNEY & UNIVERSAL”
Reviews.Author: Visionspast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days to see Disney and Universal. The FREE SHUTTLE was such a huge bonus as we flew in and didn't plan on renting a car. The only thing that I must complain about is the wireless internet is terrible. While I was at the front desk notifying them, several other guests were complaining about the same issue. Their resolution was to have their maintenance guy come and reset the router which worked for a few hours. The router is located behind the television and by the second day I was unplugging and re plugging in the router myself to get it to work. Terribly obnoxious though. Other than that though...my stay was wonderful. The staff is GREAT! They really will do whatever it takes to make your stay as carefree as possible. The room was impeccably CLEAN. The hotel seems NEW. Not a fan of the sleep number beds, but I guess they were comfortable enough. The bar does take out breakfast sandwiches in the morning for $4 which was great right before getting on the shuttle to Disney or Universal. We didn't rent a car and missed the shuttle the first day so out cab to EPCOT was $35. Also, a cab to Downtown Disney was about $8. Definitely go with Platinum taxis because Mears takes FOREVER! Have the front desk call them and then they can just call your room when they arrive. We used eat24.com to get food from a local Thai place called Thai Thani which was very good. OVERALL a great stay, will definitely stay here again for my next Disney excursion. Definitely RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay Overall”
Reviews.Author: MaryJane18
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews of the staff, I have to say that I was a bit disappointed with check-in. The service I received at the front desk was minimal at best. I was asked for my various identification cards (ID, AAA, credit card), and was then presented my room keys. My request for a room not facing I-4 was honored. The young lady at the front desk did not mention anything about the onsite restaurant. I was not told about the wireless Internet, even though I was carrying a laptop case. I was unable to connect to the hotel's wireless Internet with my laptop. The hotel staff did provide me with an Ethernet cable, however. Our room was very clean. Bedding and towels were clean and adequate. However, the toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion) were not very good. I don't usually expect much from hotel/motel toiletries, but these were among the worst I have used. The size of the room was very comfortable. The bathroom was quite small, though. When closing the bathroom door, it just barely missed hitting the front of the toilet seat. The location of the hotel is close to Disney and Universal. There are plenty of dining choices nearby, some within walking distance. Overall, this hotel was a good value for this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for a Short Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: divegirl26
Reviews.Content: The other reviews pretty much sum this place up but I will put my quick two cents in….First, this was a quick weekend trip for my husband and I, and we didn’t book a hotel till the Monday before. Being a holiday weekend, we were having trouble finding good rates. I looked at several hotels online, and I had several criteria I wanted in a hotel 1) no resort fees 2) free parking 3) free shuttle to Disney 4) free breakfast 5) clean rooms with fairly updated décor (this can be very important in Orlando where many of the older area hotels feature Golden Girls style wicker furniture, flowered bedspreads that were purchased in 1990, and probably not washed since then either, and outdated bathrooms, carpet, etc). This hotel fit the bill for the lowest price. The only thing it didn’t offer was the free breakfast, but that was ok, it did have a microwave and fridge. Since we were just driving up from Miami, we brought our own food and just made breakfast in the room every morning. Even if you can’t bring your own food, there are tons of restaurants in the area, and even a Waffle House that is actually in the same parking lot as the hotel. The free shuttle actually goes to Disney about 3 times in the morning and comes back several times in the afternoon and it also goes to Universal and the shopping outlets once a day (the schedule is on the hotel’s website). The times can be limiting, so we actually had to drive to the park one day, but we took the shuttle the next day and it worked out fine. The only thing I would say that could make this limited shuttle better would be if they provided an earlier shuttle to Disney’s Tickets and Transportation Center. The earliest one goes at 9:50 from the hotel and you have to stop and pick up guests at another resort. By the time you get to the TTC and then take transportation to the park, you won’t be getting there till at least 10:30-11:00 and the parks open at 9:00. The only other complaint was that the free WiFi didn’t work in our room. It did work in the lobby, however, so maybe if you try getting a room closer to the lobby the WiFi may work. The customer service was very good, and the room was updated and clean and quiet. The size of the room was adequate for two people, maybe even four, but I would think it would be a little cramped to put more than that in there. We would definitely stay here again if visiting Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Good price,nice big clean rooms,well run,good nearby facilities”
Reviews.Author: allanm09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in very good condition; neat, tidy, clean; helpful staff, good room. I won't bother uploading any pictures because those currently (2012) provided by the owners are indeed a fair representation. Good spacious room on the 7th floor with an outlook over the adjacent shops and restaurants etc on the Crossroads development (mostly restaurants and bars (very wide choice of each), 24 hour Goodings supermarket, nicely landscaped, quiet and unobtrusive). Being to the side of the hotel, there was no road noise. Free wifi in the room, free shuttles to the walt disney atractions, two free to use pc's in the lobby with free internet access, free local calls, the list goes on. Staff were unfailingly helpful and pleasant - especially in the hotel's bar ! I think this hotel is a better choice than being on the disney resorts - which I think are rather isolated and self contained. It's more attractively priced, is minutes walk (walk !) from a range of good bars and restaurants (e.g. Johhny's hideaway (see separate review)) The hotel sits across the street from the start of the disney estate; It's about a 20 minute stroll to downtown disney (shops, bars, restaurants) from where you can catch a free bus to epcot, magic kingdom etc. The all you can eat breakfast buffet is pretty good (bacon, eggs, sausage links, toast, corned beef hash, fruits, cakes, etc with coffee) and very reasonably priced ($10 I seem to recall) although there is a much greater choice at the nearby Golden Corrall buffet on Vineland - less than 10 minutes walk away (for which I intend to write a review (but as an aside, we went there three times)).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RCMommy
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Those corners you are always worried to look at in hotel rooms were actually clean. Great housekeeping, we often saw a Supervisor checking over rooms and staff steam cleaning the carpets. Lobby was clean. Never ate at the restaraunt so we cannot comment. We thought the location was very convenient. Plenty of places to eat, grocery store nearby. Short drive to the parks and International Drive. Pool was too cool for us to use so we cannot comment but there were a few brave souls swimming. Our only issue was the internet connection. We never could connect any of our devices from our room. We notified the front desk and someone was sent to restart the router. Had no effect. If we did connect it was for a few seconds at most. Notified the desk a few days later that it still was not working and was told how strange because only one other person had said the same. Meanwhile, the lobby was fulll of people on phones, tablets and laptops. You could see people start checking their device as soon as they got off the elevator. There were a few tv stations that did not come in well either, so it seems to be some sort of connection problem somewhere. Otherwise a very pleasant stay and we would do so again!

Reviews.Title: “If I'm totally honest I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nairn1980
Reviews.Content: After reading really positive reviews I was expecting more from this hotel than it delivered! We normally stay at the Marriott village opposite but thought we would try out this hotel due to the reviews. On arriving I was offered a jacuzzi suite for an upgraded price. I accepted this offer not fully realising that as well as losing a whole double bed this also meant no bath tub in the bathroom and just a shower. As we were travelling with a baby a bath tub was needed and bathing a baby in a jacuzzi didn't prove to be that easy! The crib we had requested was great but finding a space for it was also a challenge due to the jacuzzi and the room being actually no larger than a standard room. The jacuzzi rooms I was told were at the front of the hotel and I should have took that as a warning because the noise from the motorway was very intrusive actually waking me during the night at times. As we had several cases and baby items and shopping etc we decided to bear the noise rather than have the hassle of switching rooms and re packing. The beds were adjustable but mine seemed to have a low battery and I would set it before going to sleep and woke up with it either as solid as a brick or so soft that I was lying on the floor. The combination of the bed and the noise all contributed to poor sleep. My final gripe was the supposed high speed internet. This would not connect several times and when it did connect I kept being kicked out every few minutes. I called reception who sent up the technical guy who commented that their Internet doesn't work very well with apple devices. I commented on leaving the hotel that with the iPad 2 and iPhone being the best sellers in their categories, the Internet not working well with apple was a serious flaw. Reception assured me that they were just having technical problems with the wifi. On the plus sides the hotel location is fantastic, it is very clean and well presented And staff were very helpful. I did not use the pool as I heard it was un heated so decided against using it. I have rated this hotel as good purely because the staff at the end of my stay were sympathetic when I mentioned my issues and did sincerely apologise and to me that goes a long way! It looks like we were just unlucky with our stay at this hotel as other people seem to rave about it but for us, sadly it failed to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: coxr
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Walt Disney Complex (not the parks themselves but once in the complex you can catch a bus), there is a set of shops around the corner incl a supermarket. Really nice rooms, large clean, comfy beds great value would defiantly stay here again and recommend it to others. Only issue with is with their shuttle to the parks-the last shuttle back leaves before the parks close so if you want to catch it you have to leave the fireworks or Fantasmic etc before they are finished to get back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value”
Reviews.Author: RIsparetire
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights second week of January. Great location for Disney with plenty of restaurants and a Winn-Dixie very close by. Very clean; first rate housekeeping really, and our stay was quiet as well. I reccommend the buffet breakfast in the hotel over the Waffle House and Perkins. Small in-room fridge (which was actually cold) and microwave. Our experience with the sleep number beds (we had two queens and tried them both) was interesting, teaching us that we don't want one, but they were comfortable enough. Front desk, housekeeping, and restaurant staff were unfailingly pleasant and eager to serve. Absolutely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom055
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights during Christmas. Having a family of 4 with 2 older teens the Radisson's room with 2 queen beds and a double pull out sofa made for a comfortable sleep for our family. The small fridge, microwave and coffee machine were also a plus. Being able to bring back left overs from Orlando restaurants and enjoying them the next morning for a quick breakfast was economical and easy to say the least. Pool was not heated, but who had time to swim when the parks were usually jammed by 11 am. By taking advantage of the late hours at the parks, we got to enjoy most of the rides. With the hotel being so close to Disney + Universal + SeaWorld, you could stay out late knowing your drive home would be very quick. Service was super, considering the busy holiday season. Front desk staff very courteous and helpful. Very clean rooms. We slept in one day and didn't leave our room until after 2pm. We came back @ 5pm to find our room cleaned and beds made - didn't expect that considering the late hours for cleaning service. Can't say enough about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, excellent location, and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: brandonknarr
Reviews.Content: I have driven by this hotel plenty of times over the years, and had stayed at many others in the area before. I happened upon this hotel through bidding on a bidding website. Many times, when you do this, you don't know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised with this one, and will ABSOLUTELY be a return customer. Here's why: 1. Amazing customer service, not only upon check-in, but for our entire stay. 2. Sleep Number beds! Yes they are THAT comfortable! 3. So clean. Orlando has LOTS of hotels, most of them aren't. 4. Great location if you are here for Disney. You might as well be on property. 5. Amenities - Microwave and fridge in every room. FREE Wi-Fi! 6. No parking charge!(Is it me, or is every hotel throwing in a parking charge of at least 10$ these days?) This was just an overall great stay and a pleasant surprise. I'm bummed I didn't discover this hotel sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: llamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights. The staff were friendly, room very clean & hotel located near to many eateries & restaurants (walking distance). The establishment provides complimentary shuttle to Universal Studio, Disney, and the premium outlet @ Vineland & LBV outlets. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good hotel that was reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: CookieCahill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a pit stop on our way in driving my snowbird parents to their Florida home. For the price is was not bad. I wish our room was a little quieter, the numbers bed is not anything to write home about. My husband and I thought we had set it at one number but after I tossed and turned from an uncomfortable night (the control was on his side) I found it set at 100. But even at the different settings it was just OK. The outer shower curtain needed a little freshening which to be honest I forgot to mention on checkout. They were so friendly I am sure they would have rectified if asked because the staff was so friendly and helpful. Outstanding actually. Also I prefer a bathroom that has the toilet separate from the sink and I prefer to blow dry my hair outside the bathroom and the desk mirror was set very very high so I could only see half of my head!!! But I tell you for the price, this was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Radisson Hotel Orlando, perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: george24mx
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Radisson Hotel, and It's amazing! I love orlando, it was our second time there, and because of our honeymoon, we wanted a different level hotel. After reviewing lots of hotels, we decided for this one. NO REGRETS, perfection is the word. the rooms are big, it's all new, lcd tv, comfortable sleep number beds and great customer service. it includes the shuttle to universal, and disney, but the premium service isn't great, rude personal, one time the driver didn't make the stop in our hotel and the manager gave us a free taxi ride from the premium service, and the driver was mad at us, rude, he was crossing the streets with red light and stuff like that. not the Radissons fault, but you better call for a yellow cab, it's cheaper ! The hotel have lots of amenities, free cookies on front desk, pool, FREE WI FI, bottles of water, etc. Also there is waffle house in front of the hotel, and applebees 3 blocks away. The rooms are clean, the employees are nice, the management is great, so don't think about it, this is a great option. One time we forgot our rings in the room, and we were worried about that, at the time we came back from universal, our rings were there. next day I let 5 dollars for that girl and she did not take the money, I had to write a note telling that the money was for her. So honest. If you need some help let me know, also we met a taxi driver who gave us great discounts. I got his number. Enjoy the Radisson like us!

Reviews.Title: “Beau bon pas cher”
Reviews.Author: Dominique M
Reviews.Content: Typique d'un hôtel. Bien situé, service de limousine pour le même prix qu'un taxi, près des restaurants. Le buffet déjeuner de l'hôtel est cependant dispendieux et n,avait pas de choix. Les chambres sont très grandes avec coin salon, les lits peuvent être ajustés selon ce que vous désirez (soft ou mou) mais je vous dirais que nous n'avons pas bien dormi la 1ere nuit, ne sachant pas à quoi le régler. Pour le service sur les attractions, par contre, ils ne nous ont pas conceillé, décevant

Reviews.Title: “Still fantastic”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay and still top class. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family or Business- Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina F
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were very warm and friendly. We were close to all Disney parks and we requested a special gift from Santa be placed in the room for my two kids. They went above and beyond to collect some great items based on their interests. The rooms were very clean and the beds were great! While we spent most of our time at the parks, however, my family would have been comfortable being at the hotel for an extended time as well. We will stay there again when we return!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: peteNorthants
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Orlando and were unsure of the best location to stay. We chose the Radisson Lake Buena Vista, it was perfect! Fantastic location, good spacious rooms with two queen size beds that had adjustable mattresses. A courtesy bus to all Disney, Universal parks and premium shopping outlets, wonderful restaurant and bar staff, excellent buffet breakfast for $11 including coffee. We couldn't have wished for a better place to stay! Thanks to the restaurant and bar staff who made our holiday extra special...Vijay, Luke, Eduardo, Alli, Melissa!! We didn't hire a car, once we came out of the airport we got a 'Mears' return shuttle which cost $68 for the two of us, the journey took about 35 mins as we stopped at another hotel before ours and coming back to the airport we stopped at 3 hotels, that wasn't a problem for us. There is also a retail park directly behind the hotel with several food outlets and a supermarket. Make sure you go to the premium outlets on the courtesy bus you'll get some fab bargains..Levis are $21+ tax a pair £75 for same ones in UK!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becky S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for an Orlando vacation. It's next to the entrance of Disneyworld and is so well located for restaurants around so you don't have to pay Disney prices for food at the end of the day. The shuttle busses run a lot but there are taxis that are reasonable should you accidentally miss one. There is also a free shuttle to Universal which a lot of the hotels don't do. The rooms are huge which is great for someone like me who like to spread my stuff around. We went for my partner's birthday and we had champagne in the room which they were more than happy to organise. The pool area is gorgeous and they're more than happy to bring food at lunch to you. It's usually quiet as well as most people with kids are at the parks. The gym is very small but it's always empty so you get free reign on what they do have to offer. I stayed at the Sheraton safari down the road a few years before which was perfectly pleasant but this was so much nicer and quieter. It's far more of a grown up hotel but they cater for children reasonably well. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “TOO MANY GOOD REVIEWS IS TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE!”
Reviews.Author: J H
Reviews.Content: I called this hotel's reservations center directly and made one reservation for two adults. One confirmation was submitted to my email address; and after finding a different hotel I preferred to stay at during my visit to Orlando, I canceled my reservation through the link attached to the inital confirmation in the appropriate time I was given to avoid any charges being made to my credit card; and I was issued an cancellation number. While driving on the Florida turnpike (from Michigan) the day following the arrival date I was initally supposed to have checked in, a female from this hotel called my cell phone inquiring if I was still arriving at their hotel (sounded pretty desperate to me for business). I informed the individual that I had canceled the reservation and had a cancellation number in my email account and I was driving on the highway and that I needed to remain focused since traffic was somewhat congested. Nevertheless, she goes on to inform me that they (the hotel) didn't have a cancellation for me. I once again informed her that she was calling my cell phone while I was driving on the highway; and she goes on to inquire if I could forward the cancellation to her email address. DUH? What part of I am driving on the highway didn't she understand? I then informed her that when I arrived to where I was going, I would print the cancellation and bring it to her. She then goes on to ask me if I were in the Orlando area? DUH AGAIN! How many times had I informed her that I was driving on the highway enroute to this area? Anyways, when I arrived to the beautiful resort I elected to stay in, I was extremely exhausted being that I was the only driver in my vehicle; so, I checked in, showered and went to sleep. The following day, I had a strict schedule to adhere to and was not able to take the canceled reservation to this hotel; so, I wait until the next day, open my email and OMG, I have an email from this hotel asking me to submit to a survey for a one night stay. Huh? Immediately, I decided to check my bank account and discovered this hotel had charged me for a one night stay subsequent to me informing their representative that I had canceled the reservation; so, here comes the good part. When I arrive at the hotel with my canceled reservation, I am told that I made two reservations? Huh? Whoever I initially spoke to when making the reservation obviously has a hearing problem because I informed the reservation agent that I was making one (1) reservation for two (2) adults. Why did she list on my reservation I had a party of four (4) adults? Then, the front desk tells me that I made the reservation online. I told the woman that I did not make the reservation online, I called directly into the hotel because had I made the reservation online, I would have made it through my Gold Points account and this reservation was not in my Gold Points account; and that she could open my account to verify it. Then, she tells me that I made two reservations under the same confirmation number. If this were true, then, when I canceled the one reservation, the other reservation should have canceled also. Hmm, this seems correct to me. Okay, I was seeing how desperate they were in thinking I was going to yield to allowing them to keep money from my account that they had already fraudulently charged me for; so, I stood my grounds with informing them that I did NOT make two reservations; and they stood there toying with their system until I pulled out my cell phone and called my bank in their presence. All of sudden, the IGNORANT front desk manager tells the billing representative to refund my money because they didn't want to continue dealing with the issue. This raised a concern with both me and the representative from my bank (who heard her) and I reported the matter to the FRAUD department at my bank because it was very obvious that this hotel doubles the reservation on people who cancels their reservation as a measure of charging the customer for at least one night when the customer decides not to stay at their hotel. They stood in my face and told so many LIES, it was both pathetic and unprofessional. Had I made the reservation online, why would I list my name as Mrs. when that is not my appropriate title? Why wouldn't the reservation be listed in my Gold Points account? Why would I make a reservation for four adults when I was only traveling with my daughter? Why wouldn't I choose the AAA rate opposed to their best available rate (which is always higher)? BE CAREFUL WHEN MAKING RESERVATIONS DIRECTLY WITH THIS HOTEL BECAUSE IF YOU CHOOSE TO CANCEL, TEN TIMES OUT OF TEN, YOU'RE GOING TO BE PENALIZED FOR DECIDING NOT TO STAY AT THEIR HOTEL WHEN THERE ARE OTHER HOTELS THAT ARE MORE QUALITATIVE THAN THEIRS!
