I'm sure the majority of all of these GOOD REVIEWS are made by hotel employees. Nothing is perfect; and I have come to discover that this hotel actually is pitiful! I would suggest to anyone to sustain your cancellation number because if you don't, it is their word against yours and ten times out of ten, you will not get your money back. Now, this is a primary example of how businesses seek to take advantage of consumers in these extreme economic times. How pathetic! I wouldn't suggest this hotel to no one, even if they paid me to do it! UNPROFESSIONAL EMPLOYEES EQUATE TO UNPROFESSIONAL BUSINESS...ATTEMPTED RIP OFF!

Reviews.Title: “First Choice When Staying in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: MBVLD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this location every time we visit Orlando. The location is perfect if you're going to be going to Disney. The prices are always way better than anywhere else close by and the hotel is much nicer than any other in the vicinity. The pool and hot tub area has complete privacy from the parking lot and road. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The rooms closest to the interstate are a little louder than I am used to but we live in a very rural area and are used to complete silence at night. However, the staff will always try to accommodate you if you request a room away from the highway, especially if you are a rewards member. If you live in a busy town or near a highway you won't even notice. The hotel is just a few traffic lights from the entrance to Disney and Hotel Plaza Blvd. There are plenty of outlets, shopping, and restaurants close by. A mini golf is also just down the road. Excellent place for a weekend getaway or for a week+ long vacation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: karrgal77
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Super clean and the room is a good size. As owners of a sleep number bed my family really appreciated having one during our vacation. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great location, close to everything. Will definately be returning. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in heart of Buena Vista - you won't be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: sd_fan92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem. We come to Orlando frequently, particularly to the theme park area, and we have stayed in literally dozens of hotels in this area. We will DEFINITELY be staying here again. It is not a large hotel, but it had the feel of a much more luxurious hotel than we were expecting once we were inside. The rooms were very well appointed, beds were extremely comfortable (sleep number), and the rooms were quite large for a standard 2 queen bed room. The lobby is very nice, the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “"Clean, spacious and great staff and service"”
Reviews.Author: gypsey55
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent to theme parks and lot's of nearby choices for dining. Rooms were spacious and we made use of the fridge and microwave. I am not a fan of sleep number beds, but they were comfortable and the bedding was nice. Had issue with remote for TV, but maintenance responded within 5 min of calling front desk. Rooms were quiet and the air-conditioner worked very well. Our room was very clean and maintained very well by the cleaning staff. Only ate at the dining room once in the evening and the food was hot and enjoyable. Marie gave us great service. The bar is small, but Luke made it very entertaining. The only downside to the hotel is that the outdoor pool is not heated...but the hot tub was great and the pool area nice. I would defiantly stay at this hotel again! . .

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed at many hotels in the area.... this is the best”
Reviews.Author: Martin R
Reviews.Content: First off, I am based in the UK and our annual family trip is always to Orlando. I think I can honestly say that we have stayed at most of the hotels in the Lake Buena Vista/Disney area. Being in the UK, I can only go by what I read online for choice and there has been many times when I turn up and feel a bit disappointed. I read some great reviews for this hotel, so this year, we went for the Radisson LBV. All I can say is this is prob one of the best hotels in this area of LBV/Disney. When you walk in you are greeted by a huge posh foyer and the staff behind the counter are very friendly and cant do enough for you. The rooms are large and spotless and those sleepnumber beds are great. From our room we could see the Disney entrance and the neighbouring Disney Hotels (which cost alot more and in my opinion, not as good as the Radisson). You have a choice of great food outlets and a large supermarket all within 5 mins walk on the same road. ( Steakhouses, Chinese, Fish, MCDonalds, Pizza Hut, Subway etc) so you are spoilt for choice at normal, not Disney, prices for food. This is the only hotel after years of visiting the area that we are def going to come back too. For the price, location, cleaniness, size and friendliness, this hotel cannot be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: diggy29
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located 5 minutes from Downtown Disney. Check in was a breeze. Lobby and public areas were spotless. Room had 2 double (sleep number) beds. The beds were comfortable....just hard to adjust the bed to the exact number you wanted....but thats a sleep number bed issue. Liked the option of changing firmness of the mattress. Bathroom was great...lots of counter space for mine, wifes and sons toiletry bags. Nice shelves under the sink for extra room. Shower had very strong pressure and hot water. Area had lots of restaurants within walking distance. Couch in rooms opens to a fold out bed. All in all...a great stay and we will be back for our annual Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the hotel room,however, housekeeping needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: peacemaker123
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel for 15nights in mid nov. We just came back from US -Orlando We had a superior room , the room is big ,clean and spacious. The free shuttle bus to disney and universe studio are great. this save us from renting a car as the parking in disney work and unvierse are expensive There are many nice restn , supermarket within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay at Radission . However, the only complain is that the hotel room has no thermal flask to boil water. we have to use the microwave to boil water instead. The housekeeping needs improvement too. During cleaning and packing of our room , they have thrown away a harry porter plastic cup which is lying on the cabinet!! My children are very disappointed is not becos the cup is expensive, just that this is a sourvnier that one can only buy it in universe the island of adventure, one cannot get it elsewhere Though the hotel management has responded to our complain, however, there isnt anything that they can do to bring back the cup.. The other incident is the fridge in our room. the house keeping person switched off the power of our fridge while we were away during the day, when we came back at night, our icecream in the fridge has melted.... the above incident was a downside despite the great stay in the hotel btw, the hotel management has offered to compensate us the cost of the cup and the ice-cream, however, Christine, (if I remembered correctly your name) pls note that the amount is small, and is not the money that we heartpain, is the way the housekeeping handle the stuff. Pls look into it so that other guest who visit your hotel will not suffer the same as us

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Very good rate.”
Reviews.Author: SM-Travellers
Reviews.Content: My wife, one of my daughters and I were lodged in this hotel during November. We have chosen a superior room that is nice and comfortable. It includes a microwave oven, a coffee maker and a 32” LCD. The room has 2 king beds very good for up to 4 people. The bad thing we perceived is, if you want to eat something in your room, you have not a table for that. There is only a nice and big work desk, not good for that purpose. The hotel has a big parking lot enough for all the cars, swimming pool (we have not used it), a nice lobby (with delicious cookies during the afternoon). Considering the quality and services of this hotel, the rate is excellent. A very important tip is the free shuttle to the parks. We have only used the one to Universal Studios. There is a time in the morning to go and a time at the closing hour to return. This hotel does not include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great price”
Reviews.Author: The3Harlands
Reviews.Content: After prepaying four nights at the radisson (at half the cost of the nearest competitor) I would like to share my experience. We were half a dozen moms spread out over equally many hotels and the Radisson was the cheapest and the cleanest of the lot. The nearest competitors all had paid parking, but the Radisson has free (and plentiful) parking! The room was bright and clean with two queen beds, sofabed, desk, flat screen tv and a desk. The bathroom had a granite floor and a granite sink surround and was lovely and bright. Lots and lots of towels and the water pressure in the shower was heavenly. The beds were sleep numbered and an extra treat. Pillows were so and so, but the quilt was nice. Five minutes from the Outlet mall (fantastic !) and very close to Universal and Disney. When you come from the airport and exit 4, the entrance to the hotel comes up on your right after about twenty yards so make sure you don't miss it. The restaurant was so-so, but you can order in from lots of different menus that are found in the room. Staff is nice and friendly and I will most certainly come back to the Radisson nex time I am in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with very reasonable prices for that location”
Reviews.Author: catapocalypse
Reviews.Content: Furnishings in room and facility very modern and well taken care of. I hope their cleaning staff get paid well. I stayed for 6 nights and room was spotless each night we returned. I typically don't rate places as 5 when breakfast is not free, but since they don't charge parking or resort fees and the prices were great for the location, I thought it was fair. We ate at the Waffle House next door most mornings. Location is great for Disney, you get on the freeway and it is the next exit. Free cookies in the evenings at the front desk are good. There is a bar with reasonable "happy hour" prices near the lobby. I was also able to pick up Disney tickets in the lobby the day we arrived. I think they have the option of getting a discount on the tickets if you listen to a time-share presentation, but I wasn't interested and there was no pressure to do so. They also helped me decide NOT to get the hopper option with my DIsney tickets which saved me $200. Can't think of any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “worthy of it's reviews”
Reviews.Author: M W
Reviews.Content: Pros: Classy, super clean, modern, a/c worked great, staff went above and beyond to give me what I asked for, in the middle of parks, restaurants, etc. Neutral: Sleep number beds, jury is still out, mine kept losing air., only entrance from 535 can be stressful during rush hours., i stayed on the back side and traffic noise was only an occasional semi or motorcycle, not bad at all Cons: No free breakfast? Verdict: A flagship hotel for its class, will stay here again, just make sure you get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and a traffic hassle!”
Reviews.Author: SallyKey
Reviews.Content: The spacious rooms here are quiet, clean, up-to-date, and a good value for the area. Located right near I4 and across from the intersection to Downtown Disney, the area is extremely congested. The hotel can only be accessed from one direction so expect to make u-turns often. The housekeeping staff had not cleaned our home when we returned at 4:30 one day, and though the room was cleaned immediately when I called the front desk, the matter could have been handled with more customer sensitivity. In contrast, the staff at the bar was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate and Close to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: hoosierdaddy12500
Reviews.Content: We chose the Radisson Hotel based on good TripAdvisor reviews and a very good room rate. The hotel is close to many restaurants and a short drive to all local attractions. The room was large, clean and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff, and a great price - 10/10”
Reviews.Author: hoathenfold
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for great value accommodation in a very well run establishment that is on Disney’s doorstep then look no further. This is the second time I have stayed at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista and I am very happy to say that it remains just as excellent as it was on my first visit. The rooms are spacious, well equipped and the housekeeping is very efficient. All of the staff are friendly and helpful, but special mention must go to Luke on the bar. Nothing is too much trouble for him and he turns just a simple little hotel bar into a great place to relax and unwind after a hard day at the attractions and makes his bar somewhere special to go of an evening. It truly is a very sociable place. Good job Luke, we look forward to seeing you again soon! As mentioned the Radisson LBV is right on top of Disney and we walked to the Downtown Disney area on a number of occasions – it takes just 15 mins. Great hotel, great location, great staff, and a great price. 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay- a few improvements would make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: mj316
Reviews.Content: I can't complain at all about the rooms at the Radisson. The sleep number beds are a nice novelty. The rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed. Although very close to the road, we did not experience any problems with noise (stayed on the fifth floor). However, there are a few drawbacks people should be aware of when thinking of booking here. First, the location is a considerable distance from the parks. Although marketed as being in WDW, it is outside. Of course this is both a blessing and a curse. Disney downtown is walkable, but get ready for a good 30 minute walk. The bigger issue is that the shuttle transport is lacking. The times are fixed and there is only one run each way each day. The times are not overly covenient- you will do well to catch it in the morning and evening without going well out of your way. The other flaw is that the hotel does not offer free breakfast. Buried in the fine print is the details for an 'earlybird' breakfast, but it is only available at an ungodly hour that most will not find convenient. At any rate, it is only a very basic breakfast. While I have spent some time in this review dwelling on the negatives, I should emphasise that there is a lot to like. I feel if the hotel could work to make the transport to WDW more responsive and convenient, and include breakfast in the room package then the Radisson would easily qualify for five stars.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: tbbarrowman
Reviews.Content: the best hotel i have ever stayed in and will be back again. breakfast lovely and we celebrated our wedding anniversary while here with a meal in the restaurant which was lovely the staff were great. the champagne in the bar after was perfect. would avoid the sales desk though .

Reviews.Title: “Woop Woop”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay here. It is in a great position to explore Orlando and the surrounding area. We did everything, from Disney to Cape Canaveral, and we can honestly say this was a great base from which to do it. The waffle house next door is a great place for a spot to eat, always buzzing with a nice atmosphere and great staff. Just down the road also there is a few chain like restaurants, a McDonalds and a supermarket which are pretty useful. The Esso opposite is very expensive (try to lure in tourists from Disney Resorts). The shell 100m futher down the road is much better value) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “When you thought you didn't have a friend in the Hotel Industry!!”
Reviews.Author: nhdeejay_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the newly renovated Radisson, Lake Buena Vista, Fl for 4 days 3 nights in Nov 2011. Got a great government rate, which included a free continental breakfast and gratuity in the newly renovated restaurant. Our room on the fifth floor was plush with ammenities often reserved for high end suites.Granite counter tops, high end appliances etc etc. The room was maintained immaculate and the grounds were well lit and landscaped. After forgetting my daily cookie at 3Pm I was offerd a double helping the next day. All shines at this newly reoldeled facility, with no resort fee's , no sales pressure, just a relaxing time and great service. Save your $$$ on lodging and use them on the rest of your Orlando tour. The only negative is the in and out to I-4, but a couple of U-turns you'll get it straight.

Reviews.Title: “TOP NOTCH - BEST OF THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Kathi1
Reviews.Content: Just flew home today to Boston and already miss the Radisson Lake Buena Vista Orlando hotel!! My husband and I just returned from a 7 day stay at the Radisson and absolutely loved it! We travel all over the country & Caribbean and stay at 5-star hotels and resorts and must say we are most impressed by this hotel. Their rooms are beautifully decorated and with many amenities including a large flat screen TV, a lovely sitting area /desk, a microwave, refrigerator and free coffee just to name a few. The rooms are kept meticulously clean as is the entire hotel. Air conditioning/ heat works really well. They have a nice pool, free internet in the lobby, and fresh baked chocolate chip cookies every afternoon…..what hotel does that!! The employees are so accommodating and personable. In fact, my husband and I were celebrating our 30th anniversary and when we entered our room there were balloons, a gift bag and anniversary card there to greet us. (A special “thank you” to Charlene M., Front Office Mgr.) The location is fantastic with numerous reasonably priced restaurants all within 2 miles of the hotel and the Disney entrance is across the street. IF 5 STAR RATINGS ARE THE HIGHEST THEN THIS PLACE SHOULD BE GIVEN 6 STARS BECAUSE THIS HOTEL IS IN A CLASS OF ITS OWN. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Charlene, we will see you next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: bgande
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location, the perfect accommodations and the perfect price. Check-in was fast and easy. The Front Desk staff are so accommodating, friendly and helpful. I would suggest bypassing the Sales Desk - and the sales pitch that they give. The room was very clean, had a microwave and a half size refrigerator. There was no "odd" smells that sometimes come with hotel rooms. The beds were sleep number beds which allowed us to create our own level of comfort. We were on the 6th floor, back side of the hotel and we did not hear any noise. No doors opening and closing, no freeway noise, just the occasional toilet and sometimes we could hear the elevator. There is a waffle house that shares the hotel driveway and a tiny expensive "supermarket" within walking distance of the hotel. However if you rent a car I would highly suggest you drive North on Apopka Vineland Rd about a mile to the Winn-Dixie or South on Apopka Vineland Rd about 3 miles to the Walmart. There is also a IHOP within a half mile of the hotel. I would not rely on the hotel shuttle to take you to and from the parks or Dwntn Disney as it has limited pickup and drop off time. I would highly suggest you rent a car, you will be so glad you did. Be sure and stop by the hotel lobby in the afternoon for some very yummy & fresh chocolate chip cookies.

Reviews.Title: “The employees, the convenience, the cleanliness-sure bet.”
Reviews.Author: nurseinknow
Reviews.Content: First impression-somewhat surprised that it is immediately off the exit on a very busy street sharing a parking lot with a souvenier shop. It really is smack dab in the middle of the city, not secluded, no spacious grounds if that is what you are looking for. But it is a short walk to lots of restaurants, breakfast places, and shops. Best impression-the staff. Extremely friendly despite extremely diverse clientele. You realize people come from all over the world to go to Disney and the same goes for this hotel. The bilingual staff is amazing to watch and they bend over backwards even when are room was not ready when we arrived. It has a comfortable lobby with access to beautiful bathrooms(when your teenage daughter is a bathroom lover and you need a back up). There is a restaurant off the lobby but honestly did not see anyone there-also a bar but that was not our seen. I cannot say anything but positive things about the hotel interior,extremely clean, comfortable and spacious 2 queen bed suites. Funny thing is all the pizza fliers when we arrived back at night under our doors.It really made us laugh.Refrigerator in the room. Hot tub and pool are comfortable but the pool chairs definitely could use updating. Again you will hear traffic noise at the pool but if you want quiet Disney is not where you will find it. Don't go to the adjacent grocery store complex. I never saw a more expensive, shady grocery store. Use a GPS to find a chain grocery store and you will be able to get what you need to stock the fridge for breakfast and adult beverages. I would definitely not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value ever”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoPAntunes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel for 5 days, in a family vacation. The rooms are big enough, so as the bathroom. The rooms were always clean, something I demand in every hotel I stay. The beds are good. We've eated the breakfast in the hotel restaurant, the waitresses we're very kind and fast. Just the juice could be included in the buffet, I guess. The location is excelent, near from many restaurants, market, shops and, why not... Disney. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Found scanning Trip Advisor --”
Reviews.Author: Jann2011
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel using a laptop and a satellite stick from the passenger seat of the rental. Well appointed hotel, clean, friendly staff and smells good!

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Livingthegoodlife1
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a short trip to Epcot for the Food and Wine Festival. Stayed two nights at the Radisson due to the great reviews from TripAdvisor and we were certainly not disappointed. Check-in was a breeze and everyone we encountered was very pleasant and personable. We did not opt to go to the Sales Desk and there was no pressure to do so. Lovely rooms, free wi-fi, choice of a very reasonable buffet breakfast or Waffle House across the parking lot, very convenient location. We took advantage of the awesome Happy Hour and Luke was a joy to talk with. Lots of good ideas and recommendations and extremely pleasant. We will definately return to the Radisson on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “I just keep going back!!”
Reviews.Author: neevyweevy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on 3 seperate occasions, my most recent stay was in October of this year and each time I have found it to be of a very high standard. The staff on the front desk have always been very welcoming and helpful when checking me in and out. The rooms are of a good size and very clean, as is the bathroom. The only issue I have ever had with the bathroom is the sink, it's designed in such a way that you can't help but get water everywhere when washing your hands or brushing your teeth!! The amenities in the room are good, the free wireless internet is fantastic. During my first stay in the hotel, the only problem i had was that they didn't offer self service laundry facilities, but on my recent stay i noticed that they have now got these facilities. The housekeeping staff are also very friendly and do a lovely job when cleaning the room, i had a lot of stuff spread throughout my room, some valuable items that i didn't put away and i never had any problems with anything going missing. The location of the hotel is perfect, it's right next door to Crossroads where there are plenty of restaurants and it's a very short drive to Disney World, the other theme parks and several malls. On my most recent stay i had a room overlooking Crossroads and discovered that I could see the Magic Kingdom fireworks which was a nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “New, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: madp01
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel with my family during a recent vacation: before this hotel we stayed in other hotels in Miami and Daytona Beach and the Radisson was defintely the best hotel of the trip. I can confirm that it's a new, fresh and beautifully furnished hotel. The room rate was convenient and there were no hidden "resort fees". Parking is free, and the room is equipped with a large LCD TV, microwave and fridge. The beds have individually adjustable mattresses (you can change the softness for each side of the bed using a remote control). The hotel is located very close to the Disneyworld entrance and to the Interstate 4, and this is both an advantage and a disadvantage, since, if you are driving to/from the hotel, you may get easily stuck in traffic going to or coming from Disneyworld, Pleasure Island and Downtown Disney. This happened to me at least twice during my stay. However, I don't recall hearing noises from the highway in our room. Orlando Premium Outlets is just across the highway (about one mile), while the Orange County Convention Center and SeaWorld Orlando are only 5 miles away. Universal Studios are located about 7 miles from the hotel. Unfortunately it's not possible to buy park tickets in the hotel (at least the Disney Parks): they sell only special packages and not "plain" tickets. We used room service on a couple of occasions (too tired to have dinner outside after a long day at the parks !) and my son particularly enjoyed the "5 cheese pizza", as well as the free Chocolate Chips Cookies at the reception desk. I would definitely use it again on my next stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Steve K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family in the 2 queen + sofa bed room. Decor was very fresh and modern. Everything was spotless, and room had everything we could desire including a HUGE fridge and microwave. Could not say enough positive about this place for a room big enough to sleep 5. Wife commented it was best hotel of our trip. Hotel was slightly hard to find initially (Google map was way off) but it's right next to the I-4 ramp before Crossroads. Would be a great hotel for someone wanting to visit Disney or just needing an overnight stay in Orlando. Incredible value for the rate we paid. Best value and best room of our cruise+universal trip.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: cosmony
Reviews.Content: So glad we read the reviews on trip advisor and chose this hotel. My husband and I stayed for 5 nights.The staff was always happy to help and kept things clean and running smoothly. They let us check in early, and we had a room on the second floor. Large room, no road noise, had frig, microwave, great coffee makers, what more could you want? Our coffee maker was broken, we stopped to let them know on our way out and there was a new one when we got back. The afternoon cookies were terrific. Pool area was clean, hot tub was nice and warm and plenty of towels are available. We took advantage of the shuttle to disney, took the early shuttle to animal kingdom and used the disney buses to get to epcot. We used the car rental agency inside the hotel. Everything went smoothly. Enjoyed an evening at the bar with a great bartender Luke, and had dinner in the restaurant. We both thought the food was very good. We did breafast sandwiches and coffee from the bar in the morning. After the first breakfast, we found we could split the egg cheese and turkey croissant because they were hugh. Plenty of other places to eat just a short walk from the hotel. Overall, the location was convenient, the staff great, sleep comfort beds were ok (I could take em or leave em), afternoon cookies wonderful and the free shuttles were a nice benefit. You can't go wrong for the money by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Vive78
Reviews.Content: We booked this room on a discount hotel site for a great price so I wasn't expecting a lot. I was so pleasantly supplied! Our room was beautiful - very clean & modern and very large. There were two queen size "Sleep #" beds (so great!) and a pull out couch. This was great because we were traveling as a family of 5. They gave us a great little welcome package with little necessities in it (from Altoids to a Shick Razor). Positives - great rooms, friendly service, very close to Disney! Downfalls - it's on a boulevard so being unfamiliar with the area it is hard to get to; the standard Orlando hotel sales pitch with the enticement of free tickets. No breakfast included and the breakfast buffet is pricey....but there is a Waffle House in the same parking lot that was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Close to theme parks and good value”
Reviews.Author: xangrace
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in the hotel whilst visiting Disney World. The staff on the desk were very helpful and our room was a good size for the three of us. We ate in the restaurant both evenings and also for breakfast and found the service to be very good. The negatives were there was no kettle in the room so we had to microwave hot water also there was no fresh milk for morning drinks just powdered creamer!!! When I called room service I was told that I would be charged for milk. The taxi to Epcot was £30 although this did include the £14 entrance fee to the park. Also the swimming pool wasn't heated so we decided not to take a swim. Overall it was good value for money and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great property in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: dsr1122
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and were very pleased. Despite being located at the intersection of the highway and a very busy state road, there was no traffic noise in our room. The beds were comfortable, and it was a bonus to have a fridge in the room. Given the location off I4, it's a very short drive to the Disney parks, and a bit longer to Universal (but only about 15 minutes total). We did not take advantage of the Waffle House across the parking lot (choosing to buy some breakfast food at a Target nearby), but it's there and open 24 hours for your waffle eating pleasure. I would steer clear of the people who try to sell tickets in the lobby, unless you're willing to sit through a timeshare presentation, the ticket prices are higher than if you just buy directly through the respective parks. They also had no clue about parking prices or park hours. There are tons of restaurants and shopping nearby. The one downside to this hotel, the advertised "free shuttle" service to the parks is abysmal. They have such limited times that it's just not worth it. You'll definitely need to drive to any of the theme parks (and unfortunately pay the parking fees).

Reviews.Title: “Business trip - Disney nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel: -Perfect location, across the street from downtown disney. -Manger and staff are first class, always trying to improve your stay. -Rates are great since they're just off Disney property. -Large clean rooms with sleep number beds. -Clean outdoor pool with comfy sun chairs. -Beside crossroads restaurant palaza (10 plus restaurants) -Good breakfast buffet. I stayed here on a 5 day business trip and was very surprised. You dont see too many hotels this good for this price. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous value!”
Reviews.Author: PhotogChic
Reviews.Content: Read many of the reviews on this hotel prior to booking and they were all great so we decided to book. For the price (which was very reasonable) we were very happy! Hotel was very clean and the property being non-smoking was a plus! They dont charge for parking & there was no resort fee. I would highly recommend this place to family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to go to Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: ItsmeJoie
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights on our visit to Disney World. Our two queens room was clean and spacious, the bathroom was very clean too, and by the way I just loved the bath soap they give there, I even took one home with me :))) Complementary parking and internet, refrigerator and microwave in the room, very friendly and helpful stuff - I can't say anything not good about this hotel. Before choosing it I read a lot of reviews, and I agree with some of them (the water splashes around the sink all the time badly, there is water on the floor in the bathroom, like something is wrong, but it's just because the curtain is too short, and water goes on the floor when taking a shower). But - you know - this is hotel, not your home! For me the main things are - it was clean, it was conviniently located, there was everything we needed there. Five stars! I would highly recommened to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Timbo302
Reviews.Content: No complaints at all. Close to local attractions and close to several places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy F
Reviews.Content: We always come to Florida for the daytona 500 in Feb and always stay at this hotel... We came this time in Oct to bring our daughter back home to Nova Scotia,Canada...she had been working for Disney World since last Oct and her term was up... we have been staying here for the past 4 years and enjoy it very much..its close to alot of restaurants that you can walk to.The rooms are hugh & very clean!!! nice pool... What else can i say ...we love it here!! Upon our arrival a couple weeks ago .. ...we were not in the front door 2 minutes when Luke & Eduardo ( work for the bar & restaurant) came right over and shook my husbands hand and gave me a hug..They remembered us!!! How nice is that The bar , restaurant & front desk staff here are AWESOME!! Actually the whole place and everyone who works here are AWESOME!! You will not be disappointed if you stay here So what are you waiting for!! Thanks again Radisson for a wonderful stay.We will be back in February!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend. Wonderful Experience.”
Reviews.Author: CeciC2011
Reviews.Content: I got married on Oct 8th and had all my guests stay at the Radisson. At first I was hesitant because I had never stayed there, but I was so happy to hear from my guests before I even got there that they loved it. The hotel is next to all kinds of restaurants & shops. The hotel lobby was very clean & modern. The customer service employees at the desk were very friendly and helpful. As for the rooms they were big, spacious, modern & clean. At night I even had the pleasure to hang out at the bar, enjoy happy hour & get a delicious meal. I REALLY recommend this hotel. You won't regret it. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: KevinBaltimore
Reviews.Content: This was a second trip to Disney for the wife and I. We wanted to stay off campus to take advantage of more affordable/diverse food and drink. This place fit the bill and we did it without renting a car. We were within ten minutes walking for resturants, shops and grocery stores. We would walk to the store for sandwiches and snacks to take to the park. After leaving the park(s) there are some decent places to eat and drink. Yes, Eat at the Sweet Tomato and the Ale house. Adjust the Sleep number beds, they really are comfortable. The little bar/cafe is a nice little place to unwind. Breakfast buffett was a good value. No Do not let anyone talk you into discounted Disney tickets in exchange for the time-share presentation breakfast. We did, breakfast was mini-donuts and 4oz coffee, and we ended missing the last shuttle to the park. All in all, we loved it and will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: MariaBerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 16th to 30th September and enjoyed every minute of our stay. The staff were all very helpful and nothing was a problem to them. We would like to say a big, big thank you to Luke the bar man who made our time at the hotel bar most enjoyable. Not only is he a well manner young man he took an interest in all the guests and was very helpful giving information and suggestions about the Orlando area. Would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: PSUNittanyLion
Reviews.Content: My and my recently married wife stayed at this hotel during a part of our honeymoon and our stay was absolutely amazing. Huge rooms, very clean, friendly staff, and a great loctaion to everything food, shopping, the highway and about 25 yards from teh main road to Disney! We tried the breakfast buffet in the restaurant and I was nevervous for a bit but it surpassed my low expectations! Food was really good and made to order pancakes, toast and eggs/omlettes were included in the 10.99 price. This is a really great hotel for the price. Whenever I'm in orlando and not staying in Disney property I will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS”
Reviews.Author: shafter1207
Reviews.Content: We recently mad our fifth visit to this hotel and found it to be an excellent value. Service is always great, and the rooms are always clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of a crazy town.”
Reviews.Author: Mavis44
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay to Orlando. In my opinion, Orlando is a crazy town and very hectic in an over the top tourist kind of way (We live in Florida and just wanted a quick getaway.), but this hotel made for a pleasant stay. Reasonable rates, and though the hotel is right off the interstate it was very and surprisingly quiet. We had a jacuzzi tub in our room, which was a nice touch. The hotel restaurant is overpriced. $7 for a meek piece of chocolate cake. The room is clean and nice. My only complaint is that I did not care for the Sleep Number bed at all, so I didn't really have a very comfy sleep. However, if we ever go back to Orlando (hopefully not any time soon) we would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all rounder”
Reviews.Author: boo1066
Reviews.Content: I always make use of Trip Advisor reviews when booking hotels and liked what I'd heard about this hotel, so we booked a weeks accommodation here Sept 2011 and I am so pleased I did as I wasnt disappointed. The hotel is well located just off the I-4 and about a mile from Downtown Disney, large car park all around the hotel and easy access off the main 535 that runs by the front entrance. I was a bit apprehensive as I'd seen some comments about road noise but I can honestly say I couldnt hear the roads from our room, which was at the rear of the building on the 8th floor. We were over looking the Crossroads retail park, which is beside the hotel and really convenient as we could walk in there to eat at either the excellent Perkins or Uno restaurants. We also ate in the hotel restaurant one evening as we were too tired to go out and this was great value. Rooms at the Radisson are excellent, bright and well decorated, spotlessly clean, plenty of space, two huge beds, a sitting area with sofa and desk, full size fridge and microwave and the essential coffee maker. The sleep number system on the beds is just perfect and the rooms have good quality pillows, not the hard foam things your head bounces off! Bathrooms are well appointed with room for all your toiletries and a good shower over the tub. Couldnt have asked for more for our trip, so much so that we have already booked another stay for a couple of nights when we are passing through Orlando this month! The pool area is secure, clean and well maintained, with pool towels supplied for guests and comfortable loungers, and there is also a small fitness centre which looked to have everything you would need if you wanted to work out during your stay. I was there to relax for my 40th birthday! I even made use of the guest laundry during the stay, which another bonus feature and great value, even the detergent was available to purchase at the reception desk. On our final day we werent due to leave until late afternoon and the hotel made a really reasonable charge for us to retain our room for late checkout. Flying back to the UK we really appreciated this as we didnt have to move all our luggage and try to keep it secure for hours. All in all I cant say enough good stuff about this place and I look forward to visiting again in a few weeks time. Thanks to all the Radission LBV team for providing a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: panatravel
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family mid September, we picked this hotel through Trip Advisor, our stay was extremely comfortable, very safe place and conveniently located at one of the main entrances to Disney World complex. The cleaning of the room was superb, I could not find a flaw in it. Beds are comfortable once you get a grip on how to adapt the hardness of it, I am recommending this hotel to friends and family, as their service versus price could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: KEGillesen
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed here with our kids aged 3 and 4 for a week in the beginning of October. Usually a quiet part of the year, but this was the weekend when Magic Kingdom celebrated their 40th anniversary, so the first weekend was a little busy after all. Hotel location is fantastic, in the middle of the Disney World. For our first day to the parks, we took a shuttle bus, that brought us to the parking at Magic Kingdom. For the rest of the week, we took our own car. Just a few minutes drive to Epcot, Typhoon Lagoon and all the fun, dining and entertainment at Downtown Disney. Within 5 minutes drive you find a large selection of convenient stores, restaurants, hotels and outlets. Hotel rooms are large, and ours # 816 on the top floor had a sofabed, an office chair and a writing table in addition to two queen beds. We lived here for a week, and never felt the room was too crowded. Bath was spacious and had a shower/bathtub. Cleaning was extremely good and daily turndown service the same. Breakfast was not included in room price, and we could choose from different menues. Selection was quite good and sufficient, so we did not get fed up even after a week. Service at front desk and restaurant was at all times very good, helpful, friendly and informative. A lobby bar offers refreshments. Hotel has an outdoor pool and hot tub on the ground floor with a pool bar. Not a lot of noise despite a lot of traffic just outside. A nice and clean fitness room is also located on ground floor. All in all a very satisfying stay, and we don't hesitate to recommende this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed the - comfy sleep number beds - clean, large room with a sitting area - pool and whirlpool - cookies in the afternoon - shuttle to and from Disney parks - helpful staff on the front desk and the Disney booking desk in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Family”
Reviews.Author: shannondt5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at this hotel for one week. The room was very comfortable, and we had penlty of room. The location was great. We will state here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: T D
Reviews.Content: AAA+++ and at a very good price. Large family suite with 2 large screen tv, plus free high speed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel, for 3 days after selecting it based on reviews on this site and can truly say that the majority of the reviews were on point as the hotel is very good and the location to Disney excellent. The hotel really provided me and my family with excellent service. Everything was clean and well presented and the resturant breakfast buffet (on special for $10.99) was very good. You can have breakfast for a cheaper cost at one of the offsite chain resturants, but truth be told the hotel's resturant was well worth the money based on the quality of the food and service provided. The front desk girls all provided superior customer service with a smile ...so big ups to them! As most people have stated getting out of the hotel can be sometimes difficult because the main road at certain times has high traffic volume,however, that downside is minute compared to all the other positive things to say about the hotel. I will certainly stay here again if i'm in Orlando and need to be in the Lake Buena Vista area. To the management and staff my closing comment is "Don't rest on your laurels, your business is competitive and what will keep customers coming year after year are reviews that talk to the positive service and amenities you provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Miamii
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and we all think this is the perfect Orlando hotel! The Location is great and really nice beds!! Close to everything but sometimes it can be hard getting out of the parkinglot cause of the traffic going to downtown Disney.. But the hotel is still great and we will return in about 5 weeks! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: rodriguezandrea86
Reviews.Content: The rooms are awesome. The staff is friendly. We had very good time here.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: dom l
Reviews.Content: Radisson was nice place to stay but nothing special. A lot of guests were on their way to Disney which made the atmosphere loud and frantic, full of screaming children and crying babies. It was not a peaceful night for a business man with a 6 am meeting. The couple in the room next to me was having a loud arguement which only ceased for a few moments at a time after I called the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Theresaj25
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 9 night stay in Lake Buena Vista based on reviews on Trip Advisor and great value for money it offered. This was our 3rd time in Orlando, we have previously stayed on Hotel Plaza BLVD but this hotel offered much better value for money. From the moment we checked intothe hotel everything was faultless. The room was a great size with a fridge and microwave in the room. The bathroom was a bit small but more than adequate for our needs and everything was spottlessly clean. The air conditioning in the room is great and works very well, we had a room overlooking the crossroads restaurants area and so had no problem with the noise from the highway, The room had free internet which was easy to use and a good speed, free parking and no resort fees. There was a bar and restaurant at the hotel which looked nice but we did not use as lots of restaurants right next door to the hotel and Downtown Disney can also be reached in 25 mins walk or 5 mins by car. The parks are all easily accessable from the hotel, as other reviews have commented you do need to do a u turn when returning to the hotel from the other side of the road but this didn't cause us any problems at all. There is a nice pool area with plenty of towels and sunbeds available and they have done a very nice job of secluding the area so you feel like you are not on the main road. There is also a small gym area which looked nice but we never used. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and proffessional. Overall I would recommend this hotel for a stay in Orlando, it offers excellent value for money and is very clean with friendly staff. We will be staying here again on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: miltonwar
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very clean! Has free parking and has a pool. Also has a small gym, but instead of use the gym, I made a 3 minute drive to downtown disney, and run over there. I went with my two year old daughter. She enjoyed the parks and everything, and the relax time at the pool before dinner. It also has coin machine wash and dryer at a convenient price. The hotel its located near everything! We made a trip to Tampa and st. Pete one day and to Daytona other day. The 4 highway is two minutes from the hotel. The service staff was very helpful and even when the check-out was at 1, for just 25 you can extend you check out if you have late flight as we did. If I travel again to Orlando, without any doubt this will be the place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and location, lovely large rooms and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: laurapinkney01
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, rooms are large and spacious with all mod cons including microwave, fridge, hair dryer and coffee machine. Lovely bar downstairs with long happy hours and also Disney tickets booth, gym and pool. Room wonderfully cleaned everyday and hotel is only one mile from Downtown, 10mins to Magic Kingdom and 15mins to Universal. This hotel topped off a wonderful holiday for us and can't wait to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Best cost x benefit in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Rmontale
Reviews.Content: Following the good reviews about Radisson Lake Buena Vista here, I decided to give it a try. I can't be more happy with my decision. You can't find a better Hotel in Orlando for the price. It really has the best cost x benefit, even more considering that Orlando is so packed with attractions that you'll probably only be in your room to take a shower and sleep. The room is very clean (the housekeeping service was amazing - props to Rosia), the air conditioning works very well and all the staff was nice and polite. The room is equipped with a microwave, a little fridge and beds with the "Sleep Number" system (give it a try. It's great). Oh, they also have free (and fast) WiFi in all rooms. Also, they don't charge a fee for delivering packages, which was essential to me (I have received about 15 packages from Amazon). The location is great: It has lots of restaurants nearby and it's a few miles away from Downtown Disney and the Premium Outlet. You also have easy access to I4 (Tampa) and other roads. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Russco2000
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for it's location and it's price. We pre-paid and got a great deal and was looking forward to staying at the hotel because of the amenities. We were greeted by some very helpful and polite staff and were swiftly checked in. We were pleased with the room and the size and I have to admit the my wife and I enjoyed having 2 queen beds so much that we actually took one each! Unfortunately the down side of the rooms were the Sleep Number beds. We could not get them into comfortable positions and when you get the one side working, the other side wasn't. I would much rather had a normal comfortable bed. Apart from that the room was spacious and well supplied with a fridge, microwave and good sized tv. The free wifi was also very much appreciated, fast speed too :) The location is perfect, short drive to the Disney parks and you're right on the doorstep of some good food. We rented a car from the car rental place that has an office in the hotel lobby. It's important to point out that they are not associated with the hotel, which is good, because the rental company were very unprofessional and totally unorganised. They messed us about when we returned the car and charged us more for something that they already said we wouldn't be. Upsetting end to an otherwise great holiday and a wonderful stay at the hotel. The only downside of the hotel was the housekeeping. We would leave our hotel all day, come back mid-afternoon at the hottest point of the day, and then we would get a knock on the door (even when we had a do not disturb time on the door) and would be asked if they could clean our room. I would still definitely recommend this hotel to others though. Good price, good location. Enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay - Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Pauline009
Reviews.Content: Only stayed overnight on our way to the Gulf but would definitely recommend this hotel. We booked bed and breakfast (which was fantastic) - eggs etc cooked to order so they were hot and fresh and the banana/pecan pancakes were delicious! Sleep Number Beds were a great success but we did not get an early night because we were playing with the different settings! Exiting the car park into the very very busy traffic was a bit difficult but we were not disturbed at night by the traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Neil W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time in Sept 2011 & were extremely happy with our selection. We took the advice of other Trip Advisors to make this selection. The staff were extremely obliging even before we arrived by providing us with essential transport information for our trip from the airport after a long journey from Australia. Platinum Transport was there waiting for us at the baggage claim & wasn't that reassuring for 2 weary travellers who arrived into Orlando after 30+ hours in the air. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by 2 delightful receptionists who had us checked in & heading for our room in no time. When we arrived in our room we had another pleasant experience walking into a fresh, clean, neat, well laid out & spacious room, rating 5 star quality. We made good use of all in-room services including in-room safe, free wireless internet, free local calls, an extensive TV channel selection & superb bathroom amenities. It was our first experience with Sleep Number beds & we soon snuggled into a peaceful nights sleep once we got our number right. We dined in the restaurant almost every day & experienced breakfast & dinner. The food was exceptional & very affordable. There was not one staff member that we came across in our entire stay of 5 nights that we could fault. They all say hello to you whatever time of day it is & ask how your day is going. This included the GM who was happy to stay & chat with us. The overall quality of the hotel was in sensational condition including the foyer, lifts, corridors, restaurant & outdoor areas. Well done Radisson Lake Beuna Vista. We can't wait to come back & will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Surprise - nice”
Reviews.Author: OrangePeach
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for business and this hotel was a great pick. The rooms were new and clean and the internet was wicked fast. The location was perfect as I was doing business with those in the travel/tour/restaurant biz. The size of the hotel was nice, not too big, not too small. No gift shop so pack what you need.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to B in Orlando!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NADDOOOOM
Reviews.Content: A very friendly staff and fast check in will take you to a spacious room with the best bed I have ever tried in a hotel with (My sleep number Option) so you will adjust the mattress as you like !!! Very clean property with a complementary coffee with snack bars at morning and free cookies on the help desk for the rest of the day. Free wireless with free internet ..... a free shuttle to them parks every day. Location is next to to a huge plaza were all the restaurants and shops are there !! Everything makes this Hotel the best Place to be when visiting Orlando. I will be back here sooon !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great staff, Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: What more would you ask for? Great large clean rooms, Great staff. If you want a friendly hotel ( I felt like I was home). Close to all the parks and food. One of our best place we ever went to. We can't wait to go back!!!!! I rate this A+++++ Plus!!

Reviews.Title: “I love it :)”
Reviews.Author: luminousss
Reviews.Content: spacious rooms, clean, close to Disney and provides a shuttle, super friendly stuff, cheap laundry room,and this hotel gives cookies for free :))))

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean hotel...we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: msanniota
Reviews.Content: The family guest room was huge....2 queen beds in the first room with all the ammenities - plus internet connection and a desk and sitting area and then the next bedroom with a king bed and door to the room. The price was absolutely a deal...couldn't be better! The staff were wonderful, the toiletries were in abundance...we couldn't have asked for more for the price and size of the room that we got.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal and we can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: suzie b
Reviews.Content: The room was bigger and better than expected. Housekeeping staff and supervision were the best we've ever experienced anywhere. The manager took personal attention to all his guests. It felt like a little boutique hotel in a big city. It was pure pleasure. The Platinum Transportation services connecting to Disney transportation and the parks were excellent and very reliable. The front desk, from the time we booked the hotel two weeks before getting there, until the day we checked out could not have been more helpful and courteous. The Radisson at Lake Buena Vista is our Disney and Universal home away from home in the future. Check it out, you'll be happy you did!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...and no resort fees”
Reviews.Author: areyesrn
Reviews.Content: yeah, seriously. No Resort Fees. I had narrowed down my two affordable choices or Tripadvisor's top 10 in Orlando to The Point Orlando and this Radisson. I chose the Radisson because The Point Orlando had a ridiculous resort fee ($11+/night)... more than other "resorts." Driving in from Philly, we checked in early at 2pm on 8/22/11. We were given room 815. Check-in was painless. Staff was WONDERFUL.. Free chocolate chip cookies at the desk. We had a room with 2 queen beds. Room size was fine. So was the Chimei HD Television...BUT there's only like 4 HD Chennels. The other 40+ channels are standard def, and if you've ever attempted to watch a standard def program on a hi-def screen, you know how unwatchable it is. Anyway, the 4 hi-def channels looked AMAZING on the monitor.. The Sleep Number beds were nice, as well. We all put the mattress down to the lowest number for maximum comfort. Housekeeping is awesome. Esmeralda is awesome. They respected our Do Not Disturb sign...we just had to initial their clipboard when you see them in the hallway in the morning. Internet is excellent. you have Ethernet in your room (just bring your own ethernet cable) and STRONG wi-fi throughout the hotel. No complaints...if you log on with your cell phone, you'll have to keep going through their log-on page and your phone gets disconnected when it powers down, so you won't get all your push-emails and notifications until you re-connect using your phone's browser. Location is pretty perfect. there's a strip mall next to the hotel with a Bank Of America ATM and a 24 hour supermarket called Gooding's, among other (like 6!!!) restaurants. Beware of buying discount tickets in the lobby. I attempted to do this on 8/23/11 in the morning. You can only get a discount if you attend their 90 minute timeshare sales pitch. I told them I'd do it if I was there for like 2 weeks, but I was only there for a couple of days. They must be giving the chick a great commision, because even after I lied and said I was only there for a day, she STILL tried to get me to go to the 90 minute timeshare sale pitch. LOL. If she was cool and said, "you know, enjoy Disney for the day you're here...don't waste half your day on this," I WOULD HAVE attended the timeshare presentation. But chica was only thinking about her commision and not the hotel guests best interests...which I undestand, I guess. I did make a rookie mistake. The hotel has several warnings telling you NOT to order from the pizza menus that people slip under the door. However, I ordered anyway. I ordered from this pizza place and there was no address on the menu (even though they said they're available for dine-in...LOL!!!) and a Google search turned up nothing. So please, this is for anyone staying in Orlando, DO NOT ORDER FROM THE PIZZA MENUS SLIPPED UNDER YOUR DOOR.. We had to check out early the evening (5:30pm) of 8/24/11 because of the NONSTOP warnings about Hurricane Irene on television every 10 minutes. I was hoping they'd give me some sort of deal especially since I told them earlier that morning that I would be checking out at 5:30pm...like some sort of nominal penalty fee that added up to only half of the room or something, but they still made me pay for the entire night. They porbably still were able to rent the room out to latecomers who came to check in after 7pm. I completely understood why, but was still looking for another deal. :-D All in all, I'm going to make sure I come back to the Radisson next time I'm in Orlando. Its top 10 spot in Traveladvisor's list of Orlando hotels is WELL deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it (twice already) and have multiple reservations already booked to return!”
Reviews.Author: M00nfrog68
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our 2nd stay at the Radisson LBV and continue to love it! We stayed with friends in July (a visit which we never got around to reviewing) and then again just as our family this past Labor Day weekend. We already have this hotel booked for stays in October, November and December. And once we decide on firm dates for 2012, we will start booking stays when we plan to visit next year. We are out of state Disney Annual Passholders; and the Radisson LBV is our hotel of choice when coming to Orlando to visit the Disney theme parks. The location is very convenient to all the Disney Parks as well as as Downtown Disney. We used to stay on property at a Disney moderate hotel. But after finding this hotel, we stay here instead of on Disney property. In our opinion, this hotel is nicer, the rooms cleaner and larger, and a better price value. The rooms are very clean. Housekeeping is thorough. The housekeeper even made some towel animals for my children one day this last visit. The room furnishings are nice and everything was in working order. The bed linens were crisp and clean. The fold out sofa bed was made up prior to our arrival as well so it was nice not to have to struggle to make that up -- especially since we arrived after midnight our first night! I do have to agree with a previous review though about the pillows needing to be a little better. On our first visit it was hard getting used to the sleep number beds but now that we have figured out our numbers, they sleep good. The room also has a desk with ergo chair if you need to work. My son loved using the desk to put together the Lego set he purchased at the Lego store at Downtown Disney. There is also a counter top / cabinet area that contains a refrigerator, coffee maker and an overhead microwave. The refrigerator seemed to cool better and was larger than most in other hotels we have stayed in. The bathroom was very clean and supplied with ample soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and mouth wash. The towels were very white and clean. The shower curtain and liner were both very clean and hung on a curved rod to make the shower seem roomier. The TV was in excellent working order and had a very clear picture. It is a wall-mounted flat screen so it doesn't take up extra space on the dresser. We had no problems with the wi-fi working in comparison with some of the previous reviews. The hotel and its rooms are quiet. I've stayed in other hotels where the halls were noisy and you could hear the folks next door - this is not the case here. Some other reviews mention that they have heard noise from streets from outside the hotel. We have never had this issue. We didn't visit the pool or hot tub this visit. However, in July we did and both were clean and towels were furnished. It is a good-sized kidney-shaped pool. If your children are looking for water slides and such, you won't find that here. It's just a basic but clean pool and pool area. We stay at the parks from open to close usually so that is not an issue for us. There was a pool bar as well but when we visited the pool in July, it was late at night so it wasn't open. No biggie for us though -- bc we usually don't use pool bars anyway. The chairs around the pool are very nice with padded cushions. The folks working at the Radisson LBV are also super nice - from the check-in and in-house reservation folks to the bellmen and housekeepers. It seems to me that most folks there seem to want to do a good job and it shows. Everyone we have ever spoken with or have had contact with at the Radisson LBV has been courteous and customer service oriented. There are also numerous restaurants - both fast food and table service - that are convenient to the hotel. If you want to pick up a quick breakfast on your way to the park, you have several drive-thru options and all very close to the hotel. There are also a wide variety of table service restaurants in close proximity. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant so we cannot speak to its food or service. Many of the the restaurants are within walking distance as well if you don't want to get your car out. The only possible negative we see to this hotel is the traffic congestion in the area. With the hotel being situated near I-4, close to Downtown Disney, and as well as on 535 - a major thoroughfare, you WILL encounter traffic and congestion especially during the peak hours. We just took that into consideration when coming and going. The traffic seemed worse in July than this past weekend -- which would make sense though since summer is a more peak tourism time. Another traffic concern relates to 535 being a busy road and having are with a median, so you can only turn right out of the hotel when exiting it so you have to go and make a u-turn to get back to I-4. As well, if you are coming back from Downtown Disney, you have to go past the hotel, make a u-turn and come back to it. None of these are big issues for us but it is something to be considered. If you are in a hurry to get somewhere then you will need to leave extra time to accommodate for the traffic, congestion and road layout depending on which way you are headed coming and going. In close, the Radisson LBV is WONDERFUL! I would and have recommended it to my friends. I am VERY picky about the hotels my family and I stay in. But I have no hesitation with this hotel at all! Can't wait to be back at the Radisson LBV when we visit the House of the Mouse again!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: khurramb
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our incredible disney vacations and we are so glad that we stayed at the Radisson. Best part was it is in downtown disney area and close to every park in the disney and has crossroads (shopping area) behind it. Not to mention the free shuttle service to all the parks. The rooms were very clean and had sleep number bed, microwave and a mini fridge. The service was very good and a very good buffet breakfast too. Kids loved the pool and spa did the trick for me. Definitely going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel of our trip. Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: NK_D_Calg
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, clean, efficient, nice room, great beds. Very good proximity to theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Gravesender
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is very convenient and centralize. All major theme parks are minutes away. Staffs were nice and rooms are quite clean. Mini-fridge and microwave. Number beds, swimming pool, spa and gym. I found hot water to be very adequate which is definitely a plus. Cons: Wi-Fi did not worked at all in my room, front desk provided a cable for internet access. Even though the bathroom seemed fairly new, the shower tiles looked like a patch job. Overall, the whole family enjoyed our stay and will consider staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: JusTiff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so beautiful and reasonably priced! I have stayed there 3 times already and will keep going back whenever I'm in town. The rooms and bathrooms are always clean and not to mention they have comfortable sleep number beds! There is a restaurant/bar right in the hotel lobby if you just want to stay in and relax, but if you do want to go out you have tons of local restaurants to choose from. Also, the hotel is close by to different attractions and outlet malls, which is convenient for tourist! (A shuttle will come and pick you up if you request it at the front desk.) Lastly, the staff is extremely nice and welcoming so you feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel but disappointed by the staff.”
Reviews.Author: mom2threestooges
Reviews.Content: I took my three kids to Orlando and wanted to stay at a Radisson because of the great reputation they have and the many good stays we have had at other Radisson hotels. I initially chose another Radisson in Orlando, but changed my reservation when I found out they allowed smoking. I chose this hotel because the reservation agent assured me it was a non-smoking property, which is important to me as 1. I don't smoke and 2. I had my asthmatic son with me. Well, upon check-in, I realized that I had been lied to. There were people smoking all around the outdoor pool and at the only TWO entrances into the hotel. I went to the front desk and inquired as to why there was smoking allowed when this was supposed to be a non-smoking property. I was informed that this only means that there is no smoking allowed inside the building. I asked how I was supposed to bring my kids in and out of the hotel when the doors were the allowed smoking areas and not only did they have no answer for me, they were quite rude about the answer and did not seem the slightest bit concerned. We ended up staying the entire time there as I was not going to disrupt our plans to have to search for a new hotel. We even added on a night due to the extreme weather disrupting my plans to leave and when I went to add a night on, I encountered nothing but trouble. They wouldn't even honor the room rate I had locked in and I was charged almost DOUBLE for that last night. The hotel itself was clean, the rooms well laid out and the pool and outdoor hot tub were fine, but there is no way I would stay here again with all of the other hotels in the area available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maxime G
Reviews.Content: We stayed there while making the most of Orlando : Disney, Universal, Wet'n Wild. The hotel was at the perfect place to visit all these places, about 10 min away to each place. The room where huge, nice and clean. The breakfast was really nice as well with plenty of choices. I recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if you take your own pillow”
Reviews.Author: vinyloddisee
Reviews.Content: I spent 20 hours researching reviews of wdw area hotels and not wanting to pay to stay inside resort chose Radisson. It was so close, it could really be considered inside resort area. First off, the lobby is just as impressive in person as online photos show it. Very convenient coming and going. We arrived at 1:00 p.m. and front desk checked us right in, and we went straight to our 2 room suite on the 8th floor. The bathroom was very nice, TV's good, great view, could see the fireworks at night. Seriously noisy elevators, but once we got to sleep, slept okay. (Did not at all like the sleep number beds, just a preference.) The pool was very nice and tiki bar convenient. The inside bar wasn't well stocked. Yuengling draft out, No Stella and only 1 Coors Light for the evening. Housekeeping was immaculate. Loved our room. Just please take your own pillow, I'm surprised more people don't say something about how flat they are.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just the right distance from Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: GroverUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my wife and daughter. Rooms were spacious enough, clean and well maintained. We had two double beds and sofa with desk and chair. The beds allow you to choose the firmness of the matress for just your side of the bed. I've got to get one of these! Staff were always great and really friendly - especially in the restaurant and bar. The outdoor pool is simple, but neat and tidy, and it was a nice place to go and relax after overdosing on Disney. Breakfast was not included in the cost but, frankly, after being used to the costs of British hotels, I didn't have too much of an issue with paying the additional amount and the all-you-can eat breakfast buffet was excellent with a good selection of pastries, fruit and joghurts, pancakes, bacon, eggs, etc. I recommend the banana and nut pancakes which, unfortunately, I didn't discover until my last day. The hotel is situated on the east on the Disney parks and resorts but isn't too far away - just the right distance as far as we are concerned. It is right next to Interstate 4 which also makes it an easy hop to Universal and Seaworld, etc. It also sits next to the Crossroads area which has restaurants, bars and a supermarket (hotel rooms have a fridge and microwave if you don't want to dine out) and it is only the next block down that also has a Denny's, Burger King and Olive Garden (which became our favourite place to eat). These places are within easy walking distance. By the way, there is also an ATM at Crossroads which is also handy. All in all a nice hotel and we would definitely consider using it again whenever we next stay in Orlando. The only downside, and unlike the Holiday Inns I stay at, was that we had booked through a UK travel agent and my loyalty card was refused. This was quite unfortunate having not only stayed there for a week but also during a double points promotion. So, just be aware of this if you want to stay in Radisson hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: bhavin_nc
Reviews.Content: you expect to have a free breakfast on your stay on a good name hotel. YOu get that but not a variety, no fruits, rooms were not too spacious but ok for one or two person. low staff

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Yazen
Reviews.Content: We are presently staying in Stuart, FL and decided to drive to Orlando for the day to shop at the Premium Outlets( they have a Tod's shoes and my wife can't resist) . Instead of driving back the same day,, we booked at the Radisson based on Trip Advisor. The reviews are accurate. The hotel is CLEAN and a few minutes drive from PREMIUM OUTLETS and DOWNTOWN DISNEY. It is off a major traffic artery but they have shuttles to the parks with a two hour advanced notice. Only drawback was the Maid disrupting our sleep twice. My fault for not placing do not disturb sign.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marbel
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Excellent value for money. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. Although there are lots of restaurants in the vicinity, food in the hotel is good and reasonably priced. Staff are friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: AdrainEss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Fast easy check in... they also have a guest services desk for theme park tickets... there was a doorman... very beautiful decor... good pressure in shower... nice size tv... The rooms were so clean and very nice. Sleep number beds was awesome and now I MUST invest in one! my two year old is going on about a sleep number bed now which is insane! haha. A nice view of I-4. I saw the reviews about the noise from the interstate that some was complaining about but we had a room looking at the interstate and it didnt bother me... didnt even know it was there. The traffic coming out of the hotel is a bit of a problem and you have to do a U turn or turn somewhere and come back out to a redlight to be safer. Thats the only down side to it was the traffic oh yeah and one of the places Romas Express (a resturant who delivers to the hotel... sucked really bad but thats on another reveiw and has nothing to do with the hotel) We didnt try out their food at the hotel but it looked like it was nice. They had a bar as well. And its right near downtown Disney... its like right at the light so not far at all. Otherwise... superb service, clean rooms, great beds, great view, nice staff. Cant believe the great price I payed for this hotel and it was an absolute gem! And there was no hidden fees parking and internet was free! We needed more towels and we called and they were there in like seconds knocking at the door! Our fridge wasnt turned on either and the maintence guy came in very friendly guy and turned it on a flash. Everyone (the staff) was very nice. Ive stayed in Orlando before and this is my favorite hotel so far. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: carmelo15
Reviews.Content: We got to hotel about 2 hours before 3PM check in to see if we could get in room early. Front desk clerk was very accommodating and checked us right in. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Sleep number beds were great after a little playing around to get the right number.Bathroom was a little small but clean with nice tile floors,and plenty of counter space. Our room was on side near the highway and was very quiet. Overall , a very nice place to stay. Though you can only get into the hotel from one direction, it was never really a problem. It is a very busy area with traffic,so it can be tough getting anywhere and should not be held against a very nice hotel, plus the price made it even more appealing. The only drawback we had was I booked through the Radisson website and upon checkout was charged a different price. Brought to the attention of the front desk and they resolved the problem. Just something to keep an eye on.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: IndyCICURN
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a local hotel to have a weekend getaway. We try and get away from the family once a month, something we started a few months ago. During that time we have tried several hotels in the area and they have been ok, but there was always SOMETHING negative about each one, which kept us looking. We will look no longer! We loved this hotel! Living in the Disney area, we have stayed on Disney property, in the celebration area,iand in the Lake Buena Vista area. While we love Disney hotels, when not with the kids this will be our new home away from home! The room was gorgeous. The beds, wonderful with the sleep number options. There was a welcome package on the dresser, and nice toiliteries in the bathroom. There is a great flat screen tv with 80 channels, standard mini-fridge, coffee maker and microwave in the room. A nice place for a night, weekend or week! Just behind the hotel there are many resturants and a 24 hour grocery store.
