The rooms are lovely, and with a superior room there is a full size bar fridge, laptop sized wall safe mounted right into the wall and far more secure than the closet style found in most hotels, and maid service was excellent! One drawback to this hotel is that the restaurant stops serving food at 10pm so if you are coming back late from the parks you have to walk to a nearby restaurant such as TGIF, Perkins, or red lobster all within 10 minutes, but not necessarily what you want to do at the end of a long day at the parks. Reviews say downtown Disney is an easy walk, which is only sort of true....15-20 minutes, not 10, but again, at the end of a long park day the walk is not enticing so just hop a ten dollar cab from the Lego store!

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: teamtogo2011
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Radisson for 2 nights. our 2 children are 3 and 1. we were able to purchase the tickets for the parks, the staff at the desk were very friendly and helpful. the staff at the bar, restaurant and swimming pool were great. very children friendly. the room was perfect. very comfortable beds (you can adjust how hard/soft the matress should be), nice cot/crib for the little one. 15 mins from the parks. can't fault it. We were very very pleased we chose the Radisson and should we visit the area again we'll go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “As close to Magic Kingdom as you can get without the high price!”
Reviews.Author: achatter
Reviews.Content: After LOTS of consternation about whether or not to stay in a "Disney hotel" -- I read through all of the reviews of the Radisson and decided to give it a shot. I am so happy I went with this option -- here's why: I really wanted to enjoy MK with my 4-year old (and my parents) and didn't want to be stuck in a Disney hotel where we paid for sub-par but expensive food. And though I have a child, I didn't want to be surrounded by children! That being said, I also really wanted to be as close as possible to MK. I was concerned about the drive there and back after reading some of the reviews on here b/c folks kept saying it was hard to get to/get out off, and I just have to share that I am a bit of a nervous driver and this was EASY. It's a regular road, not a highway. The hotel is well marked! You pull right out, and you are in MK within 8 minutes. We had literally parked our car in under 10 minutes from leaving the hotel. Next to the hotel, literally adjacent, are a bunch of chain-style restaurants, and they offered a nice selection since I really wanted to be at the MK most of the time, but this was a cheap way to eat breakfast rather than have to deal with a Disney hotel experience. The hotel was clean, pretty, rooms were lovely (we had a family suite, and for the price I would stay there again in a heartbeat). We ordered room service and the woman who brought us the food had messed up a little and left an item out. She took it off the bill and brought it to me anyway, her idea, I thought it was a nice touch on her part. I really can't say enough good things about this hotel if you want somewhere nice to stay VERY near MKingdom but don't want to deal with the Disney hotel. You will be happy and please know that it is really easy to get there! I was very concerned after reading reviews and was totally shocked to see how easy it was to get out of the hotel and back to it. As an aside, I had asked for a room away from the elevator and wasn't given it. Since I was in family suite, I heard the elevator all night. If I go back (which I'm sure I will!), I'll hopefully be able to explain my experience and get a different room. It wasn't terrible for me at all since I am a heavy sleeper, but it might be for someone who isn't, or a child. The family suite is GREAT, by the way. Two big rooms, terrific price. I really loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location--Cleanest rooms I've EVER stayed in--Plan on staying again when I return to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Cheerfan63
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit with my job, my son's athletic competitions and family vacations--so I've stayed in a wide range of rental properties. This trip was for my son's athletic competition at Disney, so I decided to bring my daughter and her two small children along as well (afterall, we were at Disney!) I booked my room on Priceline and got an incredible deal, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised to find a very spacious room with sleep-number beds, a pull-out couch (in a separate section of the room--which was very nice!), a small fridge, microwave, coffee--everything you'd expect to find at a higher-end priced hotel! This hotel is convenient to everything! A wide range of restaurants is located steps away. There's even a small restaurant in the parking lot, as well as a very nice, reasonably priced souvenir shop. Magic Kingdom is 4-5 miles from the hotel, keeping you close to all the parks, yet away from all the congested Disney traffic. Hotel parking is free (which is rare these days!) And, the hotel offers free shuttle service to/from all the Walt Disney World parks!!! The absolute best thing that I can say about this hotel is the housekeeping! Our room was literally a hot mess each day from the two small children and each evening when we'd get back--our room was not only cleaned beyond measure---it smelled fresh and clean too!!! I have never felt compelled to tip a maid for going above and beyond while staying at a hotel, but on my last day at this hotel, I waited for her and gave her a generous tip for going above and beyond my expectations! The only issue I had was getting the sleep-number bed adjusted to where it was comfortable for me. LOL. I had never experienced a sleep-number bed, so it was an adjustment--but once I found the setting that worked for me, the beds were very comfortable. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to both the budget and higher-end traveler. I was able to get this hotel from Priceline Name Your Own Price for just $69 per night!!! QUITE A BARGAIN for the stay I experienced! If you're looking for an inexpensive Disney Hopper or 1-day ticket, turn right out of the hotel and go to the first gas station on the left (I believe it's a Marathon)---they sale Hopper tickets for a fraction of the cost Disney charges. You can get a 3-day hopper for around $150 (which is a steal!) Then, if you don't use all your days, this same gas station will buy the remaining day back from you. Don't BUY GAS here though--it's always priced way higher than the rest of the gas stations on down the road.

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest and Cleanest Room We've Ever Stayed In"”
Reviews.Author: shortandhat
Reviews.Content: Much like many who stay in this area, we stayed at the Radisson because of its proximity to Disney and Universal Studios. I found this hotel online, read a ton of great reviews, was impressed by the pictures of the rooms,etc. We weren't disappointed. The room was beautiful. I am very concerned about bed bugs, and every hotel we stay in, I do a thorough search of the bed--including the box springs, the mattress, the mattress cover, and the sheets. I found nothing: no stains or any sign of bed bugs. The room was clean as a whistle; obviously, this hotel prides itself on its cleanliness. We weren't too impressed with the service, however. Check in was slow, and the lady working downstairs at the Disney ticket counter was difficult to follow (we ended up buying our tickets at Disney Quest in Downtown Disney). They don't have continental breakfast, which was disappointing. They DO have wifi. However, ultimately, what's the most important to me in a hotel is cleanliness, so I'm willing to overlook these small inconveniences as long as my room is tidy and clean. Would I stay here again? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value, Clean and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCbeachbum_8
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from a delightful vacation to Disney World. After checking the TripAdvisor reviews and online prices, I booked 4 nights at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista. I was able to book two rooms for $79 each through a special offer at travelzoo.com. My daughter, son-in-law and 6 yr old granddaughter stayed in one room,. my husband and I in the other. There was plenty of room with a desk and sofa-bed, microwave, fridge, flat screen tv, nicely appointed bathroom. Very clean throughout. Being budget-minded, we used the free bus transportation to the Disney Parks with no problem. There are 2 morning trips to Disney, 1 to Universal and the same number of afternoon -evening return trips to the hotel. Depending on which Disney Park you want to visit, you may have to transfer to the Disney transportation which is fairly easy to negotiate. In the morning, the bus picked up at 1 more hotel, but none on return trips. Travel to the parks was less than a half hour. We did not want to rent a car, so we booked service through Murray Transport for $110 round-trip from the airport and for our return. The driver was waiting for us in the baggage area, loaded our bags into the large SUV. As previously agreed to, he made a supermarket stop where we shopped for beverages, snack and simple breakfast food. It was so nice not to fight the heavy traffic Other reviews have mentioned the loud highway noise. It honestly did not bother us in the least. We were in the room only for sleeping. However, we walked many miles at Disney every day and relaxed in the swimming pool and hot tub afterward. We collapsed into sleep easily. Light sleepers might need ear plugs. Several restaurants and shops are within walking distance. We used McDonalds, Waffle House and Olive Garden. We also saw Chevy's, Uno's and a chicken wing Place. We took a taxi to Downtown Disney for the Sunday character breakfast at the Hilton, cost $10 cab fare. From there we were able to take the Disney Bus to Epcot. The location of Radisson is great. The employees are friendly and helpful. Check-in was efficient. We used the complimentary computers in the lobby. Each evening, there are freshly-baked chocolate chip cookies to enjoy. It's really a nice place to stay if you're value conscious. I recommend it highly and will stay there again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stl-sue0117
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while visting Epcot. The room was tastefully decorated and Great Beds and shower. Very easy to get to theme parks with bus service provided.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel experience in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Diego1935
Reviews.Content: Great Rooms ,Very Clean Excellent Staff No fees for guest mail/packages (some hotels charge for receiving large packages and I ship my luggage to myself sometimes =) ) I had no problems whatsoever with this hotel! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, clean, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pickyone12
Reviews.Content: Stayed during busy time of mid-winter break. Hotel at capacity but didn't feel busy or crowded. Rooms and lobby exceptionally clean! Staff friendly. Only minor problem was safe was locked on our weekend arrival. Manager unlocked first thing Monday morning so no big deal at all. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Super Value, great room”
Reviews.Author: PrincessFiona27
Reviews.Content: I bid a this hotel on priceline and got the room for $60 and tax. Lucky for me the hotel was sold out! Check in was very nice and quick. I asked for a room not on the highway side and given a good room on the 7th floor. The rooms are large with two sleep number beds and then also a pull out. We had our family and extended family so we needed the room. We were there for only one nite before going to our Disney hotel. The room was clean, good location, good staff. I had forgotten my razor and in the welcome area they gave a package with a razor! We already own AP's so it was easy to say no. The hotel was busy but things moved well and people seemed happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to the Disney Entrance”
Reviews.Author: COBB64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced and about a block from the Disney World entrance. The staff was very helpful and responsive to any requests. The hotel does have one of those sales desks in the lobby who try to sell vacation rentals by offering information and tickets to events.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Big room, CLEAN!!”
Reviews.Author: mrtimbo5
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 6th floor in an even # room on the highway side. Put the fan motor on at night which kept the noise level of traffic to a minimum. The sleep # bed wasn't the most comfortable. The room was big and sportless. Nice size mini-fridge. Bathroom was very modern. Great to have an in-room safe. Staff was helpful and friendly. Walking distance to stores, restaurants. Don't get gas across the street, they don't advertise their price and I needed to fill up the rental car. They charged me $4.04/gal regular. Saw it for $3.30 elsewhere. Pool looked nice but I didn't use it. 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical in fitness center. Flat screen TV with many channels.VERY CLEAN! Wireless internet worked well.Breakfast buffett was good. All in all, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The first thing that hits you when you walk in the door is a clean, pleasant smell!”
Reviews.Author: wisfamily77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice! The room was clean and very inviting! We had a sleep number bed which was very comfortable. A large, flat screen tv and separate desk/love seat area added to the room's overall layout.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel, excellent service, very clean and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Edward15
Reviews.Content: cant fault this hotel, the rooms and the hotel were spotless. The staff could not do enough for you, we have been to Orlando twice yearly for the past 10 years (sad i know) now we have stayed here this will be our 1st choice. Great value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price, so and so breakfast buffett”
Reviews.Author: frombaritomiami
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights this February with my family (wife and 2 small children). The best things this hotel has going for are: Location, Price and Cleanliness (new hotel and it shows). It is very close to all Disney parks and you do not pay the overpriced resorts' prices. Additionally, it is very close to a large strip mall with at least 10-12 restaurant choices. The rooms were very clean and large, the sleepnumber beds were OK I guess, neither too uncomfortable nor the best beds I have slept in. The only sore point was the breakfast buffett. The selection of items was limited and often the bins were empty. The servers were very nice and helpful but few and far in between, so it took time to put your orders through. Again, not a horrible breakfast, just limited choices. Overall, an excellent value for the money, definitely recommend for anyone interested in staying at great price near the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Stephie_Pie
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. I think it is one of the best values in Orlando. Service was normal, not great, but not bad either. My boyfriend and i had a very pleasant stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: simplesimon1977
Reviews.Content: We had returned to port from a cruise and had prearranged a stay at this hotel. I called the front desk to see if I could get an early check in. We wanted to go to Walt Disney World and I wanted to avoid a late check in. They could not accomodate us as early as I had hoped, but we checked in later without any problem. The clerk who helped us was friendly and helpful. It was a pleasant surprise to find complimentary fresh chocolate chip cookies at the counter. I had not been in my room for five minutes when the front desk clerk called to see if everything was alright and if we needed anything. I ate at the Bar and Grill in the hotel and found the food and service very good. When we checked out, I thought I had left something in the room. The staff was very helpful and expressed what appeared to be genuine concern to my situation. It turned out the thing I was looking for was in my car, I returned to the GN and those at the counter to advise them of my discovery and the GM thanked me. He gave me his business card and promised to meet or beat any hotel rate on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Oz79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and i think this hotel was adequate for the price. Good sized, clean rooms with ample amenities and Basic gym facilities but there was nothing that stood out as fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Trip Like Ours”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutTraveler3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here together (kids at home with Grandma) and this was the perfect hotel for our trip. We were here to relax by the pool and enjoy the Florida warmth. We chose to take a cab from the airport (no rental car) for about $60 and walk to whatever we needed. Our plan worked out perfectly - walked to dinner and groceries at cross roads plaza and out to Walgreens for sundries - which gave us access to everything we needed (and a little exercise each day too). Room was beautiful. Our room faced the highway, and as others have pointed out, you hear traffic in the room - but for us it was no big deal (note: we were on the top floor which might have limited the noise). Pool was fabulous - perhaps we were influenced by the beautiful weather while we were here - but our opinion is very strong - great pool. There is traffic all around the pool, but they do an exceptional job of isolating the pool area - like an oasis. Professional, attentive staff. Gift shop in parking lot is so tacky - it would be impossible to exaggerate, but so over the top it's funny.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: caaaat
Reviews.Content: Reviews for this hotel were great so I gave it a try. We were greeted by nice ladies at the front desk and the chocolate chip cookies were delicious! The pictures of the lobby don't really do it justice. When we got to our rooms, I was expecting really tacky/cheap looking decor and sheets but when I got inside, it was just pretty and very clean. The bath stuffs provided were nice (shampoo didn't lather that great for me though) and was always cleaned nicely. The beds are the Sleep Number beds. While I slept comfortably, my boyfriend had a little trouble getting used to it. The one thing that I was sad about was that breakfast wasn't complimentry. The location of the hotel is good but bad. Although there is a Perkins and other restaurants within short walking distance, the road in front is busy and can cost you extra when taking a cab because of the "U" they would have to make. They have great customer service. For example, I just checked my online credit card transactions and saw that I was charged by the hotel. I called the front desk, explained that I never charged anything to the room and then promptly removed the charges after they spoke to the manager. Love this hotel, will come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - conveniently located for Disney”
Reviews.Author: ZaphodsGhost
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Very pleased with the room. Decent size, modern - full size fridge and microwave. Safe had a removable shelf which meant plenty of room for laptops, iPads etc. Complimentary Internet was very good - had no issue with VoIP conversations. Staff deserve praise. They were helpful, and one day when we accidentally left the room leaving the safe open, nothing was touched - despite the fact that we'd left over 2k dollars on view. Pool looked ok, albeit it didn't seem to be heated in February. Spa pool definitely was - very warm. Towels and changing facilities were available. Didn't eat in the restaurant, but ate in the bar area from the main restaurant menu. Food pretty good - and staff happy to accommodate even when turning up at five minutes before restaurant closing time. Perk ins restaurant next door serves very good breakfasts. Thoroughly recommended, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel - Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: exUPSman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista over the Valentines Day weekend. Hotel provided 5 star room at 3 star price! Room was very large (could sleep 5-6), had marble bathroom floor, granite counterctops, vessel sink, fridge, microwave. Also included all necessary bath toiletries(even razor, toothpaste, breath right strips, etc). No resort fee! Free transportation to Disney(saved us $15 day on parking). Free parking & FREE WIFI! Liquid restaurant in Hotel was excellent. Offered a NY strip dinner with appetizer and desert for $25. One of the best steaks I've had as is was seasoned very well. In regards to getting in and out, there is one one entrance/exit and you must go under I-4 and then make a u-turn to get to hotel. Other than that...excellent. Already booked another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on which side of the building you stay!”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I started in room number 620. Problem - yes, it looks onto the I4 highway and exit (see picture) Enough noisy to wake me up. So I moved to room 617 on the other side of the building. Much better. Nice room, 2 good size beds with adjustable hardness - (zero to 100) You can adjust the beds to suit. Bathroom OK, bath tub is very shallow. Microwave, coffee machine in the room. Good flatscreen TV. Free internet in the lobby. Minor point - fridge in the room does kick in and makes a noise - better in-room fridges do not do that, giving a quiter room. In the corridor, Ice machine and soda dispenser. Breakfast good, buffet or a choice from the menu. Outside, a pool and sunbathing area. Water a bit too cool to swim in February. Hotel has a small gym area. Service all very good, staff helpful and location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Really? #8 ranking?”
Reviews.Author: S_K3313
Reviews.Content: Check in was average. Rooms clean, bed comfy, fairly standard for the times but overall nice rooms. Always good to have a micro & fridge. In-house restaurant service was not good, especially for being one of the two tables full at opening time. Food was slightly less than warm with no flavor. The noise from the highway was pretty loud, again while making it easy to find right off the exit noise was a downer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Reservations Not Put in System”
Reviews.Author: C_Cheung52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice hotel to stay at if you stay on the side away from the traffic. Made reservation the morning of 02/11/11, and when I arrived there was no confirmation or reservation in the system. I proceeded to show the call I made to the hotel on my cell phone, explained who I talked to and all the details. Finally, after 10 minutes the staff clerk called reservations and there was my room. Why did it take 10 minutes? I asked for a room away from the elevator, a room was assigned two doors from the elevator. Asked to be moved as the elevator made a groaning noise. We were moved and from that point on everything was good. They have a great welcoming package and delicious cookies at arrival. Close to parks.

Reviews.Title: “Low Price, AWESOME Quality”
Reviews.Author: dannyborja
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel specially for the really low price that we paid. Big Clean Rooms. Great Location to go to Disney, perhaps 10 minute ride max. Breakfast is not included but the hotel offers good breakfast if not there is a Waffle House which is cheap in Price but super good. I ate at the restaurant one night and the Lasagna was delicious. I order Pizza from the Room Service for the Super Bowl and it was great too. There are lots of restaurants near hotel as well as Walgreens. etc...Will go back specially for the price and services that you get. Shuttle to disney, Free Parking, free Internet and WIFi...Outlets 5 minutes away. Great service, Gym was small but good.Microwave and fridge in room.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable stay, decent value”
Reviews.Author: jamesclau
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place that has good value - it is a comfortable, clean place that is close to major attractions in Orlando. Doesn't have any wow factor or is superb in any way but definitely did the job. Would recommend to friends who don't want to spend an arm and a leg but want a comfortable stay at a modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Budget Rooms for a Budget Price”
Reviews.Author: lazytravelling
Reviews.Content: This is a little dated, but I didn't want to leave my experience at the Radisson Orlando-Lake Buena Vista go unreviewed... We stayed here in August 2010 while visiting Disney World. The location of the hotel is not great (next to a highway, plus a tacky gift shop megastore), but if you have a car -- and I imagine you will -- this is not too much of a problem. You're about a 7-8 minute drive from the parks, and the hotel also has a shuttle bus going to and from the major parks. We got a great deal -- about $80 a night -- so I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the accommodations. The rooms themselves are really nice, very well maintained and even kind of stylish. Ours had two double beds, plus a couch that could sleep two... so even though there were only two of us, the room was large enough to accommodate six. My only complaint has to do with the bathroom. Compared to the rooms, the bathroom was a little dated -- the shower wasn't great, the bathtub needed a little work... and the walls looked like they could use a good remodel. Still, this is minor... overall, we had a good experience. The public spaces in the hotel aren't great -- a very small bar, a small pool (almost always crowded with kids), and a restaurant that's not anything to write home about... BUT -- the next time I go to Orlando, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. TIP: Avoid the hotel's tourist desk. Better to organize your vacation in advance. Do a little research in advance regarding park prices and the packages you need... otherwise, you'll get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best choice for quality and price”
Reviews.Author: fox67Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Everything that you can expect in Orlando in you don't want to stay in the Disney resort which might be too expensive. This hotel is located next to Disney World and the Disney Village (10 min walking). Rooms are big with incredible beds, nice bathroom, microwave, flat screen TV set. There is a shuttle to go to Disney but if you want to go to Universal you will need a car. The staff was also very nice and helpful, always available even for questions they for sure already answered a thousand times. The weak point would be breakfast, the quality of the products (eggs, sausages etc)need to be improved. Last but not least you have a 24 hour fitness room and also an outdoor swimming pool and parking is free of charge!! But I really recommand this place you shouldn't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to WDW, very nice staff and room, good restaurants nearby”
Reviews.Author: get0ut0ft0wn
Reviews.Content: If you're not staying at a Disney resort and will have a rental car, this is a great option. Only warnings - traffic is bad at peak rush hour, and you have to overshoot the hotel and make a u-turn when coming home from the parks. Tip: walk to Uno Pizzeria rather than take a car! Or just hop across the parking lot to Waffle House. Very convenient. Our room was nice, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the hot tub was welcoming after a day at WDW. There's no free breakfast, but both Waffle House and McDonald's are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: RobertoAlbuquerque
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located – a few miles from the Disney’s Complex, Sea World and Universal Studios. The rooms are spacious, very clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Definitely a great choice in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: charless7777
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel! they really want to see you happy... everything here is perfect, the rooms are super clean and with a very nice style... the location is very good also, i highly recomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: arossi222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 4 days while we were in orlando. The hotel was very nice, the rooms were clean and modern. We got a great rate online for $77 per night and when i added an extra night last minute, the rates were higher at about $100, however they gave me a discounted rate of $85 since i had paid the $77. The location is great right outside downtown disney. The only complaint that i would have is that the pool is not heated and when the sun starts going down, it is complete shade. We were there when the air temperature was 85 degrees but the pool was freezing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Disneyworld visit!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in early December. Got an unbelievable rate through Expedia ($70 per night including tax). Room was very spacious, modern and clean. Loved the LCD TV on the wall! We had a hire car and the location could not have been better. Only 2 min in the car and you were already in the Disneyworld complex! Very close to a bunch of restaurants including Red Lobster, Uno Chicago Grill and iHop. Would have given this hotel 5 stars if the hotel lift wasn't so loud. I had read alot on here about the noisy lift and therefore requested a room as far away as possible. However, we could still hear it from our room. Our solution was to keep the fan on the heater running all night. If we didn't have that option I doubt I wouldn't have slept as well as I did. Don't know if the hotel can do anything about the lift noise but they should really try! It's the only bad feature of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a very fair price”
Reviews.Author: Princess095
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here . . the hotel is very clean and staff cleans public areas often. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Lisa went out of her way to make us comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything, but driving to it may be a pain”
Reviews.Author: TwilightChrome
Reviews.Content: Nice, new hotel with modern fixtures, rooms, and common areas. Courteous and competent staff. When we first checked in, we were given room 510 which faces roughly southeast, right towards Interstate 4, which is about 150 yards away. Road noise starting at 5:30 a.m. woke us up. A room move to Room 403 (facing northwest, overlooking Perkins) made it quiet as a church. When you drive out of the lot you have to turn right onto 535. If you need the other direction you have to fight over 3 lanes quickly to U-turn. If you come back to the hotel from Downtown Disney or anywhere from the North, you have to pass the hotel, go under I-4, and U-turn on 535 to get back to the hotel. Not the most convenient. What IS the most convenient is you can walk to Waffle House, Perkins, Unos, BWW, McDonalds, Chevy's, the supermarket, and 30 other stores.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in LBV”
Reviews.Author: pamelasales
Reviews.Content: The Radisson is the best place to stay in Lake Buena Vista. Its an easy exit off I-4 and close to everything. I always enjoy the friendly service and cookies at check in. We visited Orlando this time to do some Christmas shopping and the coupon book the guest services desk gave us came in handy at the outlets mall. Our room was just as nice asthe last time. This is the cleanest hotel you will find. Everything is always first class at this Radisson. I always look forward to my Orlando trip and staying here. Great Starbucks coffee in the lobby bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Need improvement of internet connection”
Reviews.Author: ignor
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and staff was friendly. My room with a whirlpool bath on highway side had too much noise from the car traffic.. Internet connection was just terrible, and almost always it took forever to load a page or impossible. For one planning to do anything meaningful with internet, this hotel is not up to it. But it should be a simple thing if management acts on it. Over all, until the internet is improved, I cannot recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: davdell0812
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night - but wished I had stayed longer. The hotel was extremely clean. The staff very nice and accomodating. I asked for an extended check out time and was given one without any hesitation or extra charge. The rooms are a very good size. They have a small area that has a sofa and work area. A small refrigerator, microwave, and sink area. The bathrooms are more than adaquate and the sleep number beds are very comfy. Wifi is available free and works very well. The hotel is directly across the street from the downtown Disney area and is very close to all of the Disney theme parks. There are numerous restaurants, and shopping areas withnin 5 miles of the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price, but watch out for noise from the lift!”
Reviews.Author: MkMark
Reviews.Content: Check in was very poor, the young lady who did so never made eye contact with me once as i seemed to be an inconvenience to her conversation with her colleague, rooms are fine, well appointed, only lift noise does seem to be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay in room 807 if youmwant a good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Screechingwheelz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 1st January in one of the family suite rooms - number 807. The room was just as the pictures and Clean as other reviews have stated. But and its a big one, this room is next to the elevator shaft, so every time either elevator is used you cant help but here the low drone of the elevator going upmand down. We got no sleep until gone midnight and then were woken again at 6am when people started to leave. Also we were not keen on the location. The hotel makes no claims to be in a leafy area but it has 2 extremely busy roads right next to it. This also makes getting in and out of place a little tricky when the traffic is heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJF135
Reviews.Content: Just going to repeat what everyone else has said, the hotel is great, the staff are excellent, couldn't do enough to help you, the rooms reflect a higher quality then the price we paid, great location, only max 10 mins drive to Disney, Universal and most other parks. The rooms were excellent, even had an Ipod docking station so the kids were happy. Cleanliness of the hotel in both the rooms and the public areas were second to none, I really can't fault the hotel, but if I had too then the only things I could mention were like the lady below, the internet wasn't always great and the beds were a bit hit and miss with the settings, but it didn't ruin anything at all. When reading the reviews we laughed at some of them saying about the big blue gift shop, but when we saw it we laughed even more, its the biggest eye sore going, but we found it funny, it didn't take anything away from the hotel, the hotel is not in a position for views as its on a main road, hence why its so easy to get everywhere so the gift shop is not spoiling anything. Would like to give an extra mention to the Bar staff they couldn't do enough for us, very helpful and very friendly. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it to my friends, in fact wished we had stayed longer, we moved on and stayed at the Holiday Inn Clearwater Beach and it wasn't nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with some minor issues...”
Reviews.Author: jess1430
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews I read stated this Radisson to be an excellent hotel. Overall, I agree. However, even great hotels can have their problems. First, the positive-as all of the reviews stated, the hotel was extremely clean, beautiful, and the service was top notch. All staff members were friendly and accomodating, and the hotel was nice and quiet...even at midnight on New Years Eve. The room service was prompt and delicious. The location was central to all attractions, and we had no problem getting to I-4 from the parking lot exit. The negative-we were looking forward to the sleep number beds. I'm not sure if we just got unlucky with our room, but both of ours seemed to be broken. The first night, we didn't sleep at all. The bed wouldn't stay inflated at the levels we put it on, and if my husband left the bed to use the restroom, I practically flew off the other side. It was rough. The next day we informed the front desk of the issue, but switched beds with our young child, as well. The other bed was definitely better, but far from the bed we had imagined based on reviews. Other minor issues...our internet didn't work in our room, even after maintenance came to attempt to fix the problem. I give the hotel credit-we received $10 off each night of our visit and apologies from the manager, but it was still inconvenient. Also, the shower water control would not stay in place. I either had to shower in cool/cold water, or if I placed the handle midway, it was loose and would fall to scalding levels. Again, something easily fixed, but still disappointing. I was considering not posting about the issues we had because this really is a great hotel. However, I value the honesty of the people who post on TripAdvisor, so I felt full disclosure best. I will say that my husband and I most value the cleanliness and quietness of a hotel, and the friendliness of the staff-and in these areas, we were not disappointed. I would probably stay at this location again-but most certainly in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-appointed rooms and a great value”
Reviews.Author: Cyndy305
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel while visiting relatives in the Orlando area. Check-in was easy and no waiting. They asked us if we wanted a higher floor or a lower floor. The rooms are VERY NICE, and everything is recently remodeled. There is a separate area off the bedroom with a desk and a sofa which pulls out into a bed. They have sleep number beds. There is also an area with a microwave, small fridge and counter. The bathrooms are brand new with granite countertops. Nice, large flatscreen TV, also. It was almost a shame that we didn't spend more time in the room. The only negative is that coming from one direction, you have to go down past the hotel and make a u-turn to get to the entrance, and it is in a high traffic area near the I-4 exit. But the rate we got was much cheaper than the other hotels in the area, and the quality of the hotel was better than others where we have stayed and paid more.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful value with courteous staff and very nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: GeneLexington_KY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this facility last spring and returned with children and grandchildren in December. Every aspect of this experience was pleasant, from making reservations to checking in. Lisa Johnson at the front desk was very helpful during our stay. The cleaning staff is efficient and courteous. The gym is functional and better than those at similar lodgings. The rooms are clean and comfortable with easy access to Disney parks. We will stay there again in March for spring baseball.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: TinaMalmoSweden
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 2 sons and an assistent at the hotel. We enjoyed our stay, close to all the attractions and shopping. The beds are fantastic and the rooms very clean. Staff is friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Best for family stay”
Reviews.Author: Florida-I75
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my two teen kids,wife and stayed this hotel in family suite room. There are two queen beds and one kng bed. It was enough space for us. This type of rooms are only seven in my understanding and not faced to interstate, so not noisy . But located next to elevetor, so you may feel a little bit annoyance. In addition, if you would like to take quick and reasonable breakfast, you can go to waffle house in the same area. Overall satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: capt170
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to Orlando to celebrate my twins 15th birthday. Out of all the hotels in the Orlando area, this one has been the best in all aspects. I had several requests before our arrival and the staff went out of their way to satisfy us. The accommodations were more than spectacular and the Hotel cleanness, appearance, services and location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: spyder1964
Reviews.Content: I used my gold points plus to stay here for my anniversary. We had a great stay. Just like the other comments we could not have asked for a better weekend with the welcoming staff and excellent service from the dining room and bar staff, well done to Mark the chef, Vicky Marie who provided service beyond expectations and Luke who made our drinks. They all made our anniversary dinner very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MickL05
Reviews.Content: We used the Radisson Orlando Lake Buena Vista as our base when visiting the Disney World theme parks. Although outside of the theme park resort it was close enough to enjoy all the attractions with a short shuttle ride from the hotel. The hotel is fairly new and rooms were quite modern, clean and very roomy. During our 10 day stay we felt quite comfortable and un cluttered in the room. The bathroom was also of genourous size. Hotel amenities were also excellent with pool and spa very welcoming after a day of theme parks topped off with a cold beer from the poolside bar. Free wireless internet friendly and welcoming staff and excellent service from the dining room and bar staff, well done to Mark the chef and Anne Marie who provided service beyond expectations. The hotel is across the road from entry to Downtown Disney and close to the Premier discount outlets. The hotel is reasonably priced and excellent value for what you get. Keep up the good work guys

Reviews.Title: “incredible value at any price”
Reviews.Author: neworleanskls
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor and the sleep number beds. I was a bit worried since there are so many cheesy hotels around Universal and Disney. What a fabulous surprise! The rooms are immaculate, large and well appointed. Minutes to Disney and 10 minutes to the gate of Universal. The staff bent over backwards to accomodate us and the convenience of parking at the front door along with the large, comfortable clean rooms was great. When they clean the rooms, they tear the entire bed apart and clean under it! They even offered daily sheet changes like the 5 star hotels at no extra charge. This is a great value all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Colin2109
Reviews.Content: We just had four nights at the hotel. Rooms were great quality and we paid a great price. Only tried the restaurant for breakfast once and found it a bit pricey for what you get. There are lots of choices to eat within a five minute walk. Free shuttle was good to Disney, but not very useful returning. We either had to leave early to get the shuttle and stay for 1.5 hours after Disney closed. We got taxis instead, about $15 plus tip. Wifi was also useless, we didn't get it to work at all or it was so slow we gave up.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: jjshirley
Reviews.Content: This place was great, from the staff, the location, and the room. We had a jacuzzie room with the sleep number bed, everything worked great, room was quite, and had plenty of room for us. Location was fantastic, close to universal and disney. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo_S82
Reviews.Content: Hello everybody, Radisson LBV is very good, I recommend everyone who does not want to worry about anything in Orlando. The room is very spacious and clean, as the bathroom. The lobby, restaurant and bar was very nice too. The bar has a Starbucks coffee, very good for the colder days. The location is good, both for those who want to go to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney, both to International Drive and Universal Studios, because Radisson is between both sides. The staff are very friendly and smiling. Behind the hotel has several restaurants and grocery stores that you can walk. Well, I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Trad11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in family suite. This is a great location and base for various Orlando activities. Lots of free parking space and great location. The interstate side rooms can be a bit noisy, but our family suite was on the other side was a really quiet. Breakfast was OK, and we did not have time to use swimming pool or gym.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: DerekfaeAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in October my wife and 2 children aged 4 & 8. We could not have picked a better hotel in the area plenty of places near by to eat from basic to the best steak houses and for Disney well what can we say 5 mins by car or take the free shuttle bus and your there in 20 mins and no parking to pay!! Hotel was spotless and room was nice and big, cleaned every day, staff were very good. Only one fault the pool is freezing. But be assured if we are back in Orlando we will book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: SL27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the lake buena vista radisson in March 2010 for 8 days. Narrowed on the hotel after a lot of surfing. I was in Florida for a conference and my wife and son accompanied me. I booked via the net so I got a cheaper deal. The hotel check in and check out were smooth. The room was quite large with heating and air conditioning. All amenities- ward robe closet, fridge, microwave,desk, table, bed stand, alarm, radio, LCD with all channels, big and clean bathroom and toilet. The housekeeping staff, employees and servers at the restaurant were polite, helpful and efficient. there was an ice dispenser on the floor with a vending machine. There was also a coin operated laundry on site ( powder sachet on sale at the front desk) which was perfect as we could travel light especially with a child around. The beds were Sleep adjustable with remote so perfect for sound sleep. Opposite the hotel is 24 hour open Waffle house. we went there for breakfast for a change - typical american fare- very nice option (buffet breakfast was included in the hotel for us and quite nice). There was not much in way of variety and we were there for 8 days so could do with some change. One could also order from some take-outs- some of them take a little long though. A little walk down the road are different restaurants and McDonalds. Downtown Disney is a comfortable walk from the hotel. The hotel has a free shuttle to and from the parks at select times. We could comfortably use it. Please familiarize yourself with the times and parking place as the parks esp Magic kingdom can be quite crowded returning home at night after the fireworks and if you dont have your own car. I would say in retrospect that hiring a car is cheaper and definitely easier in Orlando since the distances one has to travel are quite far comparatively and public transportation is not really an option. We used a cab from time to time which did work out expensive, but we got to places a little faster. For the price the stay was excellent. we have stayed in hotels around the world this was one of the better ones for the price we paid. I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “If outdoor pool was heated it would be the PERFECT hotel for uk holidaymakers.”
Reviews.Author: Gjgxp
Reviews.Content: The good & great.... Good value. 18 days including direct flights (from uk) with Virgin @ < 2k Big rooms. Cleaned daily & well! Good restaurant on site. 15:20 minutes walk to Downtown Disney (with a 4 year old diva!) A few minutes walk from shopping & restaurants including 24 hr supermarket, ATM, etc 4 daily return trips to Disney parks (during our stay Nov/Dec), so u can ignore the guy who said they didn't have suitable times for him!? To sum up, we don't want a car and the hassle of fuels, insurance, people driving on the wrong side of the road etc, here at this hotel, you just need yourself, and sunshine! The not so great... Outdoor pool not heated - that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, we were very happy!”
Reviews.Author: ndslp
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at this hotel. We stayed 8 days. We loved it. Close to everything. Everyone was very helpful. This hotel was very clean!!

Reviews.Title: “You can put a lipstick on a pig...”
Reviews.Author: VRinA2
Reviews.Content: but it will not make Orlando any prettier. Hotel is OK. Clean spacious rooms, convenient location, but the best part is free wifi and parking. There are things that could be improved, such as an update to the bathrooms, but overall OK and nothing to rave about. I do have to say that I stayed in much nicer hotels for a similar price. I presume that truckloads of kids who just had their sugar serving and are screaming into the Disneyworld are the reason behind high hotel room prices in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, very nice ambiance, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ron5544
Reviews.Content: After staying two nights at a nearby resort for a conference, we spent the last night at Radisson as there were no rooms available a third night at the resort. I was surprised at how nice the hotel was. The decor was beatutiful, the room layout was not the usual and quite attractivet, and every staff member (front desk, housekeeping staff, waitstaff in the restaurant and even the chef) were just really nice. I got the sense that people were happy in their jobs and reflected that with the customers. The pool is not big and it's near the highway so you can hear the cars if that bothers you. As with most hotels, I think, sometimes rooms nect to the elevator can have little noises. I'm a little noise phobic so I hard the landing of the elevator, but was able to sleep with ear plugs. Otherewise I would have asked for another room.

Reviews.Title: “It is so nice to stay off property in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelingaroundtheus
Reviews.Content: The good - Really everything about this hotel except avoid the people trying to drag you into the vacation talk. - Nothing about this hotel looks old or damaged. - My kids socks don't turn black :) - A well covered front desk The bad - Nothing The ugly - Nothing Wishlist for this hotel - A sundry store

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem - perfect for a busy holiday schedule!”
Reviews.Author: ezziew
Reviews.Content: It's not until the first couple of days after arriving that you realise just how perfect the location is of this hotel. It's a little bare outside, but the inside is lush, the lifts are a good size, parking is a dream in the outside car park and the rooms are thoughtfully detailed and exceptionally clean. How lovely to arrive to little packages of sample items...can't tell you how useful they proved to be! When packing in a month of activities into a week, having room service, bar and restuarant onsite is a dream. For the price, it's unbeatable. I spent days trawling the internet looking for the best deal - here it is!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: zorrarojo
Reviews.Content: Loved this place ! Great location- very clean with sleep number beds. Great service and friendly staff. We were able to check in early and use thier shuttle service to Disney! Located in Lake Buena Vista- across the street from Down Town Disney complex. Able to get to all parks without using express way. A Gem!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lynelz1
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the price. I walked in and felt comfortable right off. I had just finished a business stay at the Grand Cypress and for my personal time after my conference, I chose to move to the Radisson based on the great reviews given on TripAdvisor. It was easy to come and go from The Radisson and there was a great selection of restaurants around plus the one on site. (I was bummed that I saw the Sweet Tomatos after I had already eaten.) My room was nicely furnished and the free wifi was a plus. Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong choice for us”
Reviews.Author: Zoeycat
Reviews.Content: Booked it thru Hotwire, requested a king bed but, of course, didn't get one. So we upgraded to a king jacuzzi room (only thing available). No longer such a good deal. Won't be booking thru them again. The room was very nice but it was practically ON the highway, making it very noisy. We did NOT like the tempurpedic mattress; either it didn't work right or it just wasn't for us, but between the noisy highway and the bed, sleeping was tough. Another problem was the shuttle between Disneyworld/Epcot/etc and the hotel. It ran once to each park and once back per day. We ended up renting a car because the times just didn't mesh with our schedule. If I had it to do over again I would stay someplace a little more expensive but then have the opportunity to come and go to and from the parks as often as we wanted. Come back to the room, take a nap, then go back for dinner and fireworks. Whatever! The Radisson's shuttle schedule was not at all accommodating. Also, be prepared for a timeshare pitch when you arrive. On a good note, the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Near everything, great room, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: P8triotsfan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Was a bit put off because it was so close to Rt. 4, but that turned out to be a plus. We were 2 min from Downtown Disney, about 10 minutes from DisneyWorld and about 20 min from Universal (if that) and we were within walking distance of some great restaurants(Perkins for breakfast next door, Uno, Johnny's, etc) We got there a bit early, but were told "no problem" and checked in immediately. There were wonderful, fresh chocolate chip cookies waiting for us at the front desk (every day around 3:00 p.m.). Our room was large and comfortable - sitting area as well as 2 queen beds (dial/number beds so we could have soft/firm mattress - :o) Very clean every day. Never a wait for elevator. Staff friendly and helpful. 2 Computers in lobby to use which was great when we had to print boarding passes to go home. Didn't try food in restaurant there so can't comment. Got our room through Priceline (best deal going for 3.5 star hotel by the way - VERY inexpensive) and were really happy with the whole Radisson experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoCalvin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise so we could enjoy a day at Disneyworld. The hotel is very conveinent and has plenty of parking. There are also lots of restaurants, some within walking distance (Chevy's Tex Mex, McDonalds, and others) and downtown Disney is just a 3 minute car ride away. Check in was a breeze, we had paid for the room with double queens but upon arrival I asked about upgrading to a family suite. The plus side to the suite is 2 queens in one room with and then an extra side room with a king bed, worked great when traveling with 2 kids. Both rooms had there own tv's but we didn't have much time for that. The only downside to the family suites is they seem to be only located near the elevators where the extra room occupies some extra space. From our bedroom we could hear the elevator at night but it wasn't a big deal for us because we have a white noise machine but I could see it bothering lite sleepers. The pool was nice, small with a jacuzzi off to the side and some comfortable lounge chairs. Great for the kids to swim after a long day. The restaurant was very good for breakfast with quick service and a nice buffet (I think it was $12 or so for the buffet) and the staff was willing to get you anything you wanted. We tried the restaurant for dinner one night and the service was very slow. We were all starving and the server was new and in training but things were taking forever. I had to get up to speak with the manager and also I went to the bar to get our drinks after they hadn't come 10 minutes after ordering. From then on the service picked up and the chef even came out to make sure our food was cooked to our satisfaction (pretty impressive considering the restaurant, it showed the chef cared alot about his food). The beds are very comfortable with newer sleep number beds, if you can't get one of these beds to your comfort liking you probably shouldn't be traveling. I would stay here again, based on price and service it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comforting to have a clean, modern room with all conveinences”
Reviews.Author: Lynn2400
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Universal Studios, we found the Radisson at Lake Buena Vista a wonderful compliment to our vacation. The room was exceptionally clean, modern, environmentally consciencous, wonderfully decorated and larger than expected. The location was perfect for our commutting, immediately off the interstate, adjacent to any restaurant you possibly could consider for you and your family.

Reviews.Title: “All around GOOD but...”
Reviews.Author: fortheloveofun
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about. We stayed here for 7 days. Found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful from the front desk to the restaurant staff they always had a smile on their face and were willing to help whenever possible. The location was extremely good as it was very close to Disney World and only a few minutes from Universal, they hotel offered complimentary shuttle service which was always on time! The rooms were standard, we had paid an extra few dollars per night for the King bed and didn't find it worth it. We had a view of the eye sore that is the neon building across the street that sells discount Disney merchandise. We're not really picky about views so that didn't matter but since we were also near the main street, we often heard cars crashing (seriously there was an accident every day on that road). The beds were comfortable enough you could select your softness or firmness, but it would get reset everyday. Great selection of tv channels, there were more channels than we could surf! Good for those rainy afternoons when we had to come back to the hotel early. I liked the fact they had a laundry room that was very convenient for long term stays. OH ONE REALLY BOTHERSOME THING is EVERY SINGLE DAY there are flyers for pizza places shoved under the door, everyday at least 3, I really hope the hotel will make some kind of effort to prevent this because not only is it annoying to pick them up and throw them away 7 days in a row but we ordered from one of the places and the food wasn't that great haha. I liked the toiletries, the bathroom (raised sink) and the room was clean. Like I said, overall good. There were lots of families at this hotel and fortunately the noise didn't travel through the rooms which was great news for both sides of the wall. The pool was average, a few chairs, a bar, a standard size swimming pool and a jacuzzi. The 2 computers they had available for internet and printing were quite handy, we used them a couple time to research food places and to print out tickets to Halloween Horror Nights. Also there's lots of great restaurants nearby that are walking distance, also a 24 hour grocery store which came in handy! You'd be surprised how many people shop at 11pm on a Sunday night. There were no problems during our stay however for the price we paid we found the overall value average at best. I would recommend it to others though I'd probably do some more research when staying in Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “great value, and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MVR154913
Reviews.Content: great service, staff were very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Rooms are very nice, clean, and comfortable. The hotel lobby, pool is also very nice. Hotel is in a great location. 30 minutes walk to downtown Disney, and in walking distance to many restaurants. Experienced issues with the Wifi in my room, but staff gladly provided a network cable as an alternative. Free cookies in the lobby was a nice touch. Pros: good value, great service, and comfortable room. free internet and parking. no surprises on my hotel bill Cons: too close to I4.(may experience some noise from highway depending which side of the hotel room is facing.) Had issues with wifi internet in the room hotel grounds could be nicer. no green space

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likestotravel1969
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is at a great price point and still close enough to Walt Disney you must stay here. The rooms are very spacious. Customer service was awesome. You will not go wrong by choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, clean rooms, decent service, poor location and too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Liverbirds1
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night (had booked prior to travel for three nights, based on reviews and position on Trip Advisor) and chose to check out as we were disappointed with the location. It is situated right next to a really ugly blue gift house that looks like it's about to shut down and our view was of the car park. We felt that for the price charged it wasn't very good value for money. We ordered room service which was clearly all about quantity rather than quality (my husband couldn't eat the club sandwich as it didn't seem very fresh atall). The rooms were of a decent size and the bathroom was ok; the beds were comfortable enough but some of the pillows seemed to have nylon type covers rather than cotton and seemed cheap quality. Although it was 'ok' we wanted something in a better area, with better quality for a similar price and although the hotel we moved to was slighly more expensive, the difference in quality was significantly greater.

Reviews.Title: “Magical piallow”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. second time, flew to Orlando for disneyworld and once stayed at this hotel. he is not far from downtown disney. delicious food. large rooms, and their plus a cot. they are simply magical. large and comfortable. nearby large gift shop and a McDonalds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trondsol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 days visiting our daughter who works in Orlando. Very satisfied with everything and has never on our many journeys had such value for money as at this hotel. Clean and very nice and helpful staff. Our 7 year old daughter loved the pool. If we visit Orlando again, we will surely stay here. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: funtime345
Reviews.Content: Close to Disney, outlet shopping, restaurants. Exceptionally clean large rooms, comfortable sleep number beds. Good food/drink options on site, FREE internet, Coin op laundry on site, helpful staff thruout! Loved it! Would stay again (and hope to soon!) Stayed 6 nites. Didn't have enough time to enjoy the lovely pool and hot tub or the nice exercise room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: anickson23
Reviews.Content: My family loved this hotel. It was the only hotel directly across from the Disney resort. We were able to walk to multiple places to eat and shop. The family suite gave us a great amount of space. The hotel was clean and quiet. The pool area was very nice. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day.

Reviews.Title: “For someone who prefers villa holidays I was delighted”
Reviews.Author: RobboMariner
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package and got a very good price, so good I was a little worried that it wouldn't be what I hoped for, but checking the reviews on here put my mind at rest. This place is a real find, courteous unfussy staff, spacious clean rooms (though maybe not exactly a suite as suggested), wonderful beds, useful amenities and a great tv and channel selection. Its perfectly situated for visitors to Disney (like us) and in easy striking distance of Sea World and I Drive. We only ate at the hotel once but got a great value for money meal of good quality food recommended by our very helpful waitress. The cleaning staff were unobtrusive and really did a good job in presenting the room, though they did accidentally throw out a towel one of us had bought it was hardly a game changer. I read the concerns of some before we came, but this was ideal for us, the pizza menus came under our door too, but what hard work it is putting them in the bin. Also the concerns people have about the location for driving were a worry for me as though I've been to America and indeed Florida in the past, this was my first time driving. Absolutely no problem at all, there's a big junction near the hotel and I never had any issues at all finding big gaps to turn onto the road and across the traffic. Highly recommended, if I ever travel in a small party again I wouldn't hesitate to return to the best hotel I've found in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Travelozzy
Reviews.Content: We paid next to nothing for our twin queen bedded room in this chain staple. And it proved a great option. Right opposite the main street leading to Downtown Disney, it's also just off i-4 and so Sea World is only 10 mins drive and the Premium Outlet Mall is only five minutes down the road. All of the US "staple" eateries are nearby (most walkable) - IHOP, Fuddrucker's, Hooters, Taco Bell, Landry's, lots of dining options for every pocket. And there are Supermarkets and a Walgreens too. The rooms provide an empty fridge so you can stock up on soda / water / beer etc and most importantly keep chocolate cool in the Florida heat! They also have a coffee machine which is fairly easy to use. There were two queen beds and a sofa with lots of space for our family of 3 ... and we didn't notice much noise from within the hotel however if there is one small down side - you could hear some traffic noise (although I'm used to it so didn't bother me at all!). The bathrooms are small but very clean and fully functioning with good showers over a small bath. Lighting is good and there's bags of storage space. There is also a good TV with plenty of US channels to entertain (but I'm sure you'll have better things to do in Orlando than watch it!). Front desk staff are OK and pleasant enough but the housekeeping team and restaurant staff were very sweet. Plenty of free parking although you will notice and enormous giftland shop which isn't the greatest view view out front of the car park! But this isn;t a hotel with a view - it's a practical, clean and comfortable base to explore Orlando..... the sleep master beds are pretty cool too!

Reviews.Title: “nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: ckbarnes
Reviews.Content: Very nice room for the price. Convenient to Disney World. They could use more shuttle times though.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: miamimomofthree
Reviews.Content: I live in Miami and have three small children. This means I go to Orlando. A lot. I've been to Disney World at least 20 times and usually stay in different hotels because I can never find the right balance of convenience - price - location - quality. Well, I have found it! It is not the most luxurious hotel in Orlando, but when you spend the entire day and part of the night sometimes in an amusement park, you want to get back to a clean, comfortable and affordable room. This is the place. I actually found this hotel via Priceline. I paid - wait for it - $55/night. This meant that I was able to get two rooms, when I normally reserved just one and cramped everyone into the same room. It was GREAT. The location is perfect - just a few blocks from Downtown Disney, Orlando Premium Outlets, and very convenient access to I-4. There are shuttle buses to the parks, too. For some reason, I was also upgraded, and got a room with a nice view and an office / sofa area. The bathrooms were brand new, there were flatscreen TV's, full size microwave, and a large mini-bar style refrigerator. The fridge had two cold bottles of water waiting for us and NOTHING else, which means you could actually use the refrigerator to store your own drinks / food. There were PLENTY of towels in the bathrooms, no need to call for "extras". The restaurant has a decent breakfast in the morning with all the usual buffet helpings. Kids under five eat free, which is great, too. Parking is on site and free. Wifi is free too. Hallways are clean and new. Another thing I noticed were the white comforters - a true sign of cleanliness. This is not your "Disney Resort" 5-star luxury hotel. If you're looking for that type of stay, go elsewhere. This is a comfortable, inexpensive, clean, new, convenient and great hotel for business travelers, or families alike. I've stayed at many hotels in Orlando, and this is the only one I've felt the need to positively review! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “95% Perfect. You will be happy!!!”
Reviews.Author: miamimickey140
Reviews.Content: Date 10/22 (2nights) Room 811 This Radisson is AMAZING. Everything is new. Lobby area is beautiful. Check in was quick and the staff was also welcoming. Loved the welcome package which included toothpaste, shaver, and other little things to help with your stay. We never used the pool, but was clean and looked nice. We also never had food at the reasturant...but again..looked nice. Once we got to our room....WOW!! Clean and everything new. Sleep Number beds are great. Sheets are coomfy. BIG flatscreen TV is great to watch from any part of the room. Desk/sofa area is a nice area if you dont want to be in bed the whole time. Room is LARGE and has everything you need: Fridge, and Microwave. So this would have been a 100% perfect stay but only 2 complaints. 1- our room was on the other side of the elevator and we can hear the mechanics of the elevator. Didnt bother us since we are heavy sleepers. 2- You can only get into the parking area from one side of the street. So you would have to make a Uturn But this Raddison is just GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Salvation from others”
Reviews.Author: JDHR26
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here back in March 2010. This was our second night in Orlando as the first night was ruined by a different hotel experience several miles away. Needless to say after driving from Pennsylvania to Florida non stop we both needed a positive atmosphere and a good night sleep and found this place. The beds were amazing. If I had not purchased Disney tickets I could of slept all day. Property was quite and secure. Having traveled and lived in Europe, the Northeast, Southeast and Mid-West I have seen and been in many hotels and worked in one also, I would recommend this property to anyone without any second thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: big_D123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson through a hotel/car trip booked via Expedia. Price for room was very reasonable. Good quality room. Everything is fairly new and kept in very good conditon. Very clean rooms and meticulous housekeeping! Only downside was the elevator. Loudest elevator I have ever heard in a hotel. First night my room was close to it and I had to change rooms in the morning which was accomodated without a problem. Request a room with uneven number (away from I-4) and as far away from elevator as possible. Very nice stay otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, service, location and price!"”
Reviews.Author: gsmackay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson on our honeymoon for seven nights. After reading other reviews on Tripadvisor, it seemed like a no-brainer. We were not disappointed. The staff at the front desk offered to help make restaurant reservations, call cabs and let us know when they arrived, helped with directions, and never made it seem like a chore. Much better service than we have received at other hotels.The jacuzzi suite was beautiful, spotless and just what we needed to relax after a number of long days at the theme parks. Our room was very quiet and the sleep number bed was Zzzzzz. Despite our good intentions of visiting a number of local restaurants, we ordered room service five times; whether it was drinks, appetizers, main course items or desserts, they were all delicious and delivered by friendly staff who were always smiling, very polite, and offered many congratulations on our marriage (thanks Martina!). The hotel is very close to Downtown Disney, and only a short drive to the other Disney parks, Sea World and Universal (10-15 minutes at most). We also enjoyed the large outlet shopping complex only a few blocks away, which was a nice break from the theme parks. Thanks for being a memorable part of our honeymoon! We will be sure to recommend this hotel to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: JamieandGerr
Reviews.Content: Good central location, close to all DisneyWorld resorts. Close to many restaurants, both fast food and sit-down restaurants. Hotel has everything you need - very clean, very friendly staff all around. If you have 3 children like we do, ask for the rooms that have 2 queen beds and one pull out. This is bigger than a normal hotel room, and you get it for the same price. My kids loved the free cookies every night. The only complaint I have is DO NOT GET the rooms next to the elevator - the elevator is quite noisy. Other than that, highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So close to being excellent, but little things let it down.”
Reviews.Author: mark_webbon
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel after reading Tripadvisor reviews, and wasn't disappointed. My one concern was the hotel's location, in that car access was only from one direction. Most of the time this wasn't a problem, but by the end of our two weeks I was starting to find the necessary u-turns an irritation, especially when traffic was busy. However, the hotel was quiet and clean and the staff that we encountered were all friendly. We did get some noise when the bins were being emptied in the car park below our room, but essentially there was very little road noise and no noise from adjoining rooms. The room was always cleaned well and everything that you could need in the room was available and working. The beds are an aquired taste I guess, but we both found them very comfortable. The free wireless internet service was very slow and the choice of TV channels was not good, but we weren't in the room much so neither of those things were a big deal to us. Overall it was a great stay, but the location would still be my concern for any subsequent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Housekeeping Staff”
Reviews.Author: Groves789
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Radisson while vacationing at Disney World. The room was very clean. The housekeeping staff, especially Suleica, did an outstanding job for us. They were all extremely friendly as well. The location is good, just a quarter mile from the entrance to Disney property. The U-turn is the only inconvenience. The hotel restaurant was overpriced for the value of the meal. We went one time only for the breakfast buffet which cost $13.99 each. The omlet was delicious but everything else was mediocre - The pancakes were crunchy on top like they had been overgrilled, and the waffles on the buffet line were completely cold - like they had been frozen at one time and left on a plate to defrost to room temperature. They weren't warm at all and tasted like bland cardboard. The juice glasses were small and to get a refill required catching the attention of the attendant which wasn't always easy. The sleep number bed wasn't working properly either. I would set it at 70 and in the morning when I woke up I would be sagging in the middle, and I would check it and it had gone down to 35 during the night. I only weigh 130 lbs so it couldn't have been me; obviously it was in need of repair.

Reviews.Title: “Super clean room and very easy to get to Disney”
Reviews.Author: mich1073
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a affordable, nice, easy drive hotel to get to Disney to finish up our passes and well we found it. We stayed for 64 a night with all fees via priceline auction. Great value, could not ask for a cleaner rooom. The only odd thing was the door to toliet room, as it barely cleared to toliet and lord if someone opened the door hile you were seated there, it would be dangerous. But no parking or "resort" fees almost every place in the area charges. Great for what we wanted!!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Beds”
Reviews.Author: PocketAces0813
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I wanted a quick getaway to Orlando, so we stayed over on a Saturday Night. The hotel value, friendliness, rooms and service were all adequate. This hotel uses the Sleep Number beds. Having never been on a sleep number bed, I did not know what to expect. The sleep number beds are just like air mattresses. Whenever I moved I work up my fiance and vice versa. One of the worst night sleeps I have ever had. Apparently I did not "find my number." I let the desk clerk know of my discomfort and lack of sleep when I checked out and she told me "Ok thanks, have a nice day." If the hotel ever changes their beds, I will definitely stay again, but not until then.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel + Great Location = Awesome Getaway”
Reviews.Author: bolgertr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably one of the better hotels I have stayed at in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: britt216
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to DisneyWorld was last April on Spring Break and we were very indecisive on where to stay. We made the perfect choice. The hotel is super clean. The staff is very friendly. When we got back to the hotel at night after a long day the room was spotless from the cleaners. The Sleep Number beds are wonderful!!! Also, there are fresh baked cookies everyday in the lobby. We will stay here every time we come to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and staff but 'creative'photograghy on web site”
Reviews.Author: syl188
Reviews.Content: when you see the web site for this hotel you see the sign with minnie mouse and the hotel behind the sign---some clever photography there!!! never the less the hotel was spotless and the staff were probably some of the nicest i've ever met in the 20+ years going to orlando. the hotel is just off the i4 slip road to lake buena vista, and whereas the traffic noise didn't bother my husband, i was aware of it, didn't stop me sleeping, but you could hear it. my only negative was the pool area had only 2 tables which had the only shade around the pool, it meant that the time i normally spend round the pool was cut as there was no shade at all, and because you could smoke anywhere in the pool area, this was also off putting for the non-smoker. we were offered an amazing deal by the hotel to return next year but as we both have to arrange holiday leave with our employers it meant we were unable to take them up on their offer.

Reviews.Title: “best rooms”
