The only thing of note we found south of the hotel was a Walmart about 10mins away where we stocked up on water and foodstuff (way cheaper than the supermarket in the strip mall to the north). A short distance northeast is Premium Outlet. You can’t access it via the highway and the side road to get to & from gets pretty congested. Across the street to the west is Disney property (keeping in mind that Disneyworld is essentially a campus upon itself). The Radisson is probably one of the closest hotels you can stay at without staying at a Disney resort or an affiliated property. We found access to all the key Disney locations was quick (at least during early December). The highway (versus navigating thru the streets on the campus) seemed quickest the quickest route for us to get to and back from whichever theme park we were visiting that day. To get to Downtown Disney, there’s a “side street” entrance north of the hotel. Additionally, some previous reviews complain about the difficult routing to get back to the hotel from Disney (because of the median). Coming back via the highway, it is not an issue. If you come back via the Downtown Disney side street route, you just need to head south 2mins to the left turn you would take to go Premium and do a U-turn. We drove out to the Universal area to go to Prime Outlet. Although it wasn’t too bad of a trek (along the highway but the return on International drive was pretty slow), I’m not sure if I’d recommend staying here if you were going to spend a lot of time at Universal. Apart from the nearby strip mall, walking to nearby locations probably isn't the best way to spend your time. We were thinking about walking to Premium but that would have been a LONG walk and not very pedestrian friendly. Service We found service fine. No check-in line when we arrived mid day on a Saturday. The front desk people didn’t seem overly friendly but were efficient. Maid service was fine too. Nothing memorable which is a good thing. Room We asked and got a room facing away from the highway based on some other reviews complaining about car noise. Noise didn’t end up being a factor for us. View was ok. Overall, the room was clean and modern looking. Lots of space for the two of us as there was also a sitting area and a desk. Our room had two queen sleep number beds. You can actually feel the change in stiffness but I still think it’s gimmicky. However, my wife, who’s quick to complain about a bad bed didn’t complain. There was a mini-fridge and microwave in the room which we used for liquids, snacks, and breakfast food we picked up from Walmart. Again, we found this to be a big plus for the Radisson. There was also free Internet access in the room; my last big plus for the room since so many other hotels charge for it. The wireless was a bit spotty but the wired connection was solid. The only complaint I had about the room was the bathroom sink. The way it’s designed, you can’t help but splash water everywhere. There's also a safe but kind of small. Miscellaneous The hotel has a free shuttle to the Disney parks but the schedule was pretty limited. If the schedule was more frequent, we would have considered ditching the car rental and just roamed locally apart from a taxi trip to Premium. Having a car ended up being pretty handy (even though we ended up paying for parking at Disney) and driving was pretty easy. We didn’t end up eating at the hotel restaurant but there seemed to be some decent daily specials. There’s a decent sized pool area with hot tub outside which we didn’t use. I don’t recall anyone using the pool but we were usually out most of the day. You can hear quite a bit of street noise. There’s an onsite car rental but we didn’t check out the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, lots to do”
Reviews.Author: Asanya
Reviews.Content: My family decided to stay here for our recent trip to Epcot. It was a pleasant experience. The room was nice, clean, and spacious. The staff was friendly. The view wasn't exactly gorgeous, being a parking lot view, but it was pretty at night with all the lights on. There are several stores nearby, and a miniature golf course called Pirate's Cove. Also, lots of places to eat (TGI Fridays, Red Lobster, Taco Bell, McDonalds...), so we didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant. Plus Downtown Disney was less than 5 minutes away. The first night, we heard some mild noise around 4am. When we talked to the front desk, they said it was because of the elevator and offered to have our room changed. We declined, since it wasn't very loud, but thought the staff was very accommodating and polite about it. You do have to make a u-turn to return to the hotel if coming from a certain direction, but it only adds about 5 minutes to your time. Not a big deal. I didn't even see the pool, or fitness center, so can't really comment on that. However, every thing I did see was fantastic, and I will probably stay here again for my next Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: milliegirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. I had a suite which was large and very clean. Bright colors and really comfortable bed with sleep numbers bed. There were restaurants, liquor store, grocery stores, etc. within walking distance. If you had to catch a cab anywhere in the area, it was usually less than $10.00. Loved the little bar that was open late. Good Seabreezes. Went to restaurant called Bahama Breeze which was close and really cool. Very crowed though. Hotel staff were beyond nice. I do wish there was a shuttle from the airport. A taxi costs $52.00. I went to the Mears bus information center at the airport and got to go to the hotel for $20.00 and the bus was basically a cab.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected....”
Reviews.Author: sdu1627
Reviews.Content: I am originally from the Orlando region and on this trip went home to visity family. I have stayed in loads of hotels in the past 15yrs and this one is by far one of the best ones for the price I paid! The staff was generous, concerning, and always available to assist me. Any questions I had were quickly and promptly answered by all of them. I was there for 3days and 3nights and every service was outstanding, with employees who actually seemed like they appreciated thier jobs and liked to help their customers. I was given acitivity infomation that were located around the hotel and they even had the knowledge of other stores and entertainment in their area. Being located across the street from Disney is what helped me make the decision to book my summer vacation here in one of ther suites. I am ecstatic about returning for the week long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless Hotel, but the beds sealed the deal!”
Reviews.Author: jjkilker
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, sleepnumber beds just like at home and a great room makes me want to go back. This hotel is close to many good restaurants, we walked to Red Lobster right behind the hotel, right off I-4 whats better than that. The Manager, Mr Patel is a great guy so if there ever is a problem ask for him and I know he'll make it right. Bet you don't have one!

Reviews.Title: “Good for WDW visitors”
Reviews.Author: Kellyexcursions
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay with my husband and two children ages 7 and 10. After reading a bunch of reviews I booked the hotel at a price of $90 per night. I have stayed on Disney's premises on at least 7 different occasions at their moderate to luxury hotels. If you can afford $300+ per night, they are usually a very fun place to stay, although the convenience to the parks depends on the hotel and the parks you are visiting. This hotel is directly off Interstate 4's Lake Buena Vista exit. One of the four nights we had horrible traffic on that exit. We left the Magic Kingdom at around 7 pm and I think some of the other parks were closing at that time. Also, there is a Bahama Breeze and some other very popular restaurants directly off the exit ramp. We tried to get into Bahama Breeze and left due to a one hour plus wait. I requested a room away from the elevator after reading the hotel could be a bit noisy. The person at the hotel desk blocked out a room for me in advance. I found our room to be very quiet. My kids were making the most noise. Rooms are a good size, modern and pretty clean. Same goes for the bathroom. The beds were comfortable and overall we had a nice stay. The room has a flat screen tv and a good sized fridge. Not a mini fridge. Also includes a microwave. The pool is small by Orlando standards but we didn't go in it. Being from Miami, we don't go swimming after September and before June so that was not a consideration. I had read some reviews about outstanding management and the like. I had no interaction with them except for the room request and check in. Didn't find anyone to be particularily friendly. They did their job and that's it. However, we had breakfast one morning at the hotel and did have a very enthusiastic waiter who was extremely eager to give us Disney tips. Overall, if you don't want to stay in a low-end hotel, and don't want to spend your retirement money on a week's vacation, I would recommend the Radisson. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you don't plan on getting rest”
Reviews.Author: crappyhotel9
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation over the phone ,requested the family suite I was given a senior discount, we had the 8th floor and even though the beds were sleep numbers they were very uncomfortable, all night long you could hear the elevator running,sounded like construction site. after we checked out they said you don't get a discount on family suites, and come to find after "I got home my account had a $400.00 amount put on hold. this is one of the worst hotels I ever stayed at, if you plan on not SLEEPING and RECEIVING A DSCOUNTED RATE DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting.”
Reviews.Author: mynameismom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Orlando for 2 days prior to our cruise to visit Universal Studios. The hotel was very clean and the check in process was quick. The customer service at the front desk was mediocre, not excellent as previously posted by other guests. Check in receptionist did not smile once the entire time we were at the desk or engage in any type of conversation. She took a call while we were standing there and ignored us. She did do her job by checking us in but definitly not personal in any way. We were also very put off that when we went to the conceirge for directions to downtown disney and inquire about a shuttle service to universal studios the next day, we were given a fast talking sales pitch for a timeshare that wasted 20 minutes of our time. We never did get the directions or answers to any of our questions regarding the local area that we had originally walked down to ask for. We ended up walking out and finding it ourselves because they wouldn't take no for an answer. Our room was very clean and we were satisfied with the overall appearance. We did not have any trouble with noise from the interstate; in fact ,we were very very satisfied by how quiet our room was. I wouldn't reccomend using the in-room safe. We followed the directions precisely and when we entered the password to set it, it set off a horrible shrieking alarm. Called the front desk immediately and was greeted with "wait 30 seconds and it will stop" .There are plenty of options in walking distance (restaurants, mini golf, downtown disney is a 15-20 minute walk) but I recommend renting a car if you want to do anything else in the area as taxi service is not available unless called for in advance and the hotel shuttle was only available to Disney parks and not Univeral Studios. In my opinion, if you are planning a Disney vacation, this is not the hotel. From someone who has been there, staying directly on the Disney property, even if it is the least expensive hotel out there, would be your better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, very close to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Paradisebound1
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at this hotel. Great value! The hotel is located no more than 10 minutes from all the Disney Parks. Great housekeeping-the whole hotel is very clean. There are lots of restaurants nearby. Our room was quiet but the view from the window was the freeway. That didn't bother me and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not awesome, but not bad either”
Reviews.Author: igotyourback
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights for our honeymoon. To be honest, I was a bit bothered by the concierge (if you can call it that) that tried to get us to buy rooms at the Holiday Inn. That was the last thing on my mind when checking into the hotel. She was almost a bit rude to us as well when we politely declined paying another $130 plus dollars. The rooms were nice, although we paid for a King room that was directly located as close to the interstate as possible. Why they would build the rooms there is beyond me. We were able to change to another room that ended up being across the hall from our previous room...guess what...on the other side of the interstate. After I got over my frustration, I bit the bullet and had earplugs handy. **Note, if you plan to go to Orlando for your honeymoon, ask if you can possibly be placed in a room away from other families with children. They will wake up super early and the hotel room doors slam and wake you up.** Overall, the place was fine. The location to restaurants, etc was great.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect....”
Reviews.Author: cruiser1957
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 great nights at this hotel. We booked based on these reviews, and they were "spot on"! Everthing was perfect...it was quiet, staff was top drawer, housekeeping was immaculate, and every need was anticipated and met. I spent much of my life as a "road warrior" and tend to be quite critical of hotels. I couldn't even find a single complaint about this property...unusual for me! A couple of things that will help other travellers to enjoy their stay. First, ask for a room on the back. Second, be prepared to do some u-turns to get into and out of the property, dependent on direction of travel. Restaurants are nearby, many and varied, and all within walking distrance. We tend to be "off property diners", so really can't comment on the hotel restaurant. The fridge and microwave make it possible to enjoy "your" breakfast and beverages in the room, which is both comfortable and money-saving. A WynDixie grocery store is about 10 blocks north on SR535. USA Today is at the elevator lobby on each floor in the morning, and Starbucks coffee is available from 6:00 am in the lobby. Recommended without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lousy internet service!”
Reviews.Author: Multistradaguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week from 2-14-10 to 2-20-10. The hotel was very clean and modern. Rooms were beautiful. Only 6 miles from the Parks and an easy drive. It's within walking distance to many restaurants. But I have to say I was very disappointed with the internet service. I was not able to connect at all the first 4 days. I had maintenance in my room twice and called the front desk twice a day until it finally worked on Thursday night. I had many employees tell me what might be wrong but no one could get it fixed. The only other problem that I had was the annoying pizza delivery guys constantly slipping flyers through our door twice a day. Oh and both printers next to the hotel front desk for public use had no toner and the one at the front desk was so low, they could not scan our boarding passes at the ticket counter, we had to have the airline reprint them for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, Convenient location, Nice hotel overall but...”
Reviews.Author: nstarks
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel last week and am a frequent traveler. I normally stay at the Omni Championsgate but they were booked so I took a chance on this hotel based on the reviews I read. I must say that I was quite impressed with the hotel decor. It was far nicer than I had anticipated. The food is standard so don't expect anything spectacular. For people who are rewards members, don't expect extra points, a free welcome adult beverage or anything of that sort. You will get a welcome letter in your room with a cookie and a pamphlet that instructs you to go to the tour desk for a coupon book. Beware, the coupon book is their attempt to sign you up for a timeshare presentation so unless you want to give up a couple of hours of your time to hear a sales pitch and tour a different property, it will not be of benefit. I began my stay on the 7th floor across from the elevators and I don't recommend this to anyone who is a light sleeper, as the elevator shaft is extremely loud and will keep you awake at night. I was moved twice within three days (712 and then 808) and finally landed in room 817 (nice upgraded room) but it is located behind the elevator shaft and directly below the elevator engine (?), which was even worse (noise wise) so make sure you ask for something far away from the elevator (lower numbers on lower floors..300, 400, 500, 600) because I was told (at checkout) that the lower the floor the better the acoustics from the elevator. Also, make sure you reiterate your request to be away from the elevators when you check in or they will ignore your initiatial preferences on your member notes. I spoke with the manager on the last day of my stay and she assured me that I would receive some of my points back for my inconvenience (still waiting on them) but I suspect they will post to my account soon. Radisson has a satisfaction guarantee so if you are unhappy with any part of your stay, they claim that you won't pay for it so hopefully the amount of points I receive will cover all three nights that I stayed there or at least one night of my three night stay. I didn't get a chance to use the pool because it was entirely too cold but it is small and decent with a hot tub. The gym is small but sufficient. The bar is small but sufficient with drink specials daily and the restaurant was a decent size with decent food. Parking is free and there was sufficient room to park each night. Great staff and convenient location (directly across the street from the road to Downtown Disney). Tons of restaurants, grocery stores, and entertainment in the area so you won't have a problem finding something to eat or do. Overall, I would stay here again because you cannot beat the price, location, and accomodations. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, covenient, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DesignerDave
Reviews.Content: The location virtually right on the main road and with the awful gift shop at the entrance does not bode well on arrival, but the location is otherwise very convenient to Disney Downtown and the hotel itself is smart and comfortable. Approx $120 for a room with 2 queen size beds and a good breakfast (waiter service pancakes, eggs to order, etc). All the necessary is included; parking, WiFi, gym all included and functional.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel and staff is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: happy417
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights and the hotel was very clean and comfortable, very close to disney and universal studios which was great, they offer shuttle to disney if you are looking for this. We have to say the staff was the best we have ever encountered during our stays in a hotel. We spent time in the lounge and the bartenders are amazing very friendly and wonderful to sit and talk with, this made our vacation one of the best we have ever had. We have no complaints about this hotel and plan on staying here again on our next trip to Orlando. Very close to shopping and restaurants which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: 032711o
Reviews.Content: As a Florida resident, I frequently visit Orlando and always choose to stay at the Radisson-LBV. I first stayed at this property about a month after it opened and it still looks just as a new. The check-in is always fast and courteous and the rooms are always spotless. The kitchenette feature is nice, as is the additional sitting area with sofa and desk. I have never had a problem with the FREE wifi here as well. The bathrooms are modern and always extremely clean. In my opinion, the sleep number beds are a little overrated, but still comfortable to sleep on. Finally, the same restaurant inside the hotel continues to improve. During my first stay, the restaurant was about average. During my last few stays, I have noticed that customer service has been excellent, as has been the food. During one stay with a friend, he remarked that an omelet that he ordered at the breakfast buffet was the best that he had ever had. The buffet is excellent and a great way to start off the day. The only suggestion that I would have is with the FREE cookies that the hotel offers guests. When we checked in around 8:00pm, there was about two dozen cookies left. However, after we brought our bags to our room and returned 10 minutes later to grab a cookie, they were all gone. Of course, this was probably due to a "greedy" guest, but I would suggest that the cookies be moved behind the front desk, so that a guest has to ask for them to prevent "hoarding." Again, if you are looking for an excellent hotel that is close to Disney, Universal and all of the other attractions that Orlando has to offer, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SFeldman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our daughter on her first trip to Disney. We booked this hotel because of the great reviews it received. The hotel was clean, check in and check out were fast and the showers were amazing!! The hotel is centrally located, very close to Walt Disney World and many restaurants in the area. The staff was very nice, knowledgable and professional. We did not use the internet service. The only downside would be there was limited shuttle services each way to the parks so we ended up taking a taxi back (which was about $17). Also, there was no breakfast included in the price if you look for that. We are going back in a few months and most likely plan to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: hillsra
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 4 nights of our honeymoon. We booked a jacuzzi suite which was lovely. The jacuzzi was SO nice, everynight when we got in we got a starbucks from the restaurant, ran a jacuzzi (which was in the bedroom) and watched TV. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Its across the road from the entrance to disney world and about 10 mins from universal. Theres LOADS of restaurants within walking distance and orlando outlet stores are right behind the hotel. The only down side (which is why I rated it 4 stars) is that we had a room 530 at the very end of the corridor right next to the staff lift - from about 8am every morning its REALLY noisy. The lift "bings" at EVERY floor and the cleaning staff are NOT quiet chatting/laughing down the corridors cleaning. It wasnt really a problem as we were only there for 4 days we were up early every day but if you were trying to relax and have a layin I could understand being annoyed. Anyway I highly this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Quasimod
Reviews.Content: One of the worst services I ever have experienced. Internet did not work, when I reclaimed, the staff was just laughing, instead of helping. No word of excuse, no "sorry". Increadible. When I had a question about the pool (mini-size and not heated), nobody answered. When I sent the question by mail and fax - no answer. When I asked how to get to Tampa airport - no answer. When I sent my question by mail and fax - no answer. I still can´t believe it. In the room the air was bad, air condition had a very bad smell, windows could not be opened, and it was very, very loud. My stay was a nightmare. It was very hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: peebosity
Reviews.Content: My worst hotel stay for quite a while. I booked a 'superior' room'. What I got was a second floor room next to the elevator area with a view onto a wall. The kicker was that I could not get a wireless or ethernet connection in my room because they had 'run out of IP addresses'. The last time that I stay at a Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, food could be better”
Reviews.Author: Julia_Karant
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights. Got it thru Expedia for £53 a night so a good deal I think. Rooms clean, towels changed every day even when not required, nice TV. Overall great. Cannot really walk anywhere from there but where can you in the US? Food in restaurant was a bit basic and greasy, could be better - that was first night. We only ate there twice and second time pasta was nice, so perhaps don't order a burger and fries...

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: cafekate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Radisson it was very pleasant . The stay at the hotel are very nice and helpful. The cookies are a nice plus and delicious. If you are looking for a nice place to stay the Radisson will fit the bill. Only drawback was the weather was rainy for 3 days and everyone likes nice weather on vacation. My husband and I definately will be back at the Radisson again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: laslototh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I expected after reading the reviews here on tripadvisor. My wife and I wanted an inexpensive place to stay near Disneyworld that was clean, comfortable, quiet, and convenient to the parks. The Radisson Lake Buena Vista was almost a perfect fit. The hotel has been recently remodeled, so its appearance and furnishings were all in good shape. The property is very clean, and the maid service was punctual and efficient. The rooms were very quiet for the most part, although we did hear a truck picking up trash on a couple of mornings about 5:30 AM. We found the staff to be uniformly pleasant and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms themselves are fairly large, with a nice sitting and desk area. The beds are very comfortable. Each room comes with a small fridge and microwave, so it’s easy to stock up on breakfast items, drinks and snacks for the park. The bathroom is laid out nicely and the shower had plenty of hot water. There were a couple of quirks with the room. The safe is located in the closet in an awkward position, and is small. Also, the drawers in the dresser are only about 9 inches deep, so you might have to fold you pj’s to fit them in. Unlike others that wrote here, we never had any problem connecting to the hotels’ free wifi from our room. This hotel is not a resort so don’t expect a lot of on-site amenities. There is a modest pool and hot tub, a small computer area, and an adequate restaurant on the property, but that’s about it. The hotel’s location is convenient to Disneyworld via the Hotel Plaza Boulevard entrance. And it’s a quick return from the Disney parks to the hotel via I-4 (people who complain in this forum about the dreaded U-turn to get back to the hotel should take this route). We didn’t use the transportation that the hotel offers to Disneyworld, so I can’t comment on it. But if all you are looking for is a good place to spend the night, I don’t think you can do much better than the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Elle1030
Reviews.Content: My Spouse and I booked the King bedroom with Jacuzzi for a romantic night. Awesome experience all around. Although the room was a bit more than we were looking for ($$), we left the next morning very pleased with absolutely nothing but excellent things to say about this place. Yes, the location is right by the interstate but that's what makes it perfect..everything is within miles so you wouldn't even need a car! The staff was amazingly friendly. The room alone was BEAUTIFUL and I always have to order more towels in other hotels but not this one...they had more than enough. This will be our next stay when we return, I promise ;) Oh, and the parking is free!...hellooo what are you waiting for! Check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location no need for Car”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the Radisson for a convention. Location is great. You can walk easily to LOADS of restaurants. I did rent a car....Thrifty from the Airport. BEWARE OF THRIFTY AT MCO!!! I rented the car and was not told about their new policy.....you must buy gas within 10 miles of the airport of the day of drop off AND show them a receipt proving this! The info is noted in tiny print on the rental agreement. I bought gas the night before ...13 miles away and they charged me $8.44 a gallon since I did not follow the rules. Wow....the total extra charge was over $20.00 for 3 miles that I went "extra" according to their policy. THEY say it is to help the next rental customer have a full tank...when it is really a scam so they can get extra cash on the rental for $8.44 a gallon!!! Anyway, hotel is very clean. Rooms are nice with coffee, fridge, microwave. Restaurant was ok with a nice little bar. Easy to get on and off highway but on weekends if you do have a car driving in the area will be horrible. Took me 1 hour to go 1/2 a mile. Loads of restaurants, hotels and traffic. I found it easy to walk to Landry's, Bahama Breeze, etc with only a 10-20 minute walk which was quicker than driving. Good value for the price at this hotel. I would probably stay again for price and location for a convention (it had shuttle service nearby to Gaylor Palms and Marriott World Center).

Reviews.Title: “Would have loved it if located anywhere else....”
Reviews.Author: teachermomVirginia
Reviews.Content: If this hotel were located anywhere else, I would have probably felt that I had a better experience. Here were the positives: the hotel seemed clean and the room was big and comfortable. The WIFI wasn't working when we initially arrived but was fixed a few hours later. The service at the front desk was pleasant and helpful. There was a restaurant with decent food, although leisurely service. Overall, the hotel itself (although facing the highway, a somewhat tacky gift shop and Waffle Shop) was decent. But I felt somewhat mislead (and therefore dissatisfied) with the hotel because of its location and the purpose of our visit. We chose this hotel because we were visiting DisneyWorld over Christmas vacation. When making the reservation, we asked if it was located close to Disney and did they have shuttles to visit the DIsney World. We were told yes to both questions. Since my dad was visiting with us and would be using the truck for business that day, my 6-year-old and I were planning on either walking (since the hotel was close to Disney) or using the shuttle to get to the Magic Kingdom. Neither of those options would have been very useful. The hotel is close to Disney. But Disney is like the size of Manhattan and the hotel is not close or within walking distance of the part of DIsney that you'd be likely to visit---it's pretty close to Downtown Disney, true, but not close to the Magic Kingdom, Epcot, the water parks or Animal Kingdom. I've run marathons and would not have been able to walk to any part of the park not involving shopping, much less a child or when making the return trip. The shuttles were not adequate either. In reading a manager's response to another view, I gather that they now have added a shuttle (still not adequate in my opinion). At the time, they had 2 shuttles to Epcot and 1 shuttle to the Magic Kingdom (none to any other part of the park). The one to the Magic Kingdom left at about 10:30 and returned 12 hours later. Really? The Magic Kingdom is geared to families with small children. Are they really going to spend 12 hours at the park without a break or let little kids stay up past 10:30 at night? Keep in mind that there was a note on the shuttle schedule indicated that the schedule was not exact and that you should show up early and expect the possibility that the shuttle might run a little late. So a 10:30 p.m. shuttle might not show up until 10:45 or 10:50 (but people should be there waiting at 10:10 or 10:15) and might not deposit you back at the hotel until closer to 11 or 11:15. I imagine the manager's response will indicate that they have added a shuttle or that you can take a shuttle to Epcot and then use Disney transportation to get to another park. Adding another shuttle would not really provide an adequate amount of service to make it easy to get back and forth to the part (it would still leave huge gaps in the day where you were stranded there) and taking a shuttle to another park and then using a bus or monorail to get somewhere else ends up meaning a hour long commute either way. As I said, I would have loved this hotel if it were located anywhere else. I would have liked this hotel a lot better if it was more straightforward in its description of its location and use of shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have stayed at for Business”
Reviews.Author: ranndella
Reviews.Content: I must say, I am usually worried about the types of places my company will allow me to stay on business. If I were traveling for a vacation, I would not typically think of staying at a Radisson, I much prefer "luxury" resorts. However, I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It was located right off of I-4, which made traveling home from my meetings a breeze. It is near many restaurants, Disney, gas stations, etc. Besides the location, the hotel staff immediately greeted me at check in - no waiting in line. They were very friendly. The hotel was very clean, nicely decorated, and it was very simple to check in, which I greatly needed after a hard days work. I checked into the room and it was perfect. Spacious, microwave, refridgerator, comfortable beds, very clean and nice tv, good channels. I tried to get a drink from the vending machine and it wouldn't take my dollar, so room service brought me a soda free of charge for my hassle. Being that I am a Floridian and travel frequently to Orlando, I may just dump my other "luxury" hotels and stay at this one because this one has many more ammenities including free wi-fi. You get everything free of charge, versus the other hotels you pay for wii fi, no fridge, no microwave. This is the perfect place to come with kids and an inexpensive option to staying at Disney resorts, which do not have the same features. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brwnlab
Reviews.Content: Great place, nice rooms, clean, friendly, and a great location! Sleep number bed is great. Rooms offer a fridge and mircowave, free wifi, and a nice clean space to relax! Friendly staff, and great housecleaning crew. Excellent location for Disney, you are looking at the entrance to Downtown Disney from the hotel. Location is great for dinning off Disney property, plenty of good dinning choices. Highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: udxp14
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 9 nights in December. We chose this hotel simply because of the comments on Tripadvisor. We surprisingly got a great rate linked in with an AMEX promotion. We have been to Florida 8 times now - and this has to be the best accomodation we have enjoyed, in the best location with the best service. The location is perfect for everything - for the parks, shopping and eating. The staff - awesome - from the minute you check in. Bedrooms - stylish and comfortable - with great sleep number beds. Room service - top notch. Wifi - in the room. Also NO stealth resort fee or car parking fee lumped on top on arrival. All in all a very positive experience and a credit to the Radisson chain. A special mention to Chef Mark -who again is an absolute credit to this hotel and typifies the high level of service and hospitality you receive here -----10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, good service and great value”
Reviews.Author: jogjacrew
Reviews.Content: The sleep number beds in this hotel add so much to the comfort level. The stowaway bed in the sofa was an added bonus--yes it sagged, but the mattress can easily be put on the floor, and the sheets to make up the bed were folded inside the sofa bed! I needed extra blankets, sheets and decaf tea; roomservice brought it up in under 5 minutes. The linens were soft and really pretty--a duvet and feather pillows on each bed. My one complaint was the blanket which roomservice brought up--it felt like very thin foam. It was warm, but the texture wasn't pleasant. The rooms are beautifully appointed with carpet on the floors, a large flatscreen TV on the wall, and fridge and microwave. Washbasin was very modern, but I had to laugh at a few small things like that when you turn the water on low it leaks sprays out of the basin and onto the beautiful granite counter top! Great location within spitting distance of Hwy 4,around the corner from Disney, not far from factory outlet stores, no extra fees like parking, an enormous giftshop next door with all your would want to buy at really great prices. B-fast wasn't included but at $74 in this area, I wasn't complaining!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Adventures11
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. I had misplaced the password information for the wi-fi and the front desk answered my questions with a smile. The surprise for me was sleep number beds. At the end of the day visiting the Magic Kingdom, crisp white sheets and extra fluffy towels are nice after a long soak in the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but hardly #1”
Reviews.Author: xTravellerx
Reviews.Content: Location near Disney World is very good, as well as the 3-4 daily complimentary shuttles to Disney World and back. Room was rather spacious and comfortable, but very, very damp. You felt the dampness in the air the moment you stepped in, and in the morning you literally could not see out from the window because the glass was so wet. One reason for the dampness of our room was probably the in-room jacuzzi, which was - oddly- located in the bedroom, and not in the bathroom. Room service, and service in general was very good. Breakfast was average, but quite reasonably priced. There were no juice, coffee or other drinks in the buffet table, but you had to ask the waiters to bring them to you glass by glass. There definitely was a lot of noise coming from the outside. Because of the rumble of the nearby highway, I had to wear ear plugs to be able to sleep. The hotel offered free wi-fi, and there was a business centre with 2 computers and printers, although only one computer was working. Overall the stay was quite comfortable, although overpriced in our case. I don't understand why this hotel is currently the number 1 in Orlando. The other hotels there must be pretty lousy, if this hotel is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel but definetly not #1”
Reviews.Author: Carolcc
Reviews.Content: Couldn't agree more with the recent posts. I booked the hotel, partially based on reviews on tripadvisor, and found it just ot be an above average "side of the expressway" hotel. The rooms were nice and service was fine. The pool is tiny and basically in the parking lot. Its not a place to stay if you want a hotel experience. If you plan to just come back from the parks and only sleep there, its a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bella246
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good size room. Slept very well, didn't hear any noise from outside or the elevator, as others have stated. Didn't care for the sinks, because I have small children that couldn't reach it. Shower curtain had a big hole in it, I didn't undrestand how that was overlooked, was somewhat dissappointed, because of the great reviews. Friendly and helpful staff. Good location close to everything. Would probably stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel....but hardly justifies #1 rating”
Reviews.Author: wstcstwil
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and pretty typical for a Radisson in my experience. But given all the really nice hotels in the area I can hardly see how this would justify a #1 rating. We took a trip down a few days after Christmas to visit my gf's grandparents. We stayed in one of their superior rooms which was absolutely huge. It was setup real nice with two queen beds and was big enough for a family. Probably one of the biggest rooms I have ever stayed in for the price (paid about $150 with an amex promotion over christmas week). Huge flat screen on the wall and very comfortable beds. Didn't make it down to the pool but it looked very nice and the restaurant was good and well priced. The bad part of this hotel is that it is but isnt close to the attractions. We didn't have a car so it cost about $15 to get to seaworld and $25 to get to epcot each way. If you rent a car its not really a problem. Its on a kinda seedy stretch of 535 next to a wafflehouse and gift shop. So you drive up to the place and are initially underwhelmed. Would I stay here again? Yes. But probably if I was traveling on business and not with my girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not #1!”
Reviews.Author: cdfsvdfddfv
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms for a hotel, great beds, recently rennovated so they were in great shape. The location is convenient but the hotel is like 100 feet from the Interstate. Walking distance to 5 or 6 good moderate restaurants and fast food. This is not a resort and doesn't offer many of the resort extras. This is ORLANDO, home of DIsney - there is no WAY this is the best hotel in the area - Don't get me wrong, it's a nice standard hotel in a convenient location and can be a good value in high season but there are many better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoPink
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good. The room were clean and comfortable. The location is also excellent. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT #1, Camera stolen, Bad location”
Reviews.Author: temp4rebecca
Reviews.Content: I trust and rely onTrip Advisor reviews and this is the first of a dozen times that it steered me to a very poor hotel. This hotel is in a terrible location. The only thing you can really walk to it a dirty gift shop and waffle house. The complaint of not being able to get into the hotel when returning from Disney is valid and an ENORMOUS hassle. The first opportunity to make a u-turn is a half mile down the road in stop and go traffic. After a day at the parks with small children, this can be an EXCRUCIATING 20+ minute wait. However, the worst part of this stay was when my $600 Nikon camera was stolen at the pool when I was there with my kids. The front desk staff refused to assist in any way. They have security cameras and pool key swipe cards that could have been checked but they acted like I was bothering them by even asking. They refused to let me hang a small sign in the pool area. Every picture from the trip and from the month prior were lost. The prices at this hotel are good but they definitly draw a different crowd from other disney hotels. I would recommend people look at the Hilton or other hotels along the Downtown Disney hotel zone. We didn't go inside the Hilton but it looked very nice and the location was awesome (you could easily walk to Downtown Disney).

Reviews.Title: “$650 Stolen out of room! Do not trust this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kiwi_chameleon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our vacation from Oct 21 - Nov 2. We put up the do not disturb sign on our door as we did not need maid service and left for the day. When we returned to the room, we discovered our room made up by the maid and that $650 in cash was taken out of our room safe while we were gone. No one on staff approached me to try to discuss the issue after I brought it to their attention. I had to seek them out each time I wanted to know what was going on and if they had investigated anything. Convenient that the day that we asked for maintenance to come fix our beds (sleep numbers weren't working properly) they didn't come because of the do not disturb sign, but that the maid service DID enter our room when we specifically requested them to not make up the room. Notice the ONLY day on our trip this happened was the day that the money went missing. Very interesting if you ask me... This is the SECOND time a Radisson hotel has allowed someone access to my room that was unauthorized. The previous occurrence was in Portland, Oregon, but the missing money was recovered that time. My advise, don't stay at this hotel. They are untrustworthy, treat any issues with little care, and have been giving me the run around now for 2 months.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: Camel100
Reviews.Content: stayed here to visit the disney parks and orlando's outlet. great location as long as you are driving to the parks (although i think i also saw shuttle buses there). rooms were clean and spacious, although the hotel is on a busy road - so not the quietest. nevertheless i thought it was very comfortable (you can even adjust the firmness of the bed!) & good value for a 3* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson is a very Disney Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalibuNortheastPenna
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to Down Town Disney. The hotel itself is right off I-4--plenty of parking. Very nice restaurant inside, good selections, reasonable prices. Rooms were very comfortable and spacious. We specifically stayed there to try the Sleep Number Bed. Not sure we really liked the bed, but the hotel itself could bring us back. Despite being close to the highway, it was very quiet, clean and modern. Offering free internet connection was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service”
Reviews.Author: surferbabe8445
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I decided to get away for the weekend and stay in a hotel and go to Disney. We booked our first night through hotels.com and were expecting to use a free night we had earned through them for the last night. The people at hotels.com would not allow us to use it so we were stuck without a hotel for the next night. The two men at the desk Brandon and Stephen, helped us deal with the people at hotels.com and booked us another night in our same room at a discounted rate. They were very accomodating and went out of their way to help us when we were dealing with horrible customer service from hotels.com. The only complaint I would have is having to make a u-turn in order to get to the hotel from disney and the towels were a little scratchy but the customer service and quality of the rooms was much more than I expected for the price. Great for a quick get away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreamp0lice
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great customer service. Stayed here for 8 nights on our Disney trip and firstly could not believe the size of the room. We stayed in a family room with two queen size beds and in a room to the side - the biggest king size bed we had ever seen. Did not like the sleep number bed - one of the beds had a slow leak so by the morning you woke up very squishy & the children in the room above thought it was a great game to put them up & down all night - very noisy. Other than that - it was a great location for our purposes however i would reccomend having a car becuase there is not much within walking distance. Very good hotel for a family vacation. Staff are AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “You need to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bruce-Two
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated #1 on tripadvisor and that is why we selected it. Great Hotel. Decoration was fantastic, price is great and the location is just outside the Downtown Disney front gates. Select Comfort beds. A very modern room design too. Flat screen TV, fridge, microwave, large room and fancy bath. Recommendation - Eighth floor rooms have a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - everything close by !”
Reviews.Author: traveler_cin63bau
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing we could say about our hotel experience is being hit by timeshare people (booth is located in the lobby beside front desk) and falling for their sales pitch. No, we did not purchase timeshare but wasted 3 hours of our precious vacation time trying to say NO to them. However, we did get discounted tickets for Walt Disney World and dinner show at cost. Good things definitely outway the above experience - very friendly staff, excellent room, internet accessible, great flat screen TV, separate sofa & desk area, beautiful washrooms, fridge & microwave in room, room very clean, beds comfortable, no noisy air conditioner, very quiet hotel (could not here other guests), convenient parking and right beside Interstate 4 for quick access (especially when coming out of Disney World) and down the street to entrance to Disney Beuna Vista Drive (Downtown Disney). Other attractions like Sea World, Universal Studio 10 mins away using either International drive or I4. Affordable eating restaurants all close by and in walking distances - Waffle House, McDonalds, Taco Bell, Perkins, etc. If it wasn't for the presence of timeshare people in the hotel, this would be a 5 out of 5 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kivapierce
Reviews.Content: New Hotel, Great rooms, Welcoming check in staff, superb beds. Excellent value. Best hotel we stayed in on our 14 day trip to FL. Would recommend it to anyone....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect price!”
Reviews.Author: zand05
Reviews.Content: There is a good reason this is rated #1 with Tripadvisor! We were very impressed with how nice this hotel was. The room decor was fantastic, beds extremely comfortable, and everything very clean. Each room comes with a microwave, small refrigerator, and a coffee maker. Breakfast in the restuarant was quite good, with a nice selection at the buffet. We especially enjoyed the bonus "to go" cup of coffee we received. The best thing about this hotel is the fabulous price we got it for on Priceline! Wow! Incredible quality for a great value. It is also very convenient to Disney, being just one exit down from Epcot. There is also a free shuttle to Epcot but only running for a few trips each day. We have had to move over to the Double Tree Castle Hotel for a business conference and are very sad to leave the Radisson. There is no comparision!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDaniels
Reviews.Content: The #1 rating on your site is well understood. We didn't know what to expect and were pleasantly surprised - it was just perfect! The location has easy freeway access to/from the airport, great access to Disney World sites, and has lots of restaurants nearby. The lobby is roomy and comfortable with easy chairs, couches, a large screen TV and evening cookies. There's a small lobby bar as well - very cozy. good place for a drink, coffee, or cappuccino. The rooms are well appointed and up to date; Sleep Number beds, down quilts, desk and loveseat in the sitting area, shiny black bathroom tiles with the latest in sink, faucets and countertop added to the rooms appeal. There was also a fridge and microwave for our use. Housekeeping staff were pleasant and kept our room exceptionally clean and sparkling. We had a super rate via our Entertainment Books hotel booking procedure. We feel we received a great deal more than what we paid. All in all we can't say enough about this hotel; we look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: jezabell2
Reviews.Content: Cannot compliment this hotel enough! Was spotlessly clean, rooms lovely & bright. We were the first one near the elevator and there was no noise what so ever. Loads of parking. Good few restaurants within walking distance. Only a few minutes away from Disney. Near one of the many outlet centres. Will definately be back next year

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay and great for the price”
Reviews.Author: veno
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel and we felt was all round a really good experience for the price we paid. We had no problem finding the hotel itself from Orlando airport and location wise was fine for what we wanted, being 15-20 minute drive from both the airport and Universal Studios, we did not visit Disney so cannot comment on access. The surrouding area also had all we needed, right next to the hotel is a retail park with a number of family based restaraunts, nothing too fancy but good selection available. The outlet stores where we managed to pick up a few bargains were also only a short drive. The hotel itself was welcoming and well appointed throughout, nice size swimming pool, breakfast in the restaraunt was a reasonable price and quality. Our room was again well appointed, spacious, good beds and well cleaned. The staff were all friendly and courteous and made us feel welcome, the fresh cookies each afternoon were also a nice touch. Overall important to remember the price and rating of this hotel, we felt that taking this into consideration we could not have expected or asked for any more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service and Immaculate Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cct1000
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this new hotel. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. The beds are sleep number beds so you are able to adjust the firmness on each side of the bed. The design of the lobby is great because there are two main entrances: from the read and front parking lots, so when you arrive back from the theme parks late, and park in the last remaining spots, it is not a long walk to the lobby. The bar and restaurant are excellent options. The front desk staff are well trained - there is a concierge for travel advice, restaurants, etc. The location is great for many restaurant choices along Vineland. The drive to Disney is about 10 minutes. It is an elegant, upscale hotel at a reasonable price. I stayed with my wife and 2 year-old for two nights in a very comfortable large room with a refrigerator, loveseat and flat screen television (also used the wi-fi with my iPhone). We very much enjoyed the accomodations. A nice value for $100/night. Finally, I left my Blackberry in the safe in the room. I called the hotel the next day and left a message. They called me back, located the Blackberry and mailed it back to me in a secure package (complete with packing materials) charging for the cost of the shipping. What a great result! I honestly have no negatives to say about this hotel, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kathy351
Reviews.Content: My stay was perfect. I got the hotel on Hotwire for an amazing price. It was close to Disney Downtown, Epcot, and Disneyland but at the last minute I decided to go to Universal Studios. No need to take high priced transportation. I walked to the Outlet Mall and caught a trolley to Universal Studios. I also caught the express public transit bus to the airport for $2 instead of $55 taxi, or $35 shuttle. The bus stop was just across the street. The room had 2 sleep number beds, excellent TV, large sitting area with desk. The staff was excellent. The laundry was quick and easy to use. I have no complaints and hope to stay in another Radisson hotel on my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: chayton6
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay 'off site' for the first 2 nights of our 11 night Walt Disney World trip. This was our family's first ever vacation to WDW and I was happy to find this hotel at such an affordable rate and the reviews on TripAdvisor were so very positive. After staying here, we were spoiled rotten and were sorely disappointed in the Port Orleans Riverside resort that we spent the remainder of our vacation in. If I had it to do-over, I would spend our entire vacation at the Radisson. We booked through Priceline, but unlike every other hotel we've booked through Priceline, we were still treated like first class customers. We were given a 5th floor room away from the elevators with 2 queen beds and a pull out sofa for our family of five. The beds are sleep number beds with elegant 'Martha Stewart' ish decor, incredibly comfy linens, and the room is just really well appointed and lovely. This was so much more than I expected for the price we paid. This room on Disney property would easily be $400 a night or more. The room included a small fridge and microwave and coffee maker, flatscreen wall mounted TV with cable, etc. We saw no bugs at all, the AC worked very well, and there was no noticeable noise in our room from other travelers or the elevators. The view was across the highway and at night we enjoyed the 'neon horizon' of Orlando. Some people may not like that type of view, but for us it was lovely. Lisa, from the desk downstairs, seemed to always be at work and always had a fantastic smile and personality. Our train arrived at 10:30 am, well before their check in time, yet she had our room ready for us with a smile. We had thought we would have to wait a few hours but nope, she had us in our room within minutes with a smile. And we were SO happy to relax and spend the day by the pool. Actually, the pool is my only "Con" for this review - its a lovely pool, very clean, and they have a hot tub. But it may well be the ONLY unheated pool in all of Orlando. My boys had really looked forward to swimming but in early November they simply couldn't spend more than a few minutes in there before running to the hot tub area. Their onsite bar and restaurant were both great and we had excellent service. One night my son dropped a glass and it broke - the staff immediately moved us to a completely new table, with a understanding and a smile - we were made to feel like family by every single person we encountered at this hotel. My next happy surprise was that they have a taxi service that they've apparently contracted with to provide service to Disney at $10 each way. I loved that I didnt have to guess or wonder. Even if someone could say "You could get the same trip for $8" - I was far happier knowing, in advance, exactly how much the trip would be for our family of FIVE. The taxi operator even happily placed a car seat in so that my 4 year old felt safe and happy. He provided his card for us and when we were ready to leave, he picked us up right at the entrance, where we were (we didnt have to walk all the way back to where he dropped us off), and had the car seat ready to go - with a great smile, and again, making us feel like welcome family. If I had any question or request, Lisa was always happy and courteous with a response. I was never made to feel like a bother and I always felt like she wanted me to be comfortable and happy with our experience. And I was! I cannot say enough about how great it felt to stay at this hotel. No, there is no 'resort landscaping' like at POR, but I happily traded that for the more than excellent decor and comfort INSIDE where it counted!! Who wants to walk a mile to get to your restaurant? We took the elevators downstairs and were immediately seated with no crowds. Since we used the taxi service, we never had any trouble with getting in to or out of the hotel from the highway. It was simply taken care of. A far better experience than the on site Disney busses we dealt with the remainder of our stay - and even with the cost of the taxi, this hotel was far cheaper than our on site hotel! There is free, if slow, wifi and a nice fitness center downstairs. There is a tiki bar/snack place next to the pool in addition to the bar inside the lobby near the restaurant. Maid service was fantastic. I loved coming back to my room to find everything clean and tidy, but also they had taken the time to lay out a small hand towel in the bathroom and carefully arrange our personal things out instead of all jumbled up in a corner as I had left them. It felt like having a personal butler. Again, if I return to Disney, I will stay HERE without a second thought! Far cheaper than onsite Disney and far and away NICER!! I truly loved it and would recommend it with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, watch the free complimentary tickets though!”
Reviews.Author: joninlondon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my trip with a mate in November - primary purpose was the location for the theme parks, disney etc. Hotel was clean, service very good, nice pool. I would recommend this hotel, though a few niggly points: - the poolside music was awful, many people commented on it though the staff told us that the radio channel wasnt allowed to be changed - it did our heads in after a while -- they need to get a chill out lounge CD or two! - on checking in they gave us complimentary tickets to disney parks "just go over to the concierge to collect them". In fact this was a time share tour - you get booked in for your tour and then a hard sell and then you would get your tickets. Many guests seemed to get sucked into this. Never experienced this with a Raddisson - and I think its a practice they need to cease immediately. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great value, but with some reservations (pardon the pun)”
Reviews.Author: Esspee
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our brief 4 night stay in Orlando purely as it has the #1 ranking on Trip Advisor. We were intrigued to see what such an affordable hotel had done to deserve such high praise! It was certainly easy to find, taking I-4 from the airport took only 20 minutes. Check-in was excellent, on the basis of the feedback on Trip Advisor we asked for a room situated away from the elevators and they were only too happy to oblige (I bet they get that a lot nowadays!). The room itself was of a very good standard, with 2 queen beds which you could adjust the firmness of the mattress on. Every amenity was present - Plasma screen TV, seating area, fridge, safe, iron & ironing board, microwave and even a hairdryer (my wife was very pleased with the last one). The bathroom was clean and well presented, although it was slightly on the small side and getting in & out the shower was made awkward by the presence of the loo right next to it! Overall though this didn't present too much of a problem. Probably the biggest bug-bare with the room would be the air conditioning. The unit was exceptionally noisy, and if you had it set on auto to keep the room at a constant temperature, you would undoubtedly be woken during the night. There was occasional noise at night from other guests, but nothing too serious. Our room was on the opposite side of the building to I-4 so I can't comment about noise from the traffic. One other concern was with wi-fi access. I couldn't connect via my mac despite the network being visible and using the passwords provided (I see other reviewers have had the same issue). There are two PCs in the reception that are free to use (they have a printer connected too), but again web connectivity fluctuated. So maybe not a concern for everyone, but for any Facebook or Trip Advisor addicts out there, it's something to bear in mind. Obviously we didn't spend too much time in the hotel itself, as Orlando has plenty to offer! And here is where the major problem with this place makes itself apparent - although its location is fantastic in terms of proximity to both Universal and the Disney Parks, getting out of the facility is next to impossible at busy times as traffic backs up from a nearby junction. If you are heading to Universal or International Drive, or Disney via I-4, you'll need to make an immediate U-turn after joining the traffic, and if it's busy this will be prevented by stationary cars. Getting into the hotel can also be a pain, and completely impossible if you're approaching from the North on S. Apopka, or the East on I-4. In either of those instances you will be forced to go past the hotel and make U-turns on busy junctions - time it wrong and hit red lights and this can add 10 minutes to your journey time, frustrating when you are so near the hotel (and yet so far). So that probably sounds very negative, and it's true that access in and out did prove frustrating. However if you're getting out and about and avoiding the heavier periods, you'll have no problem once you've figured out which direction to approach from. In summary I would say that we were largely very pleased with our stay and we would have no hesitancy in returning. Based on what we paid this was a fantastic bargain, and being so close to all the major Orlando attractions was an added bonus. Access in and out was the only real concern we had, but after a day or so we figured it out and got our directions of approach sorted - I'm sure you'll do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: upgraydme
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for 3 nights in early November after reading the recommendations here and am glad I did. Rooms are very clean and spacious in comparison to many hotels. Brilliant location just off the highway and near the attractions but not noisy. Also there's an abundance of places to eat within a 5 min drive or walk and every cuisine you can think of. I read the comments about noise from the elevator keeping people awake so when checking in requested a room as far away as possible (which is always a minimal distance but enough that you're not disturbed when sleeping) Rooms beginning 401, 501 etc are furthest away. Enjoyed the pool and hot tub each day and had both to ourselves for the duration. Only have a couple of gripes. Constant jazz music plays over the speakers by the pool and it becomes tiresome after a while. More contemporary music would've been welcome. Also, if you're not a big breakfast person and looking for something light then you're better off going elsewhere. I paid $1.60 for a banana which seemed a ridiculous price. Coffee is way overpriced too. Paid $2.80 for a coffee at the bar. The Waffle House (open 24 hrs) is across the car park from the hotel so would suggest people nip over there for a coffee. Also some of the staff are inexperienced, unhelpful and provided minimal assistance when asked where the nearest bank was or why the internet wasn't working. Overall though I loved my stay and this hotel did exceed my expectations. Remember to pick up your free freshly baked cookies from the reception area every afternoon. They are delicious, especially if you put them in the fridge for a while or heat them in the microwave! (fridge and microwave in room) I highly recommend this hotel, especially for European's that are researching the many hotels in Orlando and looking for value for money. You will be pleasantly surprised, promise.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME FOR THE VALUE”
Reviews.Author: dineshbande
Reviews.Content: We had a warm welcome from the staff and they did let us check in a couple of hours earlier than schedule( shows commitment towards service and not business unlike many other hotels). Lobby was maintained clean and attractive. Parking was free( Isn't that cool for a place like Orlando). Rooms were clean, well maintained and we had a micro oven and a mini refrigerator right inside the room. Internet was high speed and free!!!!!!!!!!! Guys and gals, I have stayed in hotels like Sheraton in San Diego (31/2 star), Rosen Shingle creek, Orlando ( 4 star) as a part of the same vacation and I bet experience at Radisson was far more better than any of these places. In my view comfort is more than any name or star rate of the hotel. A 4 star hotel is no good if you have to take 15 minutes to take your wallet out and start putting in numbers to get internet and if you have to swipe in and swipe out ur card everytime u park ur car. I would rather prefer hotels putting in their final price including everything( as Radisson did) than surprising me with hidde charges and tons of discomfort. Finally, this place was closest to Disney, ok form Universal( if u have a car--5-10 minutes drive, Wet n wild 5-10 min, Seaworld-5- 10 min, Aquatica- 5-10 min), walkable form Orlando premium outlets mall, less than 5 min drive from lake Buena vista outlet factory, nearest walmart is less than 5min ( in case if u prefer having some milk, cereal, some fast foods form oven). I would wholeheartedly suggest people to stay here and I have no questions in my mind to say that my stay here has doubled my joy of vacationing in Orlando!!!!!!! I wil definitely stay in the same place if I ever visit Orlando again....

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel. Great Location. Excellent Staff. Right by Disney”
Reviews.Author: Johnson131
Reviews.Content: If you are doing the whole theme park (Disney/Universal/Epcot) thing and want a hotel that is perfectly located for all the fun and excitement - look no further than the Radisson Lake Buena Vista. The hotel is brilliantly located right by the entrance to Disney. There are shuttle buses to the park for hotel guests. PRICE- The hotel is such good value. You are pretty much on the Disney resort without paying the 'Disney' prices! ROOMS- Rooms are really spacious. They have Sleep Number beds which you can adjust to the softness or firmness that you desire. Bathrooms are small but perfectly formed. TV and digital TV. Desk. Fridge - We put a few snacks in there from the shops at Crossroads Mall. There is a great 24hour supermarket. BREAKFAST- Really great. Lovely staff. Everything you could possibly want! Excellent service. HOTEL LOBBY - Free internet access. Sofas. TVS. Bar - serving Starbucks coffee. Really great iced coffees. SHUTTLE BUS - There are shuttle buses to Disney/Epcot. Also a shuttle bus to LAKE BUENA VISTA Factory Mall. STAFF - The staff are simply brilliant! Friendly, kind, professional. If you do go make sure to look out for Luke the barman and Ken the chef. Both top guys! SWIMMING POOL - We didn't use the swimming pool but it looked very good.

Reviews.Title: “great value, but do not stay in rooms 811 and 813”
Reviews.Author: Kortenbergtraveler
Reviews.Content: based on the rating on tripadvisor and the great price of a superior room for two kids and 3 adults at only usd 75, why should you stay somewhere else ? everything is great and good and rather cheap, certainly if you are from Europe ..., but there are a few very tiny minor things to keep in mind : the pool is big and nice and with good sofa's, but not heated ... which would be good in this time of year; secondly we asked for a high room, but 811 and 813 if you are a light sleeper, like my wife, you will be woken up by the low but often present noise of the elevator engines; thirdly if you are there for the view of decoration of a 4star hotel, well you have the view on an ugly kind of fluorescent blue gift shop building at the front, a parking lot and the I4 highway at the back and side ... and inside there is a mixture of styles with a sixties like swarowski produced ceiling lights in the lobby, lots of different granite and marble colours all over, and futuristic Epcot like mirrors and seats when you step out of the elevators on each floor; again, just minor things and you should certainly stay there if you want to go do Disney; good shuttle service to Epcot and Magic Kingdom, but you have to hop over at the Epcot parking lot, or take your own car to like Animal Kingdom or their two waterparks; oh yes, very unfortunately they DO NOT HAVE any whatsoever REDUCTIONS for any park (for 3 adults and 2 kids, for 3 days, we paid 1087 usd ... and got a reduction of yes, 11 dollars !!!) unless you qualify for the customer service desk lady as a potential target for selling a timeshare thing (so do say you are from Colombia, as the people in front of me did get a substantial reduction as they agreed to be brainwash targets for those time share sales guys ... so remember COLOMBIA)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much we want to go back again in two months”
Reviews.Author: schesterst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stumbled on this hotel after our originally booked hotel was so horrible we decided not to stay. We just drove by and went in to ask for vacancy. The front desk gave us a great rate and the room was amazing. Everything is new and clean and comfortable. Everyone of the staff was wonderful - especially Chef Mark. The restaurant, which is not busy for some unknown reason, was wonderful!! My husband and I ate all of our meals there. The prices are as good or better than the local restaurants and what could be more convenient! The shuttle service was easy and it was so nice to have the computers in the lobby to print out our boarding passes to fly home. This hotel saved what would have otherwise been a ruined trip!! We can't wait to go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotelroom ever”
Reviews.Author: SecondTry
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotelroom ever. Nice beds and large rooms with a dedicated "office" area. The hotel is located close to the Downtown Disney area. I definately liked the room the best and I can honestly say that I do not have any dislikes about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: WORLD_TAVELLER_9
Reviews.Content: Me and fiance were coming to Disney world for the first time and we stayed at this hotel solely due to the recommendation of trip advisor, and we were not dissapointed. The hotel was conveniently located, the ambiance was great and the hotel room was clean, comfortable and equipped with all modern amenities. The shuttle service was great and always on time, and the housekeeping staff were on top of everything. The only negative thing I can think off was the time share booth right next to the check in counter and I will strongly advise future visitors, to STAY AWAY from the booths. Overall the hotel was excellent and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thi Hotel is Average”
Reviews.Author: JoeTrvlr
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is rated #1? I don't get it. It is right next to I-4 (noisy). The staff was indifferent and had a hard time staying on task when I was checking in. The room I received was right outside of the elevator door (noisy). It is possible I got a substandard room because I booked on Orbitz. There was no remote control to the T.V. when I called down to the desk he acted like I had stolen it. I had to suggest getting another remote to my room. Even taking the slightly negative experiences I went through, this hotel is just average. The rooms are clean and furnishings nice. On the whole not a #1 though.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneymiffy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay here again. The service was excellent, the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, spacious, quiet, comfortable and offered a nice view. Beds were great, and you could adjust the mattress firmness. The hotel lobby was beautiful, lifts were fast and the fitness centre had great equipment and included a TV. Great location near Disneyworld, not far from Universal studios and premium outlets for excellent shopping. Also has room service, take out delivery and nice restaurants right next door to the hotel. The hotel's own restaurant is also quite nice, especially if you are pressed for time or don't feel like going outside the hotel. One time the cleaners folded a swan for us out of the hand towels, which was a very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “The best location outside of Disney”
Reviews.Author: winggapo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct 26th-30th and it was our first trip to Florida and Disney World. I booked the hotel here only on the suggestion of being the #1 choice for the area on Trip Advisor and for no other reason other than relying on the trust of previous travelers. This hotel sits on a paved lot across froma a rather gaudy looking privately owned sourvenir and gift shop that kind of detracts from the ambience of the place when you first pull into the lot, but that is one of the few negatives for the location. We traveled from Orlando Intenational Airport by Mears shuttle and had no vehicle to get around in. The hotel offers free shuttles (sans gratuity) from Platinum shuttle services which leaves at three or four times in the morning and then returns on three different schedules in the early evening commencing at 5:20p.m. until 10:15p.m. from two different Disney parks. The draw back to this is that once you go, you must stay until the evening in order to catch a shuttle back. There is no back and forth going unless you want to foot the bill for a taxi and even though a look at the map of the area implies that you could walk from park to park or from the Radisson to Disney Downtown, trust me...you can't. DisneyWorld holds property to over 10,000 acres (according to a Disney shuttle driver) and the parks are several miles apart. I would guess the distance from the Radisson to Epcot to be about 7 miles or so. If you wanted to foot this bill by taxi everyday my guess would be around $30 coming and going, so the shuttle with a two or three dollar tip is a real bargain. The shuttle was on time everyday and they don't wait more than a minute for stragglers as they go from the Raddisson to the Sheraton as the next stop before heading to the park, so don't be late. One suggestion I might make here is that if you plan on using the shuttle to DisneyWorld you should upgrade to the Park Hopper ticket option as the shuttle picks up the earliest from Epcot and you are going to get real familiar with this park. Without the Park Hopper option you are going to get to sit outside for lengthy periods on a bench just waiting for the shuttle. Better to be inside watching the fireworks or something. We arrived early the first day but the front desk held our bags safely for us while we went to the park, nothing was amiss on retrival. The hotel itself was very clean, as was or room. We had double queen beds with the advertised Sleep number bed, but it will only adjust firmness and not positions if that is what you are looking for. We both slept well every night of the stay. You may opt out of daily sheet changes by a supplied card to help conserve water and energy if you choose to do so. Our room was on the 7th floor and was quiet on each night. As it is outside the park area there were not any loud children in the hotel navigating the hallways in the early hours. There was plenty of hot water for showering on each day and evening. The only negatives we had about the place was that, while it advertises free wireless, I couldn't pull it up on my notebook suffiecent enough to surf. A call to the front desk responded in the free use of a three foot ethernet cable, (there is a connection in each room), but that also failed to pull up sufficent mbs for use. However in the morning the ethernet cable pulled up just fine...still no help on the wireless though. Secondly, the 35 inch LCD televison was of a brand name that I had never heard of ..."Chemei" or something like that and on the first day it politely froze up in place. I reached behind it on the wall and pulled the power plug and reinserted it and it came back on. This is the first time that I had ever had to "reboot" a television.
