However it was a recurring problem on a almost daily basis so my guess is that particular model of televion is actually a memory link up to the main feed so that they can turn off all the sets in unoccupied rooms from the downstairs desk. That's just a guess though. The biggest plus for this hotel to me was the area. Although it does not appear luxurious from the outside lot it sits right next to a shopping center which is within lighted walking distance at night and has many restaurants: TGIF Fridays, Pizzaria Uno, Johnny;s Steakhouse, and a half dozen fast food places like Burger King and McDonalds. The Olive Garden and Black Angus Restaurants are just a short walk past the shopping center on the same side of the road. Although we returned from the park to late to patronize them on most nights it was comforting to know they were available within walking distance. (The food in the parks is very expensive in comparison and hit and miss as to quality as with any other theme park.) Conversly directly across from the Radisson is the Hyatt which sits on maybe twenty or thirty acres of private landscaped land that looks like a private jungle. Very pretty during the day and looks quite luxurious, but at night I looked at it and wondered to myself if anyone without a car would feel safe walking through two acres of private dimly lit trails to get to the Black Angus Restuarant across the street. Orlando is not a gated community and has its share of violent crime as attested to on the television each night so travelers beware and be safe. Also the Mears driver pointed out to us numerous gators laying in the ditches next to the freeway coming in from the airport. It seems that they live around these parts. No thanks....I will forgo the ambience for the paved parking lot sitting next to the paved shopping center. The Radisson also has a restuarant which sports a breakfast buffet for those on the run, but if you opt for it be sure to ask for your eggs to order. They are included in the buffet price but for some reason almost always forget to mention it. All in all this was a great choice for a first Orlando visit. I don't think that unless you had rented a vehicle you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: mcpagano
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 10 different hotels in Orlando and this is by far the best one. The hotel was renovated from a Days Inn about 18 months ago and it looks brand new. The room was very big and nicely furnished. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had the buffet breakfast (extra cost) but it was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay- great location”
Reviews.Author: mckatkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2009 for 6 nights. We really could not fault this hotel it was the best we stayed in during our trip (we stayed in 4 in total during our trip to Florida). The room was excellent and couldnt be faulted. Ignore any previous negative reviews I think somtimes people will pick fault with anything!!!. Driving into the hotel from the main road was not a problem ( and we normally drive on the otherside of the road and are not used to driving on american roads!!!). The location is excellent, I also have to diagree with recent post regarding no nearby restaurants- there are loads within walking distance 2-10 min walk will give a wide choice e.g olive garden, orlando ale house, perkins, Black Angus Steakhouse etc etc ... I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Like most people "What else can be Said"”
Reviews.Author: rawdogg
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as most people have stated. The location was great and plenty of places to eat and a lots of shopping. Rooms were always clean and the staff was very helpful. Rooms were nice size. I do not know if you cab find a better room for the price and location and we did not do Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Positive reviews misleading - give this place a miss!!”
Reviews.Author: globetrottingguy59
Reviews.Content: I picked this place because of the excellent reviews on this site. What a disappointment. I am checking out tomorrow and will be glad to be out of here. The problems started literally from the moment I walked in the door. There was nobody at the registration desk. I stood there like an idiot for a few minutes before realizing that the person who should have been at the desk was in fact in the manager's office chatting. The office door was open, but both the clerk and the manager had their backs to it, which faces out to the registration desk. I finally had to call out to them to get their attention. I was then given probably the worst room in the hotel, room 206, just above the hotel entrance. There are horribly bright fluorescent lights on either side of the window, and the curtains cannot be closed well enough to keep all the light out. As a consequence, the room is extremely bright, which doesn't make for good sleeping. Things would soon prove even more annoying. Having arrived at midnight, I decided to splurge and get room service breakfast. I put out the order card at 1 a.m. The card says it will be picked up if out by 2. Imagine my surprise when no breakfast came at the requested time the next morning. I checked the door, and lo and behold, the card had not been picked up. I called room service, and was told, "That's housekeeping's fault." Not, "I'm sorry, sir, how can we make it up to you?" I ordered breakfast, and when it arrived, the bill was approximately double what it should have been. ($28 instead of $16.) Luckily I caught it, but how many people would have missed that? What a terrible first 10 hours here. I have two other complaints. First, and very important for anyone planning to work while here (or just surf), this hotel has the absolute worst internet connection I have experienced since the days of dial-up. Are they kidding? The wireless connection is fine, but the connection from the hotel to the outside world is up only about half the time. It will work for a while, and you click a link, and it goes off into la-la land and never loads the page. It will then stay off, and at some random time start working again. It can drive you crazy if you're trying to, say, chat, or use Skype, or download/upload files. The other complaint is that housekeeping failed to clean my room in a timely manner on my second day here. I left for my meeting at 7:30 a.m., came back around 3:30, and to my surprise found the room untouched. The housekeeper was next door, and seemed taken aback that I would want the room cleaned. It was as if she thought the Do Not Disturb sign had been out, but it wasn't. Her reaction was very peculiar, and it was hard to communicate to her that I just wanted fresh towels and to be done with it. All in all, a huge disappointment. Maybe if I hadn't been given the worst room in the place, maybe if the internet had worked, maybe if they hadn't botched up my breakfast order and bill, maybe if they had been welcoming at reception...maybe then I would give this place a good review. But I can't. All I can say is, stay away. There are tons of hotels around here and I would bet that most of them offer much better service. And now I'm going to post it, if I'm lucky enough to have a working internet...

Reviews.Title: “Accident Waiting to Happen-Deceptive”
Reviews.Author: Coolest_Mom_101
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Hyatt but it was fully booked. The description for this hotel online said best "new" hotel, even in our AAA book it was described as being newly constructed leading you to believe you were staying at a new hotel. The outside is deceiving-the facade of the hotel is new but we discovered later on that this used to be a Days Inn. The parking is free (one plus) but limited. We had a double stroller and two infants and had to park in the back on the second night unaware that there were steps in the back-no handicap access or stroller access, no ramp, just steps. We had to wheel the stroller all the way around to the front of the hotel which seems like a million miles when you have two kids that are exhausted after Disney all day. All the while, tripping on poorly installed pavers. They installed brick pavers that are not flush to the ground and loose, there is only one low area to wheel a stroller in the front of the hotel and they installed some kind of speed bump over it. The curbs are all pavers and square and it all blends in-major trip hazard. I saw countless people trip on the rug outside the front entrance as well. The lobby seems nice but small and so are the elevators. The ceilings are low and the hallways are narrow. We had a room with two double beds with the pull out couch and we had a crib. You barely have enough room to push the stroller into the room. The space from the edge of the bed to the dresser was so limited-the wheels on the stroller were getting caught on the furniture. The furnishings were a low budget imitation of what contemporary luxury hotels would offer. The dresser drawers were small, broken and falling out when you opened it, the sleep number beds were hard and uncomfortable. If you have small children with you, make sure you adjust the beds when you first get there becuause it makes a loud noise when you adjust it and my three year old was scared of it. The flat screen tv was a plus along with the small fridge and microwave and the bedding was nice. The bathroom was the worst part of the room. When you first peek in there you see the sink-looks good-granite countertop with the bowl sink that sits on top. But turn it on and its a whole other story. The faucet doesn't reach the sink and the water goes out the back of the sink when you wash your hands. The ball on the handle popped off and if you arent careful, you could scald yourself with the extremely hot water. Then there's the tub/shower. I knew this wasn't a new hotel when I saw the shower surround. They installed beige lanolium that someone cut into squares and glued to the existing tile walls. Where they attempted to grout in between, there was mold and mildew and old caulking that was beige against a white tub. I don't think I have ever seen lanolium flooring used on a shower/tub surround-especially in a hotel. This wasn't lanolium tiles-someone cut it. I felt like I was in a shower in a trailer park. It just didn't go. Someone cut major corners to revamp this hotel and it just wasn't sanitary. Not to mention the big black hair I found under the toilet seat when we got there. After you shower, when the mirror is steamy you can see the glue behind the mirror where they glued it to the wall. Just so low budget. The entrance to the room has a marble floor divider that is a trip hazard and they tiled over the existing tile in the bathroom so you stub your toe when you walk into the bathroom because it is slightly raised. This is when it occurred to us that this was a refurb hotel. We confirmed from an employee after they reluctantly told us that it used to be a Days Inn. In addition, the doors slam shut and it's so loud that it wakes you whenever your neighbors open and close their doors. We actually ate at the breakfast buffet on our last day in the hotel restaurant. The price was $11+ each adult, kids were free. They left the lids on the warming trays and it was a scald hazard for the average person holding a plate in one hand to have to lift these heavy metal lids with hot condensation dripping and there were no place to sit the lids while you are serving yourself. There were limited choices for breakfast-eggs, cold waffles (not homemade), grits, biscuits, sausage, bacon, two kinds of fruit and pastries. I went to take a pastry and then I realized that there were flying insects swarming them. Little bugs just flying and landing on it-all over it. Now I know why they left the lids on everything. It's unlimted Starbucks coffee-they bring you a caraffe that is the size of one small mug. It was rediculous...lol. The server Brian was the nicest person in the whole hotel and he did go out of his way-he made an average over priced breakfast bearable. The property that the hotel sits on is too close to the main road and you have to go down and make u-turns to get in and out. We had to drive almost ten minutes or more out of our way to just get back to the hotel. There is a median that separates the road and no way in unless you make u-turns. The only restaurant that you can easily access is the one in the hotel. Otherwise it's an annoying drive of u-turns and traffic. We gave up and ordered a pizza from one of the many solicitors they allow to put flyers under your door. They delivered it but you had to go down to the lobby to go get it and we had to pay for delivery. So why did they ask what room number we were in if we had to go down to get it? Needless to say we will be staying at a resort hotel next time-you get what you pay for. Actually in this case we paid too much for mediocre surroundings. Not family friendly, especially if you have small children or need handicap access. Travelers beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but watch out for the timeshare.”
Reviews.Author: Hockey68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for a week in October. Its a great place to sleep, very clean, decorated nicely, maid staff friendly, but I have to question how much the Raddison cares for its guests when it allows a company to operate a counter in their lobby to solicate timeshares to their quests. This company (Orange Lake Resort, check out their complaints on line) will offer you discounted tickets to the theme parks, for listing to their timeshare presentation. Everything they tell you about it is a lie, they tell you they will serve you breakfast, Its old donuts, they tell you that you will watch a movie with other people. its really a one on one of the hardest sales presentation that I have ever seen (and I am a sales person). They tell you that its no longer than 90 minutes, Its 3 hours of multiple sales people that wont take no for an answer. In the end we did get our discount, but at what price, 2 hours into a 3 hour scam are kids are about crying saying daddy can we go to Disney now. So thank you Radisson for allowing Orange Lake Resort to prey on your guests, I am sure your getting a good kick back, but you should know that they are bad mouthing your hotel during the scam... I mean presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, extremely clean, comfy beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: chadav
Reviews.Content: First trip to Orlando and this hotel definitely was the best choice. Large comfy rooms, great beds (two doubles in room), nice bathroom with shower, plasma tv and all amenities. Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel is in good location, close to all the parks. A definite place to go is Discovery Cove, bit expensive but well worth the price!! Only warning, watch out for the time share vultures - they offer you great deals on tickets in return for viewing a time share property - then refuse to let you leave, very hard sellers and prob the only complaint about the whole holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Will Probably Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: augerAustinTX
Reviews.Content: Now, there's nothing exciting about this hotel. For example, the pool is unheated and very basic. Also, the hotel decor is very odd. We lost track of the myriad materials used. And the hotel is kind of touristy. There is a hustle for Disney tickets upon check-in and the same pizza flyer was put under our door many times. But the hotel is a good value: it is very current, clean and quiet. We got an excellent rate through Amex. The location is both good and bad. One evening, the traffic heading toward Disney was so bad that it took us a half hour to get back to the hotel from a block away. But when the traffic is light, it is great. To save on driving, try the Waffle House for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: dpa15
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Radisson during a 2 week tour of Florida. An excellent hotel all round, so good that we booked in for another 2 nights on our return to Orlando before flying back to the UK. All staff are polite and helpful. The rooms are huge, clean and furnished to a high standard. The facilities include a pool, gym and internet as well as room service and bar / restaurant which are reasonably priced and of good standard. You will get takeaway pizza menus pushed under your door which surprised us that a hotel like the Radisson with on-site restaurants allow 3rd party delivery companies to deliver and advertise, but still, it's America I guess! 1 point to mention, which is not the hotels fault, but they should be aware (And I believe they are) that the Orange Lake desk is a disgrace. DO NOT BUY ANYTHING OFF THEM, by doing so you agree to time share sales presentations etc. Use them for information on parks etc, but they can't do tickets at anything cheaper than buying on the door of the theme park, the only reduced priced tickets they offer are if you take part in a time share presentation. We got dooped into cheap Disney World tickets by the rep called Rob who LIED about what we had to do to get them. Giving false information to obtain money is fraud yet that's exactly what he did. Don't even get involved with them. Horrible experience. However, we explained to the hotel what the problem was and they swiftly dealt with the issue and got us a full refund. The duty manager and sales director were brilliant and saved us from otherwise having to travel to another hotel to do battle with Orange Lake to get a refund and back out of the timeshare contract. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: northernukman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the radisson for four nights, the hotel is fantastic, very clean rooms with great beds, the breakfast is also great. My only gripe really is the noise from the busy freeway opposite the hotel which I found to be the only negative. The location is spot on with wdw only a five min drive away and lots of places to eat next door. If your looking for a nice hotel in a good location for a reasonable rate then you just can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “As good as I hoped it would be.”
Reviews.Author: Silkcuts
Reviews.Content: It was our first booking off trip advisor and it was an excellent decision. The staff were all wonderful and always genuinely in good moods. We had read the complaints of a noisy elevator and highway. Never heard the elevator and we were only halfway down the hallway. Did hear traffic sounds but no more or less than any other hotel we've ever stayed at. We couldn't understand why people complained....I found it somewhat soothing and neither my wife, daughter nor myself had any problems sleeping over our seven day stay. The pool area was clean and tidy as was the workout room and the entire hotel for that matter. We did partake in the delicious afternoon cookies and would recommend everyone indulge. The cleaning staff were friendly and kind and did a fantastic job every single day. The hotel is close to plenty of dining options. We do not have Denny's, IHOP or Waffle House here in Toronto and all were within walking distance. We were right next to Disney and minutes drive to all the parks within....which is extremely convenient. Also minutes away from Universal and Seaworld so we would once again stay at the Radisson when we return to see those parks. The bathrooms were also immaculately clean and well supplied. The beds were very comfortable too. Just make sure to ask how to properly set the mattress for optimum comfort. We found not one thing negative to say and recommend this hotel quite highly. Have spent much more $$$ for much less many times. We just hope that they will maintain this level of service in the future. Happy Vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Beds; Immaculate”
Reviews.Author: Christieubah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right outside the Downtown Disney gate near all the chain restaurants you could imagine, right off of I-4 however, it was as peaceful and quiet as can be and the hotel was pretty full. On Tuesdays, kids eat for 1.99 and half price appetizers at Buffalo Wild Wings. Pool bar and restaurant. Cookies at the front desk. Kindly asked for a suite upgrade at no additional charge even though I got my room at priceline and they did because they had it available. Enjoy your stay , you won't be disappointed - except there is only 1working elevator when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great rates, and the rates kept going down as it got closer to my check in date. Large rooms - my room had two double beds, a pull out sofa bed, desk. Very quiet rooms - just make sure you ask for a room on the opposite side of I-4. Rooms also have a refrigerator and microwave - very convenient for a family too. Also a coffee pot, and a hair dryer Internet available in lobby free of charge (2 computers). There is a small fitness center and an outdoor pool. Location is in Lake Buena Vista not too far from Downtown Disney. To get on/off I-4 you just have to make u-turns - but the traffic was easy. Lots of restaurants down the street. Walgreens is also down the street. Cleaning staff is honest. I would suggest if you are going to the Disney parks, rent a car. Although they have free shuttles the times didn't look very convenient. Free parking at the hotel. If you are looking to save money and staying at an off Disney property this is the place. Plenty of room especially with kids. The fridge and microwave are great too

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel - but spotty internet”
Reviews.Author: akrontraveler325
Reviews.Content: After reading the many good reviews, I was excited to visit the Radisson Lake Buena Vista in October 2009. The hotel was convenient to both the highway and the Disney entrance. However, this increased the noise and traffic in the area. The hotel is spotless and our room was very clean. For the first couple of days of our stay, one of the elevators was broken. It wasn't a big deal, but a minor inconvenience. The free internet access was spotty at best and we had a difficult time getting a connection, even when plugging in directly to the network. Free parking was a plus, but since this resort is not a Disney property, we had to pay for parking at the theme parks each day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: greenteee
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience was excellent except that one of the two elevators didn't work for three days during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: shla023
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista from October 8th to the 11th. It is a superior hotel and the price is right. There were only a few issues with the hotel. The first is that one of the elevators was broken during our stay therefore there was only one elevator for all the guest at the hotel. We had to wait a few times for the next elevator. Many guests opted for the stairs. The second issue was that the towels for the pool were the size of dish towels. I suggest you bring your own. Finally, If you are a light sleeper, I suggest you request a room not facing the freeway. Other than that, the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful. The hotel is near everything and the pool has a bar. We had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Interstate”
Reviews.Author: zeropopgrowth
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews. However, the hotel is right on the Interstate, and has terrible traffic noise. The pool is out in direct sun also with loud highway traffic noise. It also has difficult access- if you miss the entrance you have to make multiple U-turns to get back, and it's hard to get back onto the interstate. Service was surly. It was next to impossible to get a refund on my second night because I booked through Expedia. Also there is a bar in the lobby. There was a seedy character loitering by the elevators at midnight when I returned to the hotel. The room however was beautiful, with a great TV, a refrigerator, and coffee maker (Maxwell House coffee). And parking is free. I was able to get wi-fi in my room (spotty).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: OsloMike
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. OK, so the waffles were a little wooden, but the staff are very helpful, the grounds are immaculate, there are free cookies in reception and the beds adjust every which way! The pool is a nice place to hang out, with a bar open on the weekend. I have no real criticisms for the hotel at all. It was clean, well serviced, in a good location for nearby attractions and priced very reasonably. I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: pamhatt
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay in Radisson Hotels due to the Sleep Number beds. This was the first time I stayed in this particular hotel in Orlando. It really was beautiful. The hotel we very clean, up to date, friendly staff and located just outside the gate into Downtown Disney. The ingress into this hotel is not the easiest but the Outlet Mall, Downtown Disney and MANY restaurants are all within walking distance. We at at El Patron Mexican Restaurant right down the road and the Carne Asada was REALLY good. They also had excellent LIVE Mariachi's on Sunday Night. The rooms were decorated very well and the lighting and cleanliness of the room was top notch. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and inviting. The hotel is right next to the freeway but I did not personally hear the traffic pattern. There was a larger than normal in room refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker with plenty of counter space. We will definitely book a room at this hotel the next time we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyMomof2
Reviews.Content: We booked this room based on the ratings given on Trip Advisor and I must say I am glad we did! Our stay at the Radisson was above and beyond our expectations. The rooms were very clean, spacious, and modern. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Our overall experience at this hotel was excellent. When returning to Disney, we are definitely staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, first class stay”
Reviews.Author: Nonnie55Texas
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite, which had one king size slect number bed in one room, and two queen select number beds in another room. There were two flat screen tv's and plenty of room. I am a grandmother, who was traveling with my daughter, her husband, and four children. We took a pack and play for the youngest to sleep in. The room size was great, and it was a wonderful place to return to each day after visiting a park. The staff were helpful and polite. We do not believe that we could have had a better deal. We will definately stay here again. It's at the main entrance to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased”
Reviews.Author: voyage23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights because of the positive reviews that I read. When I arrived, I was immediately turned off by the bathroom. Their was mold around the sink area. When I asked the next day to change rooms, I was told all the rooms have similar problems with mold surrounding the sink. I was told that this was a common complaint and no further attempts were made to compensate my dissatisfaction. I unfortunately had to spend another two days, having to deal with the unsightly mold around the sink since I had purchased advanced accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted a great bed and a great price...”
Reviews.Author: MiamiEdith
Reviews.Content: I asked my daughter to find a great bed and a great price for our one night stay near Epcot. She succeeded when she booked us at the Lake Buena Vista Radisson Hotel in Orlando. Not only were the beds absolutely great but the room even had a small seating area and empty refrigerator that would have made a longer stay with family or friends very comfortable. And the pricing was most excellent...and much better than any "on property" hotel I have booked in the past. Though the property's location doesn't have the "on property" village landscaping, the location is convenient to stores, eating options, and parks.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel with free parking!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September. We booked through hotels.com & paid a total of £195. We had booked a superior room with 2 queen beds, as this was a special through hotels.com. When we were checking in i asked for a King instead & was offered a jacuzzi suite for an extra $20 per night. I couldnt decide so the lady then said she would do it for $15. Decided just to save my money & stick with the 2Q room. The room itself was modern & spacious. The beds were very comfortable & i liked the fact you could alter the firmness at the touch of a button! There was a small sofa in the room & a large window, where i could see the entrance of Disney. Bathroom was clean & modern although i didnt like the ugly glass sink set into the countertop. Towels were nice & fluffy. Room had a large flatsreen HD TV, fridge & microwave. Free parking is included at this hotel & we never had a problem finding a space. Pool was a bit on the small side, but adequate & clean. Towels were provided. The tiki bar that i had read about was closed, maybe because it was quieter at the end of September? The hotel is across the road from the entrance to Disney. However, to actually get to the parks it would take about a 10minute drive. A few minutes walk from the hotel is Crossroads dining area, where there is several restaurants all in one area, including McDonalds, TGI's, Fuddruckers, Hooters etc. There is also a fantasy golf & a small supermarket & deli here. Caroline

Reviews.Title: “"Bull's-Eye"”
Reviews.Author: Kloss
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time looking for better place to stay if you are planning to visit the Wonderful Disney Parks. It's a perfect location if you fly into MCO, or just drive in. Right off the highway, yet very quiet. Very close to all nice Restaurants and some Great Discount shopping 'if you have time'. The complimentary shuttle to Magic Kingdom or Epcot was just perfect. Last pick up from Magic Kingdom parking is at 10:45 and is just enough time to get back from Mickey's play ground after the fireworks. Our whole experience with the Radisson Buena Vista could be easily rated as 10. After the long day walking you can relax in the nice pool on the property. Free Internet with all new machines a great Bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneandDale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in September 2009 after looking at TripAdvisor reviews of hotels in the area. This is a lovely hotel - rooms were large and clean and the staff in both the restaurant and bar area that we came across were really great. The level of customer service and friendliness is far above the norm. Would not hesitate to stay here again. During our trip to Florida we stayed in other Orlando hotels near Universal Studios which were considerably more expensive than the Radisson and did not come close! With hindsight would have stayed here for the full duration.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right! Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: DixieGirlIl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on it's reviews on this website and it did not steer me wrong. This place was AWESOME! New and clean, clean, clean! And I'm a clean freak! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I had read two of the (very few) bad reviews about this hotel on this site, one from a person complaining that they were wrongfully charged a cleaning fee for smoking in the room (if they truly didn't smoke in the room, I feel bad for them, but if they did they deserve the fee), and another from a person whose room was near the elevator. I could sympathize with the person stuck near the elevator since the same situation, different hotel had recently happened to me. I explained while making the reservation that I have terrible allergies and asthma, and that I could not be put in a room that had EVER been smoked in or I would get really sick, and that I'd had a bad situation with being in a room near the elevator. They were more than happy to make sure that we were put in a room that had never been charged for a cleaning fee for unlawful smoking since the hotel is all smoke free, and they put us as far from the elevator as possible. Also, when we arrived they asked if I had problems with down comforters, and with my asthma, I do, and promptly removed them from our room and replaced them with cotton blankets before we even got up to the room. It was the most pleasant hotel stay I've ever had. It was so quiet. Beautifully decorated. The rooms were huge! The bathroom was not huge, but big enough that my husband and I could both fit in while bathing our young sons. This may sound strange, but the elevators smelled good. We've stayed in places before that were clean, but the elevators smelled bad. Not here, they smelled good, but not an overpowering scent (thankfully for my allergies). If I had to find one problem the only thing that I could find would be the complimentary shuttle service to the Disney parks. It was VERY limited timewise and it just didn't work for us, so we had to drive to the parks and pay for parking. But, you can't have it all. I would much rather stay at the Raddison and pay for parking instead of staying at an over-priced not near as nice place on Disney property just for free shuttle service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: smlukas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, without spending a ton of money. The location is near to disney or any other of the theme parks. The rooms are incredible---Beautiful colums, granite, and flat screen tvs....not to mention a sleep number bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Monica070
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place to stay in Orlando. The hotel is really clean, spotless I´ll say. The furniture is new, the bed is amazingly comfortable, and the staff is really nice and kind. We have breakfast included in our rate (great rate, by the way) and it was really good. Not the typical overcrowded restaurant but a nice and charm little one, with great attention from waitress and really good food. It is buffet but eggs and pancakes are made to order in a la carte style, you order them from your table, not long lines waiting at the buffet bar. I highly recommend staying in this hotel, we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star at Two Star Price!!”
Reviews.Author: vanincal
Reviews.Content: One of the best travel experiences that I have experienced anywhere in the world! Lobby is awesome. Had a beautiful, spotless large room with an LCD flat screen and everything you would expect at a top end hotel. Within 15 minutes, the desk called to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. Top notch employees from the desk to housekeeping! Don't bother with the Waffle House across the parking lot, for probably a dollar more, you can get a quality meal at the Hotel Restaurant. Once again, the chef came out and checked that everything was to our satisfaction. Did I mention, free parking, internet access, newspaper and cookies. Yes, it is a little awkward to enter the property (because of its freeway close location) but I assure you it is definitely worth driving a block and making a U-Turn! Congratulations to the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bingoKS
Reviews.Content: This was the first Radisson Hotel my wife and I have ever stayed at and we were very impressed! The location is great, close to all of the theme parks and places to eat. The staff at the front desk and the maids were excellent. The rooms were reasonably priced as well. Our room was very comfortable and clean. The Sleep Number beds were great and had nice bedding. The bathrooms were extremely clean and had plenty of towels. The TV was great and they even had an Ipod docking station radio. The pool and hot tub were very nice as well. Overall, probably one the best hotels we have stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay overall, but has a few faults”
Reviews.Author: FuntimesX2
Reviews.Content: This Radisson has large, beautiful clean smelling rooms which are a pleasure to stay in. The sleep number mattresses are a joy, the comforters are warm & smuggly, if you get a view of the back area if is pleasant (the front will give you a view of a large gift shop.) The drink machine on our floor did not work. The odd diesign of the sign bowls in the bathrooms had black mold and should be done away with. The door did not clear our toilet bowl, we had to lift the lid every time we opened or shut the door all the way. Our sons room next door did not have this problem. Our paper was not put at our door, we had to go down to the elevator to get it everyday. We were also told the computers worked just fine, we tried and tried to print our return plane tickets home to no avail. So we walked aways down the street at night to the Sheraton who DID have working computers and printed our plane tickets for home. Then we walked all the way back in the dark. Not a fun experience. However, the Radisson did have a beautiful room that smelled new, was large, extremely fresh & lovely to stay in and we wiould stay here again in a second! One more thing though (sorry), the bus schedule is BAD, a few more schedules need to be added, even if it means adding a few more dollars to the daily cost of staying there. That bus schedlue causes much suffering. Don't change your mind about staying here, this hotel is worth it. I just had to be truthful. GREAT CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tsmall
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and stayed at the Raddisson hotel. The accomodations were superb! It was very clean, the staff was very inviting, and the hotel restaurant was excellent. The rooms were spacious and decorated lovely. The prices were reasonable also. It's conveniently located to the theme parks, restaurants, shopping, etc. A great location. Would definetly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As they say in the US 'Absolutely AWESOME'!”
Reviews.Author: Baleraphon
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say? From the minute we checked in (thanks Ila) to the minute we checked out the hotel was superb. We originally planned only two nights here having left two free at the end of our fortnight, but we immediately made arrangements to spend them here, thanks for arranging things Mansour. The hotel might look a little unprepossessing from the road (no we never had any problems with traffic and u-turns either) it is lovely inside with an imposing reception area which sets the tone for the hotel. The whole place is kept immaculately and our room, a jacuzzi room on the third floor, was great, very spacious and nicely furnished. The bed was huge and very comfortable thanks to the sleep number system (push a remote control to adjust firmness). Our toiletries were laid out on a towel in the bathroom - with a flannel holder for the toothbrushes, and a handbag made of towels by the jacuzzi. The hotel was full of touches like this. The breakfast was great - the chef, Mark, came out to talk to guests and his corn beef hash and pancakes could not be beaten. He was extremely friendly as were his great team of staff. We cannot praise the efficiency, cleanliness and great location of the hotel enough. It really is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in a long time”
Reviews.Author: flasharon
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. Everything worked!! Check-in was easy; room was clean; high speed internet worked; beds were comfortable; shower had water pressure; staff was friendly and helpful. Kudos to this Radisson. In a time when customer service seems lacking in most organizations, this Radisson exceeded my normal expectations.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: joeb12
Reviews.Content: Great price. Courteous, helpful and professional staff. The room was large, clean and quiet. We stayed 5 nights. Courtesy shuttle to Epcot and Magic Kingdom saved on parking fees at Disney World. The stay here was a very pleasant experience and there were no "hidden surprises" that we have encountered at some other hotels (dirty carpet, bugs, noise, etc) after check-in. Radisson Lake Buena Vista will get my business for every future trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: q1w2e3
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Radisson. The hotel is literally right outside the gates/entrance to the Disney World resorts (downtown Disney) but this hotel provides so much more value. They offer free parking, free in-room internet, complimentary bottled water everyday, free cookies daily in the lobby and each room is equipped with a microwave and fridge. The rooms are spacious, clean and modern. There's a reason this hotel is rated #1.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel good location and great service”
Reviews.Author: MikeSCheshire
Reviews.Content: Read the odd negative view about the location, yes it is on a busy road but we had no problems getting in and out, or parking,and it is very convienient for disney and restaurants and shops. I thought it was an excellent location. Also has several restaurants withing walking distance, which we liked. Rooms are a good size and new and very clean. Only used hotel restaurant for breakfast, that was good though and good value. Best of all though was the friendly and efficient service. Very fast check in and out, and as we were celebrating out 25th wedding anniversay during our stay I had requested for help with surprise flowers,chocolates and balloons etc. in room. They arranged all these and put them all in the room for my wife at an arranged time when we were out, and all done with a really nice touch.Oh and they sent us an anniversay card! All in all there was nothing to fault with this hotel and we had a wonderful holiday.Thank you

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ElleKev04
Reviews.Content: Just arrived from UK into Sanford, so after the drive from the airport, we were so pleased to arrive at the hotel. The rooms are big and the beds are kingsize. There was also a sofa and desk in a separate area of the room. Bathroom was clean and modern. Ice machine and drinks machine by the lifts on each floor. The corridors were clean and spacious. The buffet breakfast was really nice and the staff so friendly. You do pay more than inner Orlando but you're getting a better quality. They also do Starbucks coffee in the lobby. The hotel is right opposite the start of the Disney parks. They have shuttles to the parks, although we didn't use them. Restaurants next door within walking distance, we like Uno for all round value. Red Lobster is also really nice but a little more expensive. My one crticism is that when we arrived, we were told that we could have a free park ticket and were directed to the desk to find out how we got this. The guy on the desk was actually from Holiday Inn resorts. He said that to get the park ticket we would just need to go to this other hotel and have breakfast and listen to a 90 minute presentation on the hotel. This is a complete lie. It is a one-to-one hard sell of a timeshare. The breakfast was a few mini donuts and muffins with awaful coffee. Although the lady who did the pitch was very nice and the resort is lovely, we didn't know we were going there to be sold a time-share. It ended up that we were there for 3 hours!! So we'd wasted half a day of park time. We got a free universal ticket, so saved $130 but we didn't get a full day at the park. If you do this, make sure you cut them off early. They will send 3 people out with all sorts of sales tactics. Just don't show even a slight bit of interest, unless you genuinely are. There is the usual crap of the deal only being available on that day, rubbish! We are not stupid, and were not expecting to get anything for free, but we did question the guy on the desk at the hotel why they wanted to know our income and what we had to go to the hotel for. He said that they are just trying to promote a 5 star resort. A complete lie. They wasted our day and lied to us. Just don't get sucked in. Put that all to one side, as the Radisson is the best place to stay in Orlando and in a quiter area than I-Drive. Spend the money to get a better holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a Pizza flyer...”
Reviews.Author: Zyphrax
Reviews.Content: MY EXPERIENCE In search of a good location to stay in close distance to Sea World, Universal and the Disney parks I decided to have a look at what TripAdvisor would suggest. Based on the good reviews I decided to stay in this hotel for 8 days. The hotel is conveniently located on the Apopka Vineland Rd (SR535) which is right next to the 4 interstate. When leaving the hotel just make a small U-turn and your on your way to all the theme parks. The view from the room isn't that great, because on one side of the hotel you have the interstate and on the other side you have a bunch of power lines. On the 6th floor we didn't hear any noise from the 4 interstate. The hotel has enough (free) parking space so that shouldn't be a problem (although September isn't a really busy month). There are some good restaurants close to the hotel and a Walgreens. You can have breakfast, lunch or dinner in the hotel. If you're going to the parks, I would advise you to eat there for better value. They offer free internet (both wired and wireless), I found the connection terrible, you have constant timeouts when browsing the internet (I mainly used the wired connection). One thing I found very annoying: the pizza flyers. Everyday when you come back to your room you'll notice 3 or 4 pizza flyers on the floor. Even the room key is one big pizza commercial. That's just annoying, a bigger issue for me was the bedding: the SleepNumber beds. With a small remote you can decide how firm you'd like your bed to be. This sounds like a nice feature, but for some reason you have to re-set your bed to the right number every day and I found a normal bed to be more comfortable (and believe me as a nerd I tried a lot of settings). Also the airco unit was kinda loud, and our last day it gave of a bit of burning smell. The bathroom was great, nice high shower, although I didn't like the wash bowl which makes it very easy to spill water allover the place. SUMMARY The good: location very close to the I4, nice clean rooms, ticket desk with reasonable prices, friendly, good value for a low price The bad: annoying pizza flyers, loud airco unit, bad internet connection, uncomfortable SleepNumber beds

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLSJH
Reviews.Content: We had an unexpected stay here. After a disasterous night at the Sheraton Safari we needed somewhere clean and comfortable to stay, reasonably close to Disney. My husband spoke to staff at the front desk who were happy for him to view a room before we made a reservation. The room was clean and modern and offered everything we needed. Staff were friendly and service was good. Food was excellent and reasonably priced. We stayed for the remaining six nights of our holiday and were very impressed. We would deffinitely recommend this hotel and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “clean”
Reviews.Author: ofnyc
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean, comfortable, closed to down town Disney and it's park attractions. families on a budget for Disney World will save on food, all fast food restaurants are withing walking distance,,Plenty of gift shops.. save on tickets by attending the time share sales located on the hotel or on the visitor booths. our family of four had a room with two beds 42'' lcd tv , microwave a small frige.. ice cold air..and free wifi... room was very nice ...pool area and jacuzzi indoor fitness center. staff was friendly .. will come back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but plush!”
Reviews.Author: ptbpama
Reviews.Content: Eat at the Waffle House at the front parking lot; hotel breakfast is delicious but pricey unless you are famished! Pool & hot tub were excellent. Very close to Walt Disney World attractions, especially Downtown Disney. Did not take advantage of the shuttle to Epcot or Magic Kingdom. Wi Fi doesn't work in all rooms, so get the ethernet cable when checking in. VERY comfortable beds and linens - Sleep Number beds! Very clean bathrooms with plenty of towels. Don't care for the decorator-type basin -- pretty but not very functional. Refrig. & microwave helpful with little kids. HUGE flat screen TV. Sitting area with large chair that folds out to a single bed. Truly exceeded my expectations and the kids were really impressed, too!

Reviews.Title: “I'm very happy to have chosen this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: number1teacher
Reviews.Content: Out of the almost 400 hotels in Orlando, we chose this hotel because of the number 1 rating on Tripadvisor. It was a great value and we were all extremely pleased with the room , the location and the pool. The hotel facade is a bit unassuning, but as soon as you enter the lobby, you will be glad you chose this hotel. We had a party of three from 65 to 15 years ald and we all loved the hotel. Branden at the Front Desk was especially accomodating and made the stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean”
Reviews.Author: swan5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Radisson for three nights, It was specious enough for a family of 5. The room and restroom was very clean. The housekeeping was on top of everything I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: ONTCDNFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We just got back to Canada. After driving 21hrs with a 4 & 7 year old the Radisson was an excellent stay. We were there for 5 days and had a great time could not ask for anything better. The price was great $387 Cdn tax in. The location was close to Downtown Disney, Walmart, Resturants and many other places. The room were clean, the pool and hot tub were excellent and the have fresh baked chocolate cookies after 3pm at the front counter. At the front desk and off to the side there is time share people (just tell them you are not interested) if you already know your plans. I will be back to the hotel. I read somewhere about how you have to drive pass the hotel and this worried me but honestly you drive up the road make a U turn and you are at the hotel this is not a big deal if you have ever had to make a U turn before. Excellent Quality, No Charge Parking, Internet, Fridge and Microwave and Large Flat Screen TV's

Reviews.Title: “New, very clean and close to all ammenities”
Reviews.Author: family2009Alberta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite new and very clean. It had a beautiful pool area, complete with a tiki bar, where the service was very friendly and my children remember it for their delicious smoothies! We stayed in a family suite which was very spacious and perfect for us as the children each had their own large bed. Housekeeping always worked around our schedule and we returned to an amazingly clean room everyday. The only negative is access to the hotel, as many times you need to do a U-turn to return at night (sometimes taking an additional 30 minutes in bad traffic). Many restaurants are nearby and shopping is also very close if you have a vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl18528
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It is centrally located by all attractions and restaurants. The rooms are clean, sleep number beds are great. If you are a business traveler, the so-call "high-speed" internet service is awful. The hotel has the noisiest elevator I've ever heard. We were 5 rooms away from it, and it kept waking us up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and brilliant value!!”
Reviews.Author: 1holidayorlando
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days with husband and 2 teenage daughters and could not complain at all!!! Ate breakfast everyday in restaurant and it was fantastic and the service as well as the food was outstanding! Rooms were large enough for 4 with fridge & micro. Beds were out of this world and this is just what you need after a day in the parks! Been to Orlando 5x now and this is the hotel / apt I would recommend to anyone of any age. Pool and hot tub were big enough with comfy loungers. Ideally situated for all parks. As a travel agent in the UK I will definitely be passing my recommendations on! Hopefully be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Value”
Reviews.Author: Nikon200traveler
Reviews.Content: From the cheerful, engaged staff to the property's superb maintenance to the excellent room amenities, this hotel is an unexpected value with an outstanding location at a key entrance to the Disney complex. I picked the hotel based on location and price and was ready for the typical, musty Florida midpriced hotel room experience. But it was not to be. The room was clean, fresh and new, as was the lobby and other public facilities. I highly recommend this hotel to individual and family travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great newer hotel, amazing price and service”
Reviews.Author: FunTexans
Reviews.Content: Booked this room on the hotel's own website because it was the number one pick on trip advisor, and I have to agree with all the positive reviews. Hotel appears to be only about one year old and everything is in exceptional condition. Hotel parking is free and there is no resort fee (most other Orlando hotels spring a $5 to $15 per day or more fee on top of you upon check-in to use "services" that should be in the base price, and some charge parking fees, so be careful, but thank you Radisson for not charging such fees!). Check-in was prompt on a busy Saturday night and they provided a quiet room opposite the highway as I had requested (you should request the same). Enjoyed the sleep number beds, nice linens, and decent towels. Lobby is upscale and beautiful and it is a huge plus that elevators are right inside the door from parking at the back of the hotel, so you don't have to run through a maze to get to your room. Room ceiling height is probably closer to 9 feet (I prefer a foot higher) and beds are a little cramped in the room, but our room had separate loveseat and desk by the window, which was a nice place to sit while reading, dressing, or eating breakfast in the room. It is also nice that beds were queen sized rather than doubles. Refrigerator in the room was a plus and was large enough to store half gallon of milk, half gallon of orange juice, and many water bottles, soda cans and beer. Last guest left our hotel safe locked, and only a manager could unlock it, so couldn't use safe until second afternoon of our stay, but it was not a big deal and front desk staff let us know this when we reported it right after check-in. Housekeeping was great, always left lots of towels, and they even made a swan out of a towel in the bathroom, which the kids thought was cute. We left a tip for them and we don't usually tip maid service. Hotel has chocolate chip cookies on the right side of the check in desk from about 4 to 8 p.m., so be sure to pick some up. The pool bartender overheard me asking where the cookies were at 3 p.m. one of the first days we were there, and the front desk people said they would soon put them out; we headed out to the pool and the bartender brought them out to us, which was a nice an unexpected surprise! Pool chaise lounges are thick and very comfortable. It is hard to tell from the pictures, but pool is very large and we had no problem getting loungers. Designers put most poolside landscaping outside of poolside patio areas (rather than inside the fence) which is a shame, because the pool could have looked more tropical and lush had they put more of the palms and plants on the inside of the fence; property should add more planters inside the fence to compensate. Thanks to the previous Trip Advisor reviewers who warned us avoid the time share counter, aka "concierge." The front desk people instruct you to go over there as part of the check-in; we ignored that step and were happier for it. Also note: we booked directly through the hotel (which has a fairly liberal cancellation policy), and when their rates dropped about a week before our trip, we called and they adjusted our reservation to honor their new lower rates, which was awesome. Disney tips: Hotel's shuttle service is limited so rent a car to get around, which will save you much frustration (although you will pay $12 a day to park at the Disney parks). Costco website had coupons with best prices. Purchase a couple of $1 disposable ponchos for each person to keep one daily in pocket for quick thunderstorms. Sunscreen your face in hotel room and spray on neck and shoulders in hotel parking lot (to avoid being on display in Disney parking lots). Arrive at parks half hour before opening, can ride 2-3 rides per hour first two hours, then lines slow down a lot; have each person carry half liter bottled water each to parks (and purchase water bottle clip for $6 to clip to belt) and refill for free at drinking fountains in parks. Get copy of all showtimes at front of park as you go in (so you don't hike to far-off land only to learn next show isn't for an hour or that EPCOT world showcase isn't open until 10 or 11 a.m. Stop touring between 1 and 2 p.m. and each lunch outside parks (best bets include Sweet Tomatoes and Fuddruckers at Crossroads Plaza just north of hotel; Lonestar Steakhouse is just south of it about a block past 1-4 and has wonderful Salmon and great burgers and inexpensive side salads; Bahama Breeze is near the Lonestar and has good food, but entrees come with no sides, so you have to pay a lot extra for side salads, etc.). Take naps from 3-5 p.m.; if you return to parks at night, count on only doing secondary rides as best ride lines will be more than an hour and fast passes will be gone for the day. Muppets 3D at Hollywood Studios is ultra outdated and boring so skip it; Philharmagic 3-D movie at Magic Kingdom is 10X better than any of their other 3D movies, so do not miss it. Thanks Radisson and Disney for our best family vacation ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Orlando or Disney World Visits!”
Reviews.Author: CriticsReview
Reviews.Content: Pros: The maid service was outstanding. The sleep number beds were also a nice touch. The hotel is located very close to Disney World, International Boulevard, and many outlet shopping centers. If you are visiting Disney World like my family did, you would pay a fraction of the price at the Radisson than if you stayed in the park. The rooms were clean and orderly. The hotel also gives out free cookies at night. Cons: The family suites on every floor are close to the elevator, so it can get a little noisy at night. There is also only one bathroom in a family suite, so big families may have a problem with that. The worst part is getting to the hotel entrance when driving. Traffic is heavy on weekends and at night near the Radisson and to get into the parking lot you have to drive down the street quite a ways and then take a u-turn to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Paid For”
Reviews.Author: iluvpace
Reviews.Content: Rates of the room is around $60-$70 & very conveniently located. I understand that some of the good reviews are b.c. the front desk were very friendly and housekeeping did their job and I must say the warm cookies were GREAT but I would not recommend to any of my friends to stay here. I have seen several complaints about the loud elevator and I still decided to go ahead and book b.c. of the good reviews and the price was a factor also. Our room was next to the service elevator. Heard it constantly in the morning so had to move to another room down the hall. Unfortunately, still heard the main elevator. Very annoying if you are a light sleeper. Whoever they hired to do the bathroom needs to be fired. Wish I could take a pic of the vessel sink b.c. it was very entertaining to wonder who was the genius behind installing it. Next time, i rather spend a lil extra to get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: WalterA98
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel (Radisson Hotel Orlando at Lake Buena Vista) through Expedia. Orlando offers a variety of hotels to meet all budgets. We chose this hotel after reading the many positive reviews it received from its guests. We are joining the long list of satisfied customers. If you are considering this hotel for your family’s Disney vacation, by all means go for it without hesitation. I have stayed at several hotels during my business trips but this one ranks at the very top for cleanliness and comfort. The staff was extremely friendly. It was certainly nice to come back to a clean hotel room after a long day at the attractions. The pool was perfect for my 8 year old twin girls (a nice way to end the evening). The beds were oh so comfortable. I asked for a room upgrade upon check-in and was offered one for a very reasonable fee. The flat screen TVs were a nice surprise. This hotel is close to all the major attractions. The hotel provides courtesy shuttles, although we did not use it. I recommend you take your car anyway since parking is only $12 at the attractions. The area surrounding the hotel has plenty of eating options. (Hint: stay away from Cece’s Pizza Buffet. If you want pizza you are better off ordering a large pie. Golden Corral offers the best buffet option.) The only somewhat negative aspect was the high-speed internet was not so high-speed. This hotel easily exceeded my expectations and we will certainly stay in again upon our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel when compared to others in its price range”
Reviews.Author: iHeart_Disney02
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times. Each time we have had minor problems with small things like the TV or the vending machines in the halls. After staying in March, we decided to stay at another hotel that claimed to be a ' resort ' for around the same price as the Radisson LBV. After that stay, we will definitely be staying at the Radisson from now on. I never once questioned the cleanliness of the room at the Radisson, it always smelled fresh, felt and looked clean. The bathrooms are always spotless and towels are replenished daily. We love that all the rooms come standard with a microwave AND refrigerator, when the other hotel wanted to charge an extra $20 to be put on a waiting list for just a fridge ! The only negatives to this hotel for us would be the location with the U-Turn on SR-535 (not really a big deal, just a little annoying), and we wish there was more of a view instead of just looking at the hideous GiftLand building. This hotel is awesome is cleanliness, comfort, and the value. The management is also wonderful because whenever we had a minor problem, the manager sent out free night certificates and a letter apologizing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone needing somewhere to stay for a weekend getaway or quick trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fab service and location”
Reviews.Author: penwah82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson in August 09 and was very impressed with the quality and location of this great hotel. The room was large and modern with 2 king size beds. The sleep number feature of the beds is very good touch. The maid service was excellent as the room was always cleaned impeccably. We also ate downstairs in the Liquid Bar and Grill for breakfast most days and several times for dinner. The chef does as excellent job as the food is very good and really good value. The waiting staff are also extremely accommodating and friendly, notably Gabriel and Aziz. Overall a very enjoyable stay, will definitely come back when visiting Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ieesha
Reviews.Content: this hotel is convenient to disney and very clean. I don't recommend buying attraction tickets from the front desk. the sleep number beds were amazing, and the late night staff were very curteous with resolution of problems with minor housekeeping issue with changing linen. Overall it was quiet and relaxing after our long day stay at the parks. And the price is very reasonable. My only complaint was I had inquired about transporation to and from the disney parks at reservation. I was told that buses ran frequently, but was not informed about how infrequent they came around. I would not rely on their bus transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a quick get-away”
Reviews.Author: navajoqueen
Reviews.Content: The hotel when you walk in is very impessive, very clean and open. The staff is very helpful and attend all your needs. On the night I got there a little baby and her mother came into the front desk the baby was shaking the mother was all shook up the young man at the desk stepped right up and took control of the situation, he handled the mother with kid gloves. The pool area was relaxing good location for the hotel lots of eateries around. I would recommend this hotel for families too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for short stays”
Reviews.Author: one4gatr
Reviews.Content: I cant argue with most of the positive comments about this place. Its a nice hotel located near just about everything you could imagine. Price is also very reasonable. A couple of things I will comment on... ok the u-turns on 535 can be a bit of a pain but this is Orlando folks just about EVERYTHING you do in this town is a bit of a pain. I didnt find this too irritating. The time share desk... OK... I dont get it... Radisson Hotel pimping Holiday Inn time share... I didnt get any calls during our 7 day stay but did get run down in the parking lot on checkout. Typical timeshare deal though... spend 1/2 your day and get a discount on the hotel and tickets on a return trip so if this is your sort of thing then by all means go for it. We did not utilize the pool or food services on the grounds so I cannot comment. As for the sleep number beds well you either love them or hate them... I liked the wife did not... The internet was as most have described (spotty) I used both wireless and LAN. Now on to my biggest disappointment. The rooms are great BUT the windows and walls are paper thin. I could hear the elevator brakes from my room (about 6 rooms from the elevator) which got very aggrevating over 7 days. You can definately hear the traffic outside (or some sort of noise) no matter what room you stay in (we stayed in 515 backside away from I4). Sirens, garbage trucks, jackhammer, leaf blowers we heard every bit of them. Worked like a 6am wakeup call daily. The AC unit also sounds like a loud vacuum when it shuts off. If I had only stayed here one or two nights it would have been ok but over 7 days I got really tired of it. So overall I rated this hotel average though I can see where some would rate it 5-star. When I return in December this will not be my hotel of choice. With some minor insulation and an upgrade to the windows this hotel would rate one of the best in Orlando. But for $79.00 per night I could have done alot worse so if your budget is tight this is probably the nicest hotel under $100 in the area if you can deal with the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Preventer77
Reviews.Content: The Raddison is one of the best hotels in the area. Spotless, spacious rooms, comfortable beds, great service. We loved the suite that we stayed in. The rooms have flat screen tvs, refrigerator, microwave. Their beds are awesome, they have the number bed, which it is the best. The bathroom is equipped with marble floor and counter top with a wash bowl sink. This Raddison is top noth and it is closed to all Disney attractions and many restaurants and convenience stores.

Reviews.Title: “clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: SusieEK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved it! It is the best deal around. The room was large and spotless. Everyday we saw people cleaning the hotel inside and out -- cleaning the carpets, spraying the sidewalks... We used the pool and enjoyed the poolside bar. We did not use the restaurant as we saved money by eating breakfast in our room, but my husband did have a Starbucks latte every morning. There is a refrigerator and a microwave. There are plenty of delicious restaurants nearby as well as a grocery store. We were so close to all the Disney attractions -- it took us less time to get to the parks than my sister's family who were staying on Disney property ( and we paid a third of what she paid for the room!)

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotell”
Reviews.Author: Palmontana
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 1 week in June 09, and everything was perfect. Nice and clean hotel and good price. The breakfast staff are extremely service minded we remember especially Gabriel. They have highchairs for children and crayons, very nice. Location is awsome, close to Prime Outlet, Downtown Disney, Crossroads with restaurants). Would absolute stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: lotusgoldfish
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotels.com through the recommendation of our friend and this hotel is really superb and my family really enjoyed our 1 week stay in this hotel. The staff are all very knowledgeable ,accommodating and helpful. We get to buy our tickets to disney and seaworld also at the lobby, less hassle when you buy it at the parks.The rooms are well-kept by the housekeeper. We stayed there for a week from July 25.She is really very good and deserves to be commended for her effort. Imagine after a long day in the theme parks we are welcomed by our clean room, and well kept, comfortable sleep number beds. They have a microwave and a refrigerator in the room and also a sofa bed. Plus my son even gets to swim in their warm pool at night. Very close to Walmart supercenter, to the parks , restaurants and to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oldham74
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & i stayed at this hotel during the american leg of our around the world trip. The reason we chose this hotel was because of the location & the excellent rate, i think we payed around $79. The hotel is situated opposite the entrance gate to disney & is very convenient for lake buena vista shops & restaurants. The hotel is quite new. We stayed at this hotel for a total of 4 nights over 2 seperate stays. The first stay we were put on the 8th floor facing lake buena vista (this is the best side to be on as on the opposite side there is the highway & not much of a view). We were very impressed with our room & liked the decor. There are large lcd tv's on the wall although they are cheap ones & we had problems with our signal on more than one occasion. I have read other reviews that mention the noise from the elevators/lifts & i can confirm that we were able to hear them too even though our room was at least 4 doors down the hall from the elevators so there is not much sound proofing going on in this building. I got the impression that even though this hotel looks good it was built quickly & cheaply. The mattresses are quite good as you can choose your own settings for firmness. Regarding internet they let us use the computer in their back office which was very helpful but not very private. Can't comment on the pool as we didn't use it but it looked ok. After our first 2 night stay we checked out to go & rent a villa in Kissimmee for a week. On our return we were warmly greeted again (the staff are very nice & friendly) & checked-in very quickly. We asked for the same room as we had stayed in before but it was unavailable so we were put in the room next door (even further down the hall but we could still hear the whoosh of the elevators!) however we soon found out the tv wasn't working properly, the toilet seat was broken & there was a strange stain near the bed which looked very dodgy. I called downstairs to inform the front desk & they apologised & moved us across the hall to the room opposite (overlooking the highway, noisy & boring view). Unbelievably the tv wasn't working in this room either & they had to send a guy up to fix it. When i complained, again, we were given $10 off the room & a couple of vouchers for a free starter at the restaurant (which we didn't bother to use). Overall the hotel is in a convenient location albeit a noisy one& is good value but i cannot believe it is #1 on Tripadvisor for Orlando. On a previous trip to Orlando we stayed at The Courtyard at Lake Buena Vista & really liked it there & if i had to choose between the two i would definitely choose The Courtyard over the Radisson but it is more expensive...

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: pmpwein
Reviews.Content: We went to the Radisson in the end of July with 3 teens and two adults. When we got there they upgraded us to the two room suite. It was perfect. the staff was nice and the hotel was spotless. We loved the beds and the pool area. We had a great time and would stay again. We spent the last part of our trip at Universal on site hotel which cost a ton more and was no nice then this hotel. The only issue I would have to say is coming and going from the hotel was a pain. We had to keep u-turning on rt 4.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollerCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel after reading all the other positive reviews and was not disappointed. The hotel seems brand new and the rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. Also the location is perfect – close too all the theme parks and within easy access to the highways. We were a little worried though, that it might be a little too close to the traffic, but there was no traffic-noise in our room at all. The hotel is actually situated a few hundred meters from the main road to Disney (theme parks and downtown Disney). You will definitely have to drive though, as the main road covers a very long distance and downtown Disney, as the closest, is about a 5 minutes drive. The hotel has a service-desk providing information about all the theme parks, and tickets can be purchased here in advance saving time at the front gates. This was however not a problem, as it seemed all the theme parks were below half full. There were only few quees - max. 20 minutes on few of the most popular attractions – all the others you could walk right in. There was a pool which looked really nice - we didn’t use it, but it seemed to be popular. We tried breakfast buffet, but this was actually very ordinary – it wasn’t expensive though, but still not worth the money. Only complaint really was one nights sleep interrupted by the firealarm. All the guests was running to the parking lot carrying sleeping and frightened children, but we didn’t receive any useful information at all and apparently it was false alarm, but still quite upsetting (not the way you are expecting to be woken up). Afterwards the firealarm came back on a couple of times and there was shouting and banging in the corridors for the next couple of hours apparently due to a group of people caught in the elevator. We mentioned this at the reception next morning and were given a 50% discount for the night in question, without any arguing. But this extraordinary event didn’t spoil the overall impression – this is a very nice and ideally situated hotel, which we will definitely use again if staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel close to disney”
Reviews.Author: robdac
Reviews.Content: I won't rehash all that's already been said about the hotel. It's a great value new construction hotel very close to Disney with clean rooms and many amenities. The management is clearly running it well. All the other reviews are right on. If I were going back I would stay here again. I only have two observations. One, don't underestimate how long it can take to get turned around with Orlando traffic when you need to make a U-turn to get back to the hotel. We stayed a week and by the second day I was wishing the hotel had better access through the shopping center next door. It's very frustrating to drive past the front door of your hotel and then have to spend 5 -10 minutes to get turned around and back to it. I'm sure the owners wish it had better access as well. Second, the "high speed" internet didn't meet my expectations. I never got the wireless to work well in my room (I didn't try the common areas of the hotel) because the connection was too poor. The front desk was kind enough to give me a LAN cable to use during my stay but that didn't help for higher demand use. Simple things loaded fine but pages that required bandwidth were very slow or dropped the connection completely. Don't even think of trying to have the kids watch streaming TV or Netflix over the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the top value?”
Reviews.Author: thyssens
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11pm after an exhausting day at the magic kingdom. Needless to say that the kids (8/6/4) just wanted to sleep. They put us on the 8th floor next to the elevators and below (I think) the elevator engine. My kids were immediately asleep before I could call the front desk to tell them about the noise. I did anyway and they told me to to tell the front desk in the morning. But the elevator noise was not the only problem. The ac unit was efficient but very old style and thus also very noisy. And on top of that, the street noise was very loud... So, all in all we didn't sleep a minute and decided to leave in the morning (the plan was 2 nights) and change hotels. When I checked out, the girl said "Oh I'm sorry, they put you next to the elevators" In my review, I told them I should not have paid for that room and they offered me a complimentary night in their hotel which I have yet to receive. I don't understand the reviews on tripadvisor. This was a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel - and I am NOT easy to please”
Reviews.Author: LLTG
Reviews.Content: Per my title, I am not very easy to please when it comes to hotels. Chalk it up to watching too many Dateline stories :) - THIS hotel is 100% the exception. The most important item to me and my family when we travel is how clean our space is. HANDS DOWN, this was the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in. We are in our mid 30's and both travel heavily for work and we travel on extended trips 3-4 times per year with our daughter. The maid service was incredible. I can not recall the name of the maid that served our room the entire week we were there but she was incredible. Very sweet and each day said good morning to us and always wished us a good day at the parks. In the mid afternoon when we came back to "refresh" and hang by the pool she always spoke to our 6 year old and asked her what her favorite part of the day was?! That was an added extra customer service feel. Checking in was a breeze, the reception area was super friendly.
