At one point during our stay my room key stopped working, luckily the maid was in the hallway and allowed us in the room because she knew us (another benefit to speaking with the customers, that created an awesome customer experience for us because we were all very tired and had a very grouchy 6 year old on our hands - if the maid wouldn't have known who we were, I am positive she would not have let us in) the guy at the front desk took the time to explain that if I had a blackberry or one of the more recent phones, not to put my key near it because often times the phone will deactivate the card - who know? I certainly didn't, but he took the time to tell me that and I didn't have that issue again. The pool was really nice, noisy during the day bc of street traffic but unless you are paying several hundred dollars to be at a secluded resort, you are going to have that. Next on my list is the price - we usually rent a house when we come to Orlando but recently had a bad experience so decided to try this hotel - NEVER again will I get a house - leaving a messy room and returning to a nice clean room has its perks and because of the price, staff and value we WILL be back - we already have our October reservation and our reservation in April 2010. As far as comments you see here about the beds - I loved the sleep number, my husband did not and he had back issues the week we were there. BUT you are going to have that regardless because "there is no place like home". The traffic getting in and out of the hotel is the ONLY part that was less than desirable but that is the price you pay for the awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Will consider booking here again next time in Disney”
Reviews.Author: journeyrhythm
Reviews.Content: Overall my spouse and I had a wonderful one week stay. We are very sensitive about clean rooms. I'm glad to report the Radisson maintained a high standard of cleansiness (keep it up). The staff was kind and helpful. The hotel is a five minute drive from downtown Disney and Typhoon Lagoon. There are many restaurants within walking distance. The shutlle can get you to Epcot in about 10 minutes or so. Sea World and Universal are about a 5-8 minute drive along the I-4. There is a good sized pool and a small fitness room on site. My only hang-up with the Radisson is that the main road it is located on gets very congested at night. Getting into the hotel entrance can be a pain. We enjoyed our stay and if the Radisson keeps the standards unlike other new hotels who let their standards slide then we would be more than happy to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great location”
Reviews.Author: HENROS
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days in this hotel. First night we had a room facing the highway - it was very noisy, but the hotel gave us at nother quiet room the next day. Quick and kind service. The hotel is located next to an area with many restaurants and some shops (eg. a 24/7 supermarket). The hotel is close to Disney, Universal eg. If you like to shop, try the two outlets Prime and Premium - great prices. Next time we go to Orlando, we will stay here again - it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Solid quality above expectations”
Reviews.Author: discoguy
Reviews.Content: I was expecting this to be a fairly decent hotel with a small room but lo and behold it was a very large rectangular room with 2 queen beds, LCD TV, a writing desk and even a couch which was rather surprising for a hotel of this standard. Cleanliness was top notch and it's really a simple hotel that is comfortable, clean and has lots of space not to mention free parking. The staff were nice though you don't see many around. I've no doubt that this hotel though smaller than the typical resort like Orlando hotel sets a very good standard in it's rooms. However we did not have the breakfast nor ever ate at the hotel as the restaurant did not look great. There are quite a few restaurants, IHOP, Smuckers, etc nearby. It's very close to the Orlando Premium outlet mall though I'd recommend a rental car to move around. I had a room facing the back and it was quite quiet. The only downside is the internet access which is free is unstable.

Reviews.Title: “Quietest, most comfy stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: travelzim2
Reviews.Content: We came here in January with our college-age daughter. Only stayed 1 night wish we could have stayed longer. This place was so clean, quiet and comfy! Never heard any outside sounds from roads, parking lot, elevator hall, or other rooms. We have stayed in Orlando many times over the years as we are a Floridian family but this was the nicest. I love this place and will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Radisson I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: TuffLilCritic
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, the rooms were fantastic we got a family room that had 2 rooms. The rooms were really big, clean, and the beds were fantastic. We also loved the pool and jacuzzi because it was really spacious and even though there was alot of people it seemed like the pool was all to our selves because it was pretty big. We also liked that it was so close to Disney and to alot of other good places. I think that it was also very very clean, the staff was very good, the elevators were fast, and the rooms were very really nice.. We are definetly going to be staying there again and by far this is the best radisson i have ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: needanotherholiday43
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from 9 nights at this hotel with my husband and 4 children, 21, 16, 14 and 8. We had a family suite. Although the proximity to the main I4 was a little worrying we could not hear any noise form it while in the room. Check in was very quick and painless and the staff were incredibly helpful. The room was clean and reasonably spacious, the only problem was that for the family suite there is only one bathroom which housed not only the wash basin and bath/shower unit but the toilet as well. Now as I am sure you can imagine when 6 people wake up at the same time and all try to get ready to leave together having only 1 bathroom was a bit of a problem, for this reason I would only recommend the family suite for families with younger children. The beds had been raved about by quite a few reviews but I have to say that very few of us had a comfortable night with the 'sleep number beds', it was like sleeping on an air bed that changed setting nightly, normal sprung mattress with a topper would have been preferable. My husband came home not being able to stand straight. Unfortunately the family suites are next to the lifts and so you can hear them working throughout the day and night. The housekeeping staff were very efficient and the room was always very clean with nice new towels replaced daily. The only problem was that they kept altering the room temperature, where we would set it to around 72 F but we would always come back and it would be lower. This was the worst when we came back at 9pm one night it being still over 90 F outside to find the room temperature at 60 F, it was like walking into an ice box. The pool was more than adequate and was very rarely crowded. The loungers and chairs by the pool had great thick cushions and the pool towels were great and fluffy. Because of the closeness of 2 major roads there was a few times when the noise didn't make for a very relaxing time. The pool bar was open daily from midday. We had only one major problem and that was a fire alarm and midnight, the guests dutifully evacuated via the stairs and congregated in the car park and not one member of staff came to tell us what was going on. Some guests went back into the hotel and were told that it as a false alarm so everyone went back to their rooms. NOT ONCE did a member of staff inform guests what was happening or make sure that everyone was ok. I did mention this fact at check out and they refunded that night cost which was great but not sure whether the staff had really been trained as in how to deal with an emergency like that. All in all we had a relaxing time and the location of the hotel was great with easy access to main routes. Not sure I would stay again though because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaCaracas
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel, the cleanliness of the room and bathroom was outstanding,and the bed was very comfortable . Although it does not include breakfast, you could find a lot of options, nearby, even a Waflle House is at walking distance. The location is really close to the Disney parks, and to the Premium Outlet, and plenty of food restaurants, it is just at one side of the I-4. It has also free parking, and a rather small swimming pool that we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: curlsfa05
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints with this hotel. Everything was classy from the lobby to the elevator to the room. Very nice updates. Great sleep number beds and good value.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: iwnt2trvl
Reviews.Content: We were in Orlando originally scheduled from 6/12/09-6/18/2009. During this time we stay in the Marriot Harbour Lake. We were having so much fun that we decided to stay longer. As we were checking out of the Marriott, I jumped on Trip Advisor for reviews. I was hesitant at stay at a hotel because we are use to the size of the timeshares (2 bedrooms, living room, 2 baths etc). But since we knew we were going to be at the parks we decided what the heck. We had passed the Radisson almost every day and from the outside it is nothing special. We got to the Radisson on 06/18 and stay until 06/20. We were able to secure a family room. We were SO thrilled with this hotel. The staff from beginning to end was awesome. We encountered Lisa at the front desk and she was awesome in helping up secure the only available room in the hotel. The lobby and lobby restroom were very nice. My kids ran over and picked up the cookies right away. It ended up lightening and we had to come back early from the park. We ended up having dinner at the hotel both nights we stayed. The restaurant food was awesome. The servers were pleasant and the chef came out and spoke to each person in our party both days. The next day we ordered coffee at the bar before heading out to Typhoon Lagoon. We called it an early day and came back to the hotel because we were enjoying ithe hotel so much. The kids ran and got cookies again. We went to the pool, ate dinner in the bar area and order some drinks after the kids settled in for the night and spent some time with their older sister. All in all this we had an AWESOME experience at this hotel. Plus, it is a bargain. We are use to more space but we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: disneyluv06
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Radisson - Lake Buena Vista with my family. We stayed for 6 nights and had a wonderful time at the hotel. I've been reading the reviews on Trip Advisor since we booked this hotel and I finally get to share my experience. From the moment we stepped into the lobby, it was beautiful. The women at the front desk were very kind and check-in was a breeze. They even asked us what floor we preferred our room to be in. One thing I disliked was after check-in they sent us over to a representative for time share presentations who was very annoying. We took the elevator to get to our room. The elevators were gorgeous and throughout our entire stay we never had to wait for the elevators like in other hotels we've stayed at. The rooms were wonderful. The sleep number beds were great and the flat screen tv was excellent. My mother has a back problem and throughout our entire stay she never complained about her back. I guess we need to get her a sleep number bed. The microwave and refrigerator were big pluses for us. They had free wireless internet which could have been better. I loved the bathroom and the bowl sink. Each day, we got back to a spotless room. They also refilled on their amazing toiletries. I loved the oatmeal soap they provided. They also left small bottles of hand sanitizer which we loved. We used the pool one time and it was nice. Their lounge chairs by the pool were extremely comfortable. The hotel also had chocolate chip cookies available in the lobby which were delicious. I have no complaints about this hotel, no wonder it's rated number one here on Trip Advisor. From the beautiful rooms to the kind staff to the amenities, it's simply the best! I will definitely stay at the Radisson - Lake Buena Vista again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hvbrasil
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews friom other site and I was not sure that I had made the right choice until I get there. The hotel is great, Locatioon is perfect to us, rooms are clean and new, all the staff was extremly friend with us. I am more than positive to suggest this hotel or even get back there. the only down point if you are looking for a hotel with has a huge pool or need things to do in the Hotel you might consider another one, but accomodations and Hotel is great for the value. i AM EXTREMELY SATISFY WITH MY STAYING THERE AND i WOULD DEFINETLY GO BACK THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Appplepie
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights (5/8 &9) at this hotel. We decided to stay at this hotel because of the short distance to Disney Village and the reviews that were on the tripadvisor. The staff was very attentive (great interpersonal skills) from the time we arrived until check out. The rooms were very neat and clean (thanks to the cleaning staff). We'd also like to give special thanks to Jamie, Dianna & Gabe for the excellent service. We feel the restaurant could use some improvement by expanding the menu and service. Our breakfast did not meet the standard of the hotel. However, about a week later we did receive a follow up from the hotel regarding our stay. Once we explained the situation, we were meal voucher to return to the hotel within a year. Thanks again, residence-Clearwater, Fl

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, comfortable, clean, close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: finamore
Reviews.Content: We spend just one night there, after leaving Tampa, to be in Orlando early next day to visit SeaWorld. The Hotel is conveniently located, clean, and everything is new. The buffet at breakfast was simple but complete. The staff very very friendly. It really made our short trip enjoyable. If or when we will go back to Orlando we surely will stay here again, Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: hagerterp
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week with our kids. The location was excellent. One exit from Sea World and close to Downtown Disney and other Disney attractions. We had extended family stay at the Disney All-Star Resort and the only thing it had over the Radisson was the pool. The hotel staff was great and took care of the only minor problem we had with no questions asked. Highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnB99
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my wife and 2 young children and it was the perfect base for visiting the Disney parks and Seaworld both of which are within a 15 minute drive. There are also excellent places to eat and shop within a few minutes walking distance. The room itself was pristene, very comfortable and exactly as promised. The buffet breakfast was excellent but we didn't eat in the restaurant at other times. All the staff were extremely helpful. An excellent place to stay and somewhere i would recommend to anyone looking for a comfortable place stay with everything to hand.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: S_Florida05
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay during our last trip to Disneyworld. We often travel to Orlando but this was our first stay at the Radisson. The location is good; at the North entrance to Downtown Disney with many dining options within walking distance and shopping a short drive away. The check in was fast but stay away from the "welcome" discount package, which is nothing more that trying to get you to a timeshare resort for 90 minutes. In return, you will receive theme park tickets and a discounte hotel stay. Unless you are willing to sit through a hard sell, avoid this. The room is very comfortable with sleep number beds that allow each person to set the firmness of the mattress. This is a lifesaver after a day at Disney. The hotel restaurant is pricey for breakfast but there is a waffle house in the parking lot and an IHOP about two blocks down the street. Overall, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: capi42111
Reviews.Content: My son and daughter were coming down to visit from PA, so my husband and I wanted to make this into a Disney trip as well. I was able to find the Radisson on the internet. I liked that it was only 1/4 mile from the Disney entrance, and it was a newer hotel. I was wonderful! Very clean, and comfortable. We had a room that had 2 queen sized, sleep number beds, and also used the sofa bed which was also very comfortable. All the staff were very nice, and greeted us warmly; and the housekeeping staff did a wonderful job keep the room clean and tidy while we were out. Towels were replaced, and everything neatly organized. I usually have trouble sleeping the first night in a hotel, but it wasn't the case here. I was very quiet and comfortable. I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, kids did not want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: familyfuntrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel June 23-25 2009 as an add on to our 7 night stay at Disney's Pop Century Resort. 2 adults and 3 children age 12,10 and 6. My kids liked this hotel better. The hotel was in a good location. It is a beautiful hotel. The room was very classy with a 37 inch flat screen, wall mounted television which was my children's favorite. They did not want to leave the room. Queen size beds with adjustable mattress's. Refridgerator and microwave. Pullout sofa sleeper. Carpet was in good shape. Nice bathroom. Nice size room. Pool and hottub also nice. Saw a very nice gym but did not use. The only complaint that I have is that we were near the elevator room 714 and you could hear it all night. we were also on the highway side of the hotel and you could hear the traffic. I would request a room on the opposite side of the hotel and at the lower end of the hotel if you have an issue with noise. I would stay here again but would request a different room because the noise did bother my husband. The staff was very friendly and I know they would have changed our room if we asked. We were only their for 2 nights so we did not bother.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service despite our many heavy shipments in and out”
Reviews.Author: henkdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson as we participated in an exhibition at the Orlando Convention Centre. This involved shipping in 18 ! heavy boxes with computer equipment and readying it for the show from varius parts of the country and overseas. The staff was super helpful all the time despite the sizable space we took in the adminimstrative room and in our room. Similarly we were helped to return the materials after the show. Cleaning ladies did their best to clean the room whereever they could reach. And always with a smile. The room was clean, the reception impeccable, the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: maddy11
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and my 3 boys for 14 days,and in short words I can say it was excellent, I really have no complain and if I ever travel to Orlando again I will repeat this hotel .Very clean ,its not noisy as i read on old reviews, great pool area .Great location ,restaurants ,malls ,down town Disney. The sleep # beds great and an extra bed every thing was comfortable. Check in and check out was very fast.Really with my eyes close I recommend it .I don't work there and no relatives there. I'm from P.R. And the price is great. Thanks a lot to all the staff at the hotel my family had a great time. It also had computers at the lobby for the guests use.

Reviews.Title: “DC- "Great Value, Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: CMA_DA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from June 12-19 visiting Orlando for the first time. I have to admit that I had high expectation about this hotel before I left by reading all the wonderful ratings and reviews. I must say that it did exceed my expectation. My husband and I had a wonderful time staying at this hotel. It was brand new, comfortable, clean and close to the many attractions in Orlando. We stayed on the 7th floor facing the Souvnier shop.The hotel was quiet and relaxing , perfect for those exhasting days after the theme parks. We did not use the pool or eat at the resturant. We preferred going shopping at the nearby Walmart supercenter for our food since the room has a fridge and microwave. Here are some cons: The location of the hotel is right off the highway, & busy street, You will need to make a U-turn. Parking at night is often really full and sometimes hard to find one, but we managed and always found parking anyways. House Keeping accidently took my towels that I brought from home, I called the reception in the morning and that night my towels were brought back cleaned and washed.. So I guess it turned out to be a good thing. House keeping ladies, were always smiling and saying hello, and front desk had good customer service as well. I would definetly recommend this hotel again and will be booking this hotel anytime I'm travelling in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 60buick
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Orlando. The staft is super. While we were there my wife had a medical emergency and needed fire rescue for help. I called the front desk and they were super in getting the needed help. They called back when they were on the way, arrived at the hotel and again when they were on the way up in the elevator. They exted our stay for as long as we needed at the discounted rate. The facility is new and is well maintained. It is convenient to all of the parks. This is the best deal in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: lavrn0223
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this particular Radisson, we have stayed many times at the Radisson in Kissimmee and have always been pleased. This is a newly constructed hotel, only about a year old, I believe. It was beautiful from the moment we walked in the lobby-- our room was sparkling clean, fluffy white comforters on the bed ( I liked that it couldn't hide if it was dirty), the bathroom was lovely, a little contemporary for my taste with the unusual fixtures, but everything worked great. We had very nice maid service, we asked the first day for our room to be cleaned earlier in the day because we returned for lunch, the next day we forgot something in our room and went back about 30 min later to get it, and the room had already been done!!! Nice pool area, BIG, FLUFFY towels by the pool to use, and cushioned lounge chairs!!! All for about $85-90 per night!!!! We had 2 adults, 2 teenagers and a 9 yr old in my room and there was room for everyone. The pull out couch slept one, and my dtr said it was pretty comfortable. It was located just off I-4, no problem to find or to park, only about 1-3 miles from Disney (depending on which park), so getting to the parks was simple. There is a complementary shuttle that the teenagers took themselves one day with no problem- I liked that, and they did too. Traffic tends to be a little heavy at this location,and you do have to U-turn down the street to get back into the lot if you are coming from the opposite direction- that got a little annoying, but nothing we couldn't handle. Overall, great stay, great value- would definitely recommend!! We go to Disney about every 2 yrs,and I always stay with Radisson- I've never been disappointed!!!! Happy vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in excellent location and good value, too!”
Reviews.Author: justchillinout
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a queen double room. The room was larger than we expected and had a refirgerator and small coffee station. The couch could pullout for addtional bed space if needed. 37 in flat screen TV and sleep number beds. Very comfortable. Granite throughout and in the bathroom, too. When we arrived there was a slight mixup with our reservation that the hotel promptly took responsibility for and also gave us complimentary breakfast for the morning. Breakfast was good, buffet and cook to order menu. Good location for entry to Disney area, outlet shopping and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service-5 stars all the way”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service at this hotel-better than a five star hotel. The restaurant staff in particular were fantastic-professional, courteous, willing to do anyhitng for you. Rooms are clean and large with great housekeeping. A wonderful stay-kudos to the staff and the management.

Reviews.Title: “Free Friday Deal - But Will Stay Again Regardless”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler62
Reviews.Content: As a Hospitality and Tourism instructor, I always share with my students my experiences when I travel - especially customer service at the hotels and details about the hotel. While researching Orlando hotels for an assignment, my students found this property. Since I was traveling with my famly for the weekend - selected this hotel for our trip. At this time, Radisson is running a special deal at some of their properties that if you stay at least two nights - Thursday thru Saturday..Friday night is free. (The cost is deducted at check-out) The lobby was very clean and well appointed. Customer service at check -in was very efficient and friendly. Quick check in. I was tired after a day at Universal Studios so that was a nice perk plus the chocolate chip cookies at the desk. :) The staff was at check-in, at check-out, maid service, pool area - all very pleasant and always said hello or smiled. The room was more than I expected. Nicely appointed furniture - tray ceiling with crown molding, artwork, pleasant colors for paint job, small pillars at the business area (with desk and small pull out sofa), marble tile in bathroom, modern bowl sink in bathroom, usual toiletries but good quality (but one that I found perfect - hand sanitizer for a day at the parks). Beds were super comfortable, clean and inviting. Everything was spotless. Pool area - Wall around the pool area so you don't have to look at the parking lot. The pool chaise lounges were better than any hotel that I have stayed at lately. Big cushions for a relaxing time poolside - no rubber slats to cover up with your towel. Bar at the pool for those wanting to partake in poolside beverages. I didn't eat at any of the on-side restaurants. Walked to the Crossroads Marketplace about a block away - my two nine years olds wanted to eat at TGI Fridays and McDonalds. Lots of restaurant choices in the plaza and Goodings grocery store. All about a city block away. Excellent location for Disney parks - it is right at the end of Disney Hotel Row coming from the Disney Marketplace/Downtown Disney area. We spent two days at Universal Studios (20 minute drive) and one day at Disney. If there would be any "negative" - it has nothing to do with the hotel or the service..it is just pulling out and trying to get on I-4. We would leave early in the AM and didn't have any trouble. However, the hotel management can't control traffic. Walk if you can to the restaurants and be patient when pulling in and out - it is easiest to just go down to the lights and pull into a business or do a U-turn. So that is way I didn't give it an "excellent" for location - some people just aren't "patient" when driving in tourist areas and want to fly out of the parking lot and get some where in 5 minutes flat.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: WarrensDen
Reviews.Content: Excellent location to Epcot Resort and Universal Studios. The staff were excellent and the accomodations went beyond my expectations. The on site restaurant was delicious and the menu choices ranked right up there with many upscale establishments. We will use this hotel again when we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Staff, Comfortable Rooms, near WDW Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: 07fit
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista was fantastic hotel. Our guest room was very spacious, and comfortable. There were 5 ppl in our party. The room had 2 Queen Select Number Beds, and a good size oull out slepper sofa. Each room a iron/iron board, in-room safe, mini refrig, and microwave. Hotel amenities included a 24 hour fitness center, a nice size pool and hot tube. And Monday to Friday they have freshly baked chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. Housekeeping staff were helpful and did their job perfect. The front desk staff (including Front Manager) helped with sending up an amenity for my parents anniversary. Housekeeping really took care of us, she would put extra towels in the room, & organize our tolietries in the bathroom. The location of the hotel was very close to great restaurants, Orlando Premuim Outlets, and of course the WDW Theme Parks. If you like steak & seafood, I recommend Johnny's Hideaway (a bit pricey), but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRoadKing
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels over 140 nights per year. When in Orlando, I stay at the Radisson Hotel Orlando in Lake Buena Vista. The hotel is new (less than 1 yr old?) and is right off of I-4 near the Disney Village. The rooms are suite-sized, with an LCD TV, seperate couch/ desk area and the hotel has those Sleep Number beds, which are extremely comfortable. The staff is excellent, and go out of their way to please their guests, beginning when you check in. There is lobby bar and a restaurant on the premises. The food in the restaurant is very good and not overpriced like in some other hotels. Last time I ate there, the chef personally came out and checked on the quality of my meal after I started eating. You just don't get that kind of customer care in many mid-sized hotels. I've stayed in at least 30 different hotels in the area and now come to this Radisson excusively. I recommend this property to anyone either passing through the area or staying for a vacation. It is one of the best kept secrets in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, worth its high TripAdvisor rating”
Reviews.Author: zztupper
Reviews.Content: Very good new Radisson Hotel, clean spacious rooms, friendly, helpful staff, free internet, easy parking near main attractions, all you'd expect from top range hotel and a bit more. We got pretty good 5-day deal (for conference), then free upgrade to spa room. Lots of positives, only minor negatives: nice pool but near to busy I4 so some noise pollution and a bit bare with not much foliage around. Also no safe in room though felt safe (as it were).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Clean, Confy ..a great deal”
Reviews.Author: nmartinez
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for four nights with my two little boys and foud the place to be a great deal...it was very clean, confy and close to all the attractions! Very good deal ...very satisfied costumer.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SHEILA147
Reviews.Content: I loved the radison lake buena vista hotel. Very clean, fantastic rooms and lobie. The pool is wonderful and there is a hot tub for night relaxing after go to the disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: BBCleo
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, top of the line finishes not commonly found in a Radisson, knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating staff, great beds and pillows and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: atravellerIL
Reviews.Content: The service was great, everyone was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. This was absolutely the best 3 star hotel ever. If you do stay here, though, be forewarned that the "service desk" where you can buy tickets to local attractions is staffed by salespeople not affiliated with the hotel - if you buy tickets there, they will aggressively try to sell you timeshares. They will offer discounted rates on tickets if you attend their timeshare sales pitch. That was really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: loribabes
Reviews.Content: We check in late, check in was very prompt and the person in the lobby is very professional and attentive. There is another guy next who offers time shares. all you have to say is no if you dont want it. I have no problem, I said no and they didnt pursue any further. That is just typical orlando, they sell time shares around. I'm used to it since we come to orlando often. The hotel lobby is very nice and clean. More of a bussiness hotel look than of a disney/orlando hotel. the rooms are very nice and clean. I'm not too impress with the sleep number beds, It took me awhile to figure out what number does really feel comfortable to me. It has the a large plasma TV. very nice! The space is ok, the room is a little but narrow but long. We stayed in the 8th floor and facing the I4, the noise did not bother me at all. The large fridge and microwave is very helpful. eventhough we eat out most of the day and night but we always have left overs, all we did was reheat and serves as good snacks or midnight snacks. The bathroom is in small side but It was enough. the swimming pool is nice with nice lounge chairs but it was not heated. i dont know if they have a heater and just not turn it on. But the water is very cold when we took a dip even in the middle of the day at 10 am. the spa is very nice though. the fitness room, i did not use but my husband used it 2-3 times, I did not hear any complaints from him, he mostly use it in the morning, i notice that the equipments are very nice- eliptical and tread mill. but the room is small. I also notice that there is not much people in the the morning than in the evening, so i would recommend to go in the morning. the restaurant looks nice, i walk in there but did not eat. very nice and classy looking, 10.99 breakfast buffet. but i cant say hows the taste, we did not eat there. overall, we really enjoyed the stay and for the price, I would be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As close to perfect as possible for the money!”
Reviews.Author: JL_theactress
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a co-worker of mine, and I am so glad we chose to stay here. The hotel is new and clean. Tthe rooms are beautiful with all kinds of extras - sleep number beds, flat screen TV - and the decor included lots of classy details, such as granite counter tops, a gentleman's height kitchenette area that housed a coffee pot, microwave and fridge, and beautiful headboards for the beds. With the building being brand new, right off the freeway, down the street from the Disney entrance and close to dozens of good restaurants, I was shocked when our weekend rate turned out to be $94.00 before tax! What a deal! The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the view - our room faced a giant blue gift shop in the next parking lot over. But we weren't there for the view - just a comfy, quiet place to retreat after a full days of enjoying the various Disney parks. For this reason, we didn't use the gym, pool, bar or restaurant, so we can't give our opinions on those. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They offered us to check in 2 hours before the usual check in time of 3pm since we arrived early. This was much welcome after a full morning of driving. Check out was a breeze - we used a credit card and received our billed statement under our door the morning of checkout. We didn't even need to go to the front desk - it was all complete! We have no problems referring this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place to sleep after being out and about at Disney. It is perfect for that. This is not a hotel to go to if you are looking for breathtaking views, a spa, and more relaxation type stuff. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: spasszeit
Reviews.Content: My wife, I and our 5 year old daughter stayed at this hotel for 7 nights at the beginning of May. Having paid for the hotel in advance, the check in took about a minute. The check out took about the same. The staff at the reception and throughout the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice, bright and clean. Like some other reviewers, we had some minor qurks - the TV remote operated in a funky fashion, the CAT 5 network cable was missing from the room, a plastic liner for the ice bucket was not provided on one occasion - but I would not lower my rating because of them. The pool was not huge, but big enough and there was a hot tub and my daughter loved it there. I am a light sleeper but I was not bothered by the sound of AC. Actually, I did not find it loud at all. Soundproofing in the room was great, at least we did not hear our neighbours at any time, which is a big plus in my book. Rear doors are right by the elevators, and it was very quick and convenient to carry bags from the parking lot. When it was time to leave my daughter started crying becuase she did not want to leave that place.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JRH3
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 2 year old daughter and I stayed at the Radisson for 4 nights in May. We had a great stay overall. We chose the hotel based on the reviews and also the great deal on price they had. The hotel is easily located off of the major highways (4/535). There are plenty of food chains in walking distance (mini golf) and an entrace to Disney a couple blocks away. Downtown Disney you could walk to if you wanted. The hotel is new and very nice. The rooms are well appointed with the sleep number beds etc. My wife and I liked the beds. We had 2 queens and also a loveseat couch and desk. Flat screen tv. Bathroom was pretty basic, tub was small and didn't seem to go with the rest of the decor but was fine. The room has a nice sized mini fridge and microwave which worked out well because we picked up some things from the grocery store (and having a young child). Checkin was a breeze eventhough we arrived at midnight. The pool was a typical no frills hotel pool and a small hot tub too. It worked well for us having a 2 year old who doesn't need alot of pool. There is a tiki bar by the pool as well. The staff was very nice. There is a restaurant/bar on site and the food was good. They advertise kids eat free, but keep in mind you need to order an adult entree (not sandwich or burger) to get the kids deal. My wife did do some business in the room and used the internet. It worked for the most part but was spotty at different times of the day. The wireless didn't really work well by the pool. Parking was free and there was no problems parking our rental. The warm cookies each day were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Clean, Clean”
Reviews.Author: winningteacher
Reviews.Content: Classy, clean, comfortable, crisp. Great facility. We flew in very late and check in was less than 2 mins. Absolutely comfortable. Housekeeping was meticulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Superb service.”
Reviews.Author: Beachbby
Reviews.Content: Came in for a quick stay to see the space shuttle launch. Location was great. Easy access to I4, 528, airport, Disney, Seaworld. Crossroads center next door with many restaurants available. Also ordered room service. The Chef called my husband about how he wanted his meal prepared and also called to follow up. Awesome service. Used business center to print boarding passes. Left laptop at home for downtime so no info on wireless service. Everything else A+++

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: southernsweety
Reviews.Content: We (my friends and I) take a trip to Orland almost every year. We've stayed in a different hotel each time. I think I've found the hotel we will always stay in when we're in Orlando. I got to Orlando about 10am and even though check in wasn't until that afternoon, I was still allowed to check in and begin the second half of my vacation. Housekeeping was friendly and always available to make sure we got whatever we needed. We ordered room service one morning and even that was great! Location is great for shopping and other area Orlando attractions. Also closer, if just by a couple of miles, to Tampa and Busch Gardens! If you go you've got to try the pool area, they have the best lounge chairs! Super comfortable! I've got only two complaints - no wireless internet in the room and one evening there was only one person at the desk who was already helping someone else, which was really an inconvience, especially when you've been on the road for a couple of hours and need to get to your room in a hurry. But other than that Radisoon is the best! It deserves #1!

Reviews.Title: “Close, convenient and budget friendly!”
Reviews.Author: TSNJ
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a last minute trip to Disney World. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were clean and modern, and the location was unbelievable. It was literally across the street from the Disney entrance and so easy to find. They have a shuttle to the transportation center that comes three times in the morning and returns three times at night (I believe). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Very good value ... I would definitely return to this hotel. (I have no bad comments to share.)

Reviews.Title: “good radisson”
Reviews.Author: 33ad
Reviews.Content: just got back from this hotel, a very pleasant experience. for the price a good choice. you have to rent a car if you want to enjoy the orlando area, this hotel is nxt to disney. but is about 10mins drive away from sea world and 20mins drive away from universal and the good parts of international drive! the hotel offers free shuttle to epcot where you have then use disney monorail and buses to connect to the other parks in the disney complex, this is all free however. the only bad thing is the free radisson shuttle only goes three times a day in each direction, hotel is next to a shopping area where you buy food to avoid the usual crazy hotel food prices. also the free internet in the lobby is useless. had problems with it all the time, one minute it would work the next it would crash, hotel says it connected at all times but if you got important emails to check go to an internet cafe,this will safe a lot of frustration. rooms are great lots of space,bathroom good,fridge,flatscreen, but hey this a new hotel, personally i think the test will be in 5years.once the rooms have got through a little wear and tear.swimming pool too small! and is right next to the freeway, which is always busy due to being close to disney finally when buying tkts to the parks a holiday inn rep will offer you a great deal, they will give you discounted park tkts if you go see one of their resorts!!! amazing as this could take business away from radisson! anyway the saving is good but you have to drive to the resort and attend a 90minute presentation. the holiday inn rep at radisson will say you have no obligation to buy anything there. but be warned as soon as you get there they will try hard to sell you a time-share in that resort. i mean its amazing,they come at you from every angle, some of the guys could be oscar nominated actors its certainly a show, the whole time of course they say they are not on commission! 3 different tour agents tried to sell me and my g/f time-shares before giving us our park tickets. so if you do want a time-share and dont mind the hassle its a good deal. if you dnt want the hassle just buy the park tkts at normal rate this will save a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: “WITHOUT A DOUBT, I WILL STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: JK1LongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: Can not say one bad thing. Go...book this Hotel now, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for value!”
Reviews.Author: duckiels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at this hotel for a week of Disney World/Universal. I've been to WDW several times before and stayed on properties in and out of the World, but for the price we got, it was fantastic. First, it was easy to find, as it is right off the I4 highway. It is within 2 minutes of the WDW entrance and about 15-20 minutes to Universal. There is a car rental place in the hotel if you want to take a day trip somewhere. There is also a shuttle to and from the parks, though I THINK it only goes to Epcot...where you can take Disney transportation to any other park if need be. We had our own car, so we didn't look too much into it. This hotel has been recently renovated, so is new-looking and very clean. The staff looked like they were working hard to keep it that way! The rooms all have a fridge and microwave. We were able to buy food/drinks from a nearby Walmart Supercenter, which definitely helped cut down on the cost of food in Disney. The sleep-number beds are pretty good, though my husband complained they hurt his back. I had no problem with them. The pool area is small compared to the Disney hotels, but it is quiet and relaxing. The lounge chairs are big and comfy. The hotel lobby gives out free chocolate chip cookies in the afternoons, delicious...a nice treat when you come home from a day at the parks! The staff was very helpful and kind. They were able to give us directions to anywhere we wanted to go and gave us a few suggestions as well. On our last day, we were able to give them our suitcases after we checked out until we were ready to leave for the airport that evening. There is breakfast available at the hotel for $11/person. There are lots of restaurants and non-Disney activities nearby (e.g. mini golf, shopping, dinner theatre). Overall, this was a great hotel for a great value and very close to all the parks. The only thing that bothered me a little was the traffic noise from the highway next to it, but only because I'm not used to it. My husband didn't even notice it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: peeteBristol
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find Check -in was quick Brandon on reception very helpful The room was spotless with twin beds which were very comfortable with soft bed linen, first class decor and lighting , bathroom had plenty of fluffly towels ,shower always hot and good power Ask for room at back good views and quiet. All in all a very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disney's World / Kennedy Space Center”
Reviews.Author: lgutier30
Reviews.Content: "MAN" I will be booking this hotel again in the next year 2010! Just a walk down the road for Downtown Disney's and the Disney's busses to go any where you need to go at no charge to you...

Reviews.Title: “Peace of Mind”
Reviews.Author: coolino420
Reviews.Content: It was the month of Nov ; when we went to see orlando; the city of fun & magic . Radisson hotel is located in main area but still you will get peace of mind there. The main advantage is its location. It is very near to the Magic Kingdom & Sea World. The hotel management is very helpful & the arranged the journey to these fantastic place. As I am Indian & indian spicy food lover ; we could get couple of indian restaurants near by ..... When we are away on vaction what we expect is good food ...this is what you get here. The hotel rent is reasonable ...So if you are looking for really one place near to all the fun spots in orlando...then Radisson at lake Buena Vista will be pleasure to stay ......

Reviews.Title: “Excellence all around!”
Reviews.Author: genoandsophia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights and had a wonderful time. The staff was tops in service and very friendly. We have nothing but great things to say about the staff; from the housekeepers, the maintenance, the pool attendant and front desk staff, their service and friendliness was a breath of fresh air. Thank you very much to all of you for making our vacation one that we will remember forever. We will stay only at this hotel from now on when we visit Orlando. Thanks again! Geno and Sophia

Reviews.Title: “Would DEFINITELY recommend...”
Reviews.Author: pv617
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, unexpectedly extended our stay in Orlando... it was 9pm and we weren't sure where we were going to stay. I pulled into the Radisson with hopes of a good rate and nice room. The lobby was super clean and nicely decorated.... the desk staff greeted me immediately. The gentleman who helped me was very accommodating and super kind. We had received some bad news earlier in the evening and were rather upset. The last thing I wanted to do deal with is poor customer service.... and well these days that seems to be the norm in some hotels. This certainly was not the case at this hotel. Excellent customer service.... and within minutes we were in our king jacuzzi room. The room was spacious and decorated contemporary.... lots of nice lighting and large flat screen. The bed was comfortable. The water pressure and heat were excellent in both the shower and whirlpool. The shower had additional jets, which was such an unexpected touch....and definitely a plus. Every aspect of the room was clean...no dust, no dirt....all in all, we were very pleased. Ordered room service for breakfast.... the eggs benedict and Banana Fosters french toast were delicious and presented well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.... Thank you Radisson staff for making a rather difficult night enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: justlovefood
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best kept secret in Orlando! We had the most wonderful stay. 10 minutes after we entered our beautiful room, we got a call from Brandon at the front desk asking us if there was anything we needed and if we were happy with the room. Now come on, where do you get service like that any more? fresh warm chocolate chip cookies in the lobby? Amazing! My sister had reservations at the Ritz-Carlton, she said our room was nicer, the people were nicer and the bed was more comfortable! HA Ha, she paid almost 900 bucks for just 2 nights!!!! Really, truly in all honesty, this was the cleanest, nicest and most pleasant place I have ever stayed! ALL I CAN SAY IS THIS IS THE PLACE! Oh yeah, did I mention the starbucks coffee or the amazing pool and spa and cushy comfortable plush chaise loungers by the pool? No expense was spared in picking out every detail. My hunch is there's a woman involved in those decisions, excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / neighbourhood / beds... great everything really!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi85
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel and the neighbourhood it was in... Over 50 restaurants within a 15 minute walk, how great is that! We thought the sleep number beds were amazing, it only took us like 2 minutes to figure out our numbers. We slept great even though our room was right next to the elevators. The tv was huge, the fridge/freezer was bigger than in most hotels I've stayed in and we had free wireless internet. The rooms were much larger than any rooms I've ever seen in this pricerange an it's also nice to have a small couch, so you don't have to sit on the beds all the time. Apart from the rather rude lady at the timeshare desk, the staff was great, they provided us with everything we asked for such as cutlery and the opportunity to print out our boarding passes. We only encountered a few minor problems. - We asked the timeshare lady to call us a taxi to Downtown Disney, she did, and she told us it would be there in about 10 minutes, almost an hour later we were still waiting, after complaining 3 times we decided to just walk and she didn't even care or apologize. - One of the elevators broke down on 3 different days during our 6 day stay. This caused for 20 minute long lines, so we decided to take the stairs for the most part. The stairs lead outside though, which is a bit annoying, since you have to walk halfway around the hotel to get to the reception. The only thing we that didn't work too well for us was the location, we didn't rent a car, and we went to Orlando mainly to visit Walt Disney World. We went to Downtown Disney practically every day, which is about a 20/30 minute walk (depending on how fast or slow you walk), which isn't too bad, it's a nice walk. But it got rather cold during our stay, so walking back late at night when it was freezing cold was a bit of a let down for us. This isn't anything the hotel could do anything about though, but it's just a warning to people who aren't planning on renting a car and are visiting Orlando mainly to go to Walt Disney World. The walk to Downtown Disney is do-able, but most likely quite hard with small children or older people, and not very pleasant when it's either cold or very hot. One solution would be taking a taxi, but this can add up to quite a large amount of money when you do this on a daily basis. We did love the shuttle to Epcot, it went to Epcot 3 times throughout the morning and went back to the hotel 3 times at night. It was always on time and never crowded, which was great. From Epcot you can go everywhere on Walt Disney World property, however, when you want to go back to the hotel during the day or go to the parks in the afternoon or at night you'll have to either take a taxi or take Disney Transportation from Downtown Disney, since the shuttle only runs a few times a day. All in all, we loved the hotel and would definately recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, warm, appointed, freindly, professional, convenient, outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Bigcityracing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the property for one night and enjoyed everything about it. The people...the employees were of the highest professional level. No need or want was unattended to. Will only stay at this property when visiting in Orlando. It has everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay while in Orlando, close to the parks”
Reviews.Author: SAMDEL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, extremely clean. Would definitely stay there again. The service was very good, everyone was nice and helpful. Family had booked another hotel in the area but changed to this hotel, since it was so nice. Very close to all the parks. Can't say there was anything I really didn't like. Price was great.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Hotel I will come and visit it again.”
Reviews.Author: chicken007
Reviews.Content: I really enjoying staying at the hotel and would come and visit it again and would recommend it to my friends and family to stay at your hotel. I love your staff they were very friendly, nice and kind. I really enjoyed your employer Lucas the bartender he was a very kind young man and a very helpful employer in giving guest on good ideals on thing to do so believe me I will be returning to your hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel! Would DEFINITELY stay again!”
Reviews.Author: supermanhicks
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The entire hotel is very new and the pool is wonderful. They offer a complimentary shuttle to Epcot (and you can take Disney shuttles/monorail everywhere Disney from there) which was perfect for our family and saved on parking. The hotel room was very comfortable, had free internet. There is a Waffle House next door which was great for breakfast in the morning. We didn't see a complimentary breakfast in the morning but everything was great. The pool was gorgeous and really huge. They had thick padded chairs to lounge out on and it was a much better pool that usual. GORGEOUS crystal chandeliers in the lobby made a very impressive entrance. We will definitely go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: JGfromChicago
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, great beds, quiet. Very convenient to all Disney parks and Downtown Disney. We had a car, so could come and go to parks on our own schedule so don't know how shuttle works. Have stayed on property many times when kids were younger. This room was larger and hate nicer amenities, including microwave and fridge so we could get groceries/bottled water at store only a short distance away. Would highly recommend for new or seasoned Disney travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GaloBrasil
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. New, large rooms and the staff is very kind. The "sleep number" beds are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nhtm5driver
Reviews.Content: New Hotel with nice clean rooms; only criticism was the tiles in the bath which looked a little dirty. Everything else great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, great staff, great price (good chocolate chip cookies)”
Reviews.Author: papabearBranson_Mo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was very professional. I was impressed when the arriving back at our room the first evening and discovering a message on the phone from the evening desk clerk stating his name and asking if everything was to our satisfaction, of not, let him know. The entire facility was quite luxurious. Excellent rate considering the amenities and the location being adjacent to Disney property. By the way, the complimentary chocolate cookies available at the front desk were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great price”
Reviews.Author: jumpall
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days at the Radisson Hotel , lake Buena Vista area in April of 2009. The hotel is about a year old and kept like new. The staff is attentive and knows your name after the first visit. The rooms are huge, clean and comfortable. The hotel is right outside of hotel row, the disneyland entrance and two blocks from Downtown disney. The only drawback is having to make a uturn when returning from the disney area. Enjoy this bargin.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Touristy Orlando”
Reviews.Author: specialk2077
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 6 day stay at the Radisson in Lake Buena Vista for a combination business trip/vacation. The hotel is right off of I-4 at exit #68 (Hwy 535/Apopka Vineland). It's a great hotel in a good, central location. The hotel was built within the past 2 years so everything is brand new. Plenty of parking, nice marble and granite décor. Great pool and hot tub with very comfortable lounge chairs. The pool isn't heated so the water was a bit cold for a swim when I was there last week. The fitness center has top of the line treadmills, elliptical and weight machine. Staff was very friendly and helpful. There is a rental car office on the hotel property. Rooms are a good size and feature the Select Comfort Sleep Number bed. There is a sitting area with an oversize chair that folds out to an extra bed and a desk that are both separate from the sleeping area. All rooms have a microwave and mini fridge and a big digital TV with lots of channels. Bathroom is a bit small, but it's nice. The hotel restaurant is good and prices are on par with nearby restaurants. The breakfast at the hotel ended up being much cheaper for us than going out to the Perkins or Waffle House down the street. The Radisson offers a free shuttle to Disney but only to Epcot. You then have to use Disney transport (monorail or bus) to get to the other parks. We found it was easier and more convenient to drive to Magic Kingdom and Epcot and pay $12 for parking vs. being dependent on the hotel shuttle. It was only a 10 minute drive to the Disney parks. You can also get a taxi for about $10. There are 30+ of restaurants within walking/driving distance. Pirates Cove (mini golf) is just down the street and is a nice way to spend time before or after dinner. There is also a Publix supermarket nearby to stock up on beverages, snacks and fresh fruit. There is a SuperTarget about 10 minutes away and it's also a good place to get groceries and get some cheap Disney souvenirs, water toys, toiletries, ponchos, etc. Overall, a good value for a very nice hotel. I would stay here again. P.S. Don't forget to bring a roll of quarters with you for all of the Florida toll roads. PROS - New property, very clean with beautiful décor. - Less than a 10 minute drive to Disney Parks and about 2 minutes to Downtown Disney. - More of a business/convention clientele, so it’s not overrun with children. - Plenty of restaurants, shopping and drug stores nearby. - There is a FedEx Kinko's down the street. - The front desk puts out fresh chocolate chip cookies every afternoon that are perfect for an afternoon sugar fix. CONS - The hotel is right off of I-4 and some rooms face the highway. There can be quite a bit of traffic noise at night. If you're a light sleeper like I am, you can counteract the noise by running the AC fan. Your best bet is just to get a room on the other side of the hotel. - No wireless internet except in the hotel lobby. LAN connection in the room was spotty at times. I had to change rooms because the connection in my room didn’t work consistently. - Vessel sink in the bathroom isn’t practical. The faucet is not positioned correctly and the water splashes all over the counter since it can’t reach the bowl. We had to have a towel permanently around the faucet to prevent a mess. - The Business Center is just 2 computers and printer next to the front desk. Not good for conducting actual business, but good for printing out driving directions or boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: R0xysm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite. Having 2 separate bedrooms was very nice. The decor was restful. The beds were very comfortable. We really enjoyed the Sleep Number Beds. The shower had great water pressure. The only thing we didn't like about the bathroom was the sink. The location was extremely convenient to all the Disney Parks and SeaWorld. Plenty of places to eat within a short distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we ate in the Liquid Bar & Grill, the service was top notch. The chef even came out to make sure we were happy. ANd the pool area was adequate for the amount of time we spent there. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Washoe2007
Reviews.Content: Recently spent an enjoyable 7 nights at the Radisson - Lake Buena Vista, FL. It is close to all major Orlando attractions (Disney, Universal, Sea World) and just off of I-4 making travel around the area quite simple. It is a new property, neat, clean and well appointed as one would expect from a Radisson property. Rooms were larger than expected. Some, if not all rooms include a small sitting area, refrigerators and microwave. There are also some "family suites" available. Excellent pool/jacuzzi area with outdoor bar and food service available. Staff was qualified, friendly and helpful. The ONLY negative thing I can say is that access to the property can be somewhat of a challenge but that is a small detractor compared to the positive things this property has to offer. AAA and AARP discount rates are available. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel, Exceptional Service, Convenient Location, Reasonably Priced!”
Reviews.Author: OBChic
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Radisson hotel at Buena Vista was fabulous! The hotel is newly built and is clean and beautiful. The lobby is stunning and inviting with granite countertops, a crystal chandelier and decorative elevators. The room décor is gorgeous, from the crown moldings, columns, attractive furniture, curtains, carpet, and paintings. The room was spacious with two double beds and a separate seating area. (I couldn’t believe it was a standard room!). The bathroom was also luxurious with a glass vessel mounted sink and granite counter top. The service was also exceptional. During our stay, my 5 year old daughter had an episode of emesis at 2 am. She vomited all over the sheets, comforter, and carpet. I called the front desk, and within minutes, a maintenance person (Alex Gomez) arrived. Mr. Gomez was prompt, respectful, and helpful. He worked diligently to clean up the mess and graciously changed the linens and cleaned the carpet. He went above and beyond his call of duty by bringing my daughter bottled water and extra towels. I was impressed with the swiftness and hospitality by Mr. Gomez and the staff at the Radisson. I was also impressed with the delicious food and excellent service that we received at the restaurant. We ordered breakfast on the morning of our departure. The server was pleasant, respectful, and cordial. The omelet was the best that my husband has ever had! It was stuffed with chicken, peppers, onions and cheese. I have told my friends and family about our pleasant stay at this hotel. We are looking forward to returning for our next Disney trip!

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful hotel and very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugMass
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during our week's travels around Florida visiting family and friends. It was a perfect location to get to anywhere. The hotel was very, very clean, and the staff was very knowledgable and friendly. The beds were very comfortable-the sleep number beds. It was a great place to stay. I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: supergeordie
Reviews.Content: Our first 2 nights in Florida were spent @ the Radisson, and we were not dissappointed. The hotel is fairly new and our room was excellent. The location of the hotel, although on the I4 was good and parking was free, it also had a pool although it was far to cool to use, staff were pleasant and helpful. You can walk to downtown Disney for here, it takes about 15 mins, where we sampled a very nice sandwich for the 'Earl of Sandwich', for breakfast there is a Perkins next door that was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Very modern facility”
Reviews.Author: rhaydon51
Reviews.Content: I found the radisson was a very nice hotel with the advantage of being right next to Disney World, with a shuttle bus. The rooms for this hotel were very nice including a bed where you can adjust the hardness and softness of it, flatscreen tv's, and free wi fi. Also it had a swimming pool and hot tub that I enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Clean Resort, Local To Disney & Restaurants, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: RHillFam4
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my 2 children, 12 & 16 stayed here on our March Break from Canada for 7 days. Excellent accomodations and resort close to Disney and major restaurants etc. Stephen at Front Desk was superb and extremely helpful will all requests including adding an extra night at the end even though they were pretty booked. The rooms are spacious, beds really comfortable and overall very clean. Bathroom great! Nice fridge and microwave with storage area for food if you buy any locally which is very handy for breakfasts etc. We bought muffins and cereal and kept peanut butter, jam and milk handy for quick breakfasts. Pool area was nice; my son always wanted to swim. Whirlpool good too and they supply towels and comfortable lounge chairs. Easy walk to restaurants and entrance to the Disney World resorts and Downtown Disney is across the street. Overall loved our visit and would definitely stay here again. My only small negative is that it is easy to get into the hotel from street when going in north direction, but if you are coming back and coming south, you have to go a little further down the road and do a u-turn. Otherwise absolutely no complaints!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: sejok
Reviews.Content: Originally, I thought that I'd given this hotel an incredible rating because my expectations were rather low... but then again, after staying at 5* hotels exclusively over the past several years while on business, I'm kicking myself for not having considered the Radisson because they have exceeded my expectations in so many ways at this hotel! 1. The Bathroom - ok so maybe I didn't have a separate shower stall and the bathroom wasn't clad in marble and the use of florescent lighting meant i looked grim (reality check anyone?) in the mornings... BUT there was everything I needed, plenty of fresh towels, simple amenities and nice warm water! 2. The rooms - I did request for a King, but got a twin instead - did I mind? no. One of the beds was big enough for me and 2 others if I had been so inclined... Room was well lit, great for working and having a large flat screen TV and an iPod dock suited me fine. FREE internet was excellent! 3. Location. erm ok... I came for a conference being held at the Mariott (resorts world?) and it was a 5min drive away. In the immediate vicinity there is plenty of food and an uneventful mall. Disney Resort's Marketplace is also within 5mins so i'd say it's a pretty good location. NOT Fantastic, but pretty good. 4. Here's the kicker: I visited some colleagues who stayed at the Mariott and paid double of what we paid... Eeks! our rooms were much nicer! They had to pay for internet and parking - sure there was a nicer pool but nobody got to see it anyway! oh did I mention they only had a 21" CRT TV? *SNORT* So to my boss who insisted that we exercise fiscal prudence, kudos to you, to my colleagues who thought they got a better deal when they got alternative funding for staying at the Mariott *bleah* :)

Reviews.Title: “We are very pleased”
Reviews.Author: ritriac100
Reviews.Content: Thanks a lot. What a good hotel and outstanding service. Restaurant and team are just wonderful,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauer7
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel but the pool was not heated and was very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: monkey_zulu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 6 nights, and we wish we had the time to stay for 10 more. We came all the way from Jakarta, Indonesia for part of our honeymoon trip in South Florida, and we're just ever so grateful we chose this out of a gazillion number of hotels in the Greater Orlando area to choose from. The room was every bit as advertised, and we got a room overlooking I-4, but had no noise problem at all. We slept soundly and peacefully every night. Housekeeping/room service was great. Front desk people were all nice and helpful. They even gave us access to thier back office to use the internet. Nice gym. Parking is free, but sometimes packed, yet I still consider it a no-hassle. Convenient location, just outside of the Walt Disney compound and hustle-bustle International Drive, yet so close. Many eateries [IHOP, Denny's, McDonalds, Taco Bell, etc.], shops [Orlando Premium Outlets, Prime Outlets] and groceries [Walmart, Gooding's 24hrs] nearby. And to top it all off, we got a great deal [$75++/night for a Superior 2-Queen] through hotels.com. A great bargain for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: KYMichelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great pool area (not heated) and was very clean and updated. It was very close to the main road with lots of restaurants and shopping. The hotel did not seem to be too crowded even though we were there during spring break. The shuttle to Epcot was very convenient and there were not many passengers. It only goes to Epcot, but there are other Disney buses you can get on if you want to go to a different park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Scooby57
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a recent stay at this resort. I enjoyed my stay because of the excellent staff. Jamie, one of your front desk agents, does an excellent job. She was very friendly and answered all my annoying questions. My room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Will definatley be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Disney83
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort and enjoyed my experience. I liked the proximity to the Walt Disney World Resort. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, and I got a good nights sleep. The staff was wonderful too. Jamie checked me in and she did an excellent job. She was friendly and helpful. She is an excellent front desk agent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cheaptraveler1
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and very close to Disney and Universal. I would recommend to improve the breakfast buffet but overall it was a great stay. I definitively would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan26
Reviews.Content: We stayed her because I had 4 free nights from a previous stay at the Radisson in Aruba(they were issued becuase of some inconveniences from that stay). I was a bit surprised when we pulled up in front of it.. it didn't look that impressing. I read all the reviews & it had gotten very good ones. When we walked inside.. it was very nice.. not huge but nice. It used to be a different hotel prior, but Raddison remodeled the inside anyway. Our room was on the 3rd flr... and it faced the north so we didnt hear the hwy noise from I-4. The beds were very comfortable we though.. (we had 2 queens), the bathoom was a tad tiny. the sink was that wierd bowl thing.. shower worked well..black marble floor was a bit strange. The A/C worked well.. controllable by temperature & not real noisey. Flat screen TV that was ok.. but we werent there to watch TV. The restaurant we only had breakfast there 2x.. it was pretty good- buffett $9.95 a person... Although.. we ate their 2 days in a row.. & were charged 2 different prices for the same thing. Not a big difference ($2) but still strange. (I think the first time the guy didnt charge for the orange juice my husband had. The hotel is located very close to Disney if that is what you are planning to do.. right outside the back entrance to Disney Marketplace. Plenty of parking. The only complaint we had (and it was really no big deal) was that there was no lemonade in any of the vending machines on any of the floors. I recieved a survey from Radisson about our stay.. I did mention that & as I said it wasnt a big deal.. my husband wanted to keep something in the fridge in case he got thirsty at night... we ended up picking something up while we were out. The sent back a reply to my survey & said they were very sorry for the inconvenience.. they contacted whoever the supplier was to come more often & they gave us another free night. for the inconvenience. I found everyone that worked there very nice & helpful... we would stay there again if we were in the area for any reason. Dining Tip: If you get a chance check out Fulton Crab House. I thought at first it might be owned by Disney.. but it isnt. The food is excellent (Mahi Mahi) The Calamari.. the best we ever had anywhere. Portions are big. It is a bit noisey. but we had a booth type table with only one person on the side of us.. so it wasnt too bad. I wouldnt want to sit smack in the middle of the place though.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place”
Reviews.Author: michiganmick56
Reviews.Content: We took a disney world vacation in march 2009 and after reading some positive reviews of this hotel I decided to book six days here. The hotel was everything I hoped for...the room was very big ...nice big tv ....good location....staff was very friendly.... its only one yr old...and everything was nice and clean

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrrr100
Reviews.Content: Hotel was new, clean, and in a good location. Close to Disney and Universal. Very close to downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very accomodating Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lilypad11
Reviews.Content: This is a Beautiful hotel to stay while vacationing. The staff are very friendly at the front desk, the bar, and the restaurant. The rooms were just beautiful and the rates were great. We had been vacationing for 14 days and this was the last 4 days of our trip. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and very close to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “This is just the best hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: missysissy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying here and it exceeded our expectations. We stayed 6 nites. It was so close to Disney,really just minutes away!! The room was so nice that we wanted to spend time in it which is very unusual for us because we're usually at the parks from open to close! The sleep number beds were so comfortable that we even ended up sleeping-in a couple of days. The big screen T.V. was positioned in the room so we could comfortably watch it from the bed. Our room was cleaned spotless everyday!And free parking with a convenient parking lot. On past vacations, we've always stayed on Disney property but because we found this Radisson so wonderful and at a great price, we will be staying here from now on!! It was truly one of our best vacations ever!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Uncomfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: CarlDSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. We had booked the standard room with two queen size beds. We were both impressed by the amenities upon arrival. In room microwave, refrigerator, and the Sleep Number beds. We both slept terribly the first night, the bed was extremely uncomfortable. We kept trying different adjustments but it always resulted in one of us waking up with back pain a short time later. To make matters worse, the in room refrigerator kept turning on and was very loud - loud enough to awaken both of us. The hotel has a pool and spa, so we thought we would use that. It was pretty cool outside, low 60's - the pool is not heated and the water was really cold. We wanted to use the spa, the water was barely luke warm and the jets would not turn on. We complained at the front desk and they a said they would contact maintenance, we didn't hear from them again. We spent one more night in the quuen size room, trying the second bed to see if it was any better. We complained about the beds and asked for a room with a standard bed. We were told that the Sleep Number beds were are only choice but we could upgrade to a king size and that might be more comfortable. We went for the upgrade, we were surprised that they did not offer this gratis and that they charged us for the upgrade, especially considering that it was just for one night. The king size room has a jacuzzi tub and nice walk in shower. It seemed much nicer than the queen size room, That night we realized what a mistake the upgrade was. The noise from the adjacent freeway was so loud we both had difffculty sleeping. The larger king Sleep Number bed proved to be just as uncomfortable as the queen. At checkout I complained about the beds again. We both had terribly stiff backs after our stay there. On a more positive note, the restaurant was excellent. The staff was super friendly, and we both really enjoyed the two meals that we had there. The chef came out to ask us how our dinner was, exceptionally friendly. I can say that we won't be staying here again, it is just too uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “close to all the theme parks, easy to get to from Orlando MCO, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: nialldoheny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.
