We stayed 4 nights at beginning of our 10 day trip to Florida and again on the final night of our holiday (after doing a few days away while we toured around Southern Florida). Hotel simply fitted our needs perfectly. Room was super clean, modern, all furnishings were of the highest quality and the comfort in the beds was just fantastic. There were only two of us (myself and my girlfriend) but even if we had kids, you could easily sleep them in the room too, as there were two double beds along with a small foldout sofa. The optional breakfast we thought was fine, although they do need to brush up on their tea making skills. Front desk staff, in fact all staff were generally quite courteous and very helpful. Hotel is also in a great location for visiting the nearby theme parks, Disney being just across the road, with SeaWorld and Universal not being that far away either. But a car is a must really for getting around. Nearby there's a big outlet center too where you can bag cheap designer items at knock down prices. Right next door there are plenty of places to eat along with a 24 hour supermarket, but don't shop there, it's ridiculously expensive. Better off going to the nearest Publix or Walmart which are both within 2 miles. We paid $495 in total for 4 nights at beginning but this doesn't include breakfast which adds around $12 per person per day. Re the noise that some people mentioned because of being close to I-4, we had rooms on both sides of the building and didn't have any problem sleeping. So overall not bad at all. Would we go back??? Definitely. In fact we did, for our very last night in Florida before catching the plane back to Brussels the following day. Driving time from Orlando MCO International airport was about 20 minutes. Just go ahead and book it, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a great place”
Reviews.Author: gammie75
Reviews.Content: Not one bad word for this hotel. We asked for an extra blanket and before my husband was back in the room it was delivered. Beds were sooo nice (sleep number) Room is clean and sooo upto date. Service was great Booked direct and got a cheaper rate then any third party booking agent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Orlando...And I have stayed in many!”
Reviews.Author: buntyt33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August/September 2008 (apologies for the delay in posting)and as the title says it is a great hotel. Having lived in Florida I return at least a couple of times a year but this was to be my first solo trip in many years. I chose this hotel as it was within walking distance of Downtown Disney ( I do like to walk and took about 20 minutes or so), Radisson is a well known brand and it was easily accessible for my friends picking me up.. The hotel has been completely refurbished; it didn't look that great previously as I remember passing it years ago and they have done a fantastic job. The public areas are spotless and apart from one member of staff (there is always one!) the staff were very friendly and polite. The room was HUGE, with two beds, flat screen TV, fridge etc.and was always refresehed and perfectly cleaned on my return. The hotel itself was very quiet to be honest so there was no noise or wild pool parties! I didn't see a fellow guest on my floor throughout my stay. I didn't find a problem with noise from i-4 and I am a light sleeper. However if this might be a problem best to ask for a room facing the car park at the back. I took the hotel shuttle to Disney a couple of times and they were great. Very punctual and got you to EPCOT within 10 minutes. Previously when we stayed at Crowne Plaza Universal they only had 2 shuttles back but here there were 3 here and at at much better times. I returned Animal Kingdom using Disney transport one day and it took me over 2 hours to get back to Downtown Disney! As you no doubt know The USA is the land of the car and not public transport! Right next door is The Crossroads shopping centre. It has a great 24 hour supermarket and lots of places to drink and be refreshed. TGI's was my favourite (forget The inferior UK version) This was a great place to relax with one of their fantastic moijitos. It's an easier stagger home! If there were any niggles it was the internet connection could be a bit hit or miss; wouldn't normally bother me but as I was by myself and relying on my laptop to keep in touch with those back home it could be frustrating when it was off for hours.But as I say just a small niggle. This hotel was a perfect base and I would recommend to anyone planning a trip to Orlando; great rooms,location and staff at a really good price!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: AndrewFromManchester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this hotel twice during January, two nights each visit, as part of a visit to Florida and on balance I'd have to say that we wouldn't choose it again. First, the positives. The rate - without doubt this hotel is good value. It is after all a 4-star and I wasn't aware of any competing hotel in the area that offered such value. Secondly, the rooms - spacious, well-appointed with microwave and fridge. Thirdly, the beds - the sleep number beds allow each side of the bed to be independently inflated/deflated to your own personal comfort level. These work really well. We hadn't experienced them before and I now think all hotels should have them! Now for the downsides. First and foremost, the location. When booking the hotel I knew approximately where it was and that it was convenient for the theme parks but I hadn't appreciated its exact location. Just take a look at my photo to see the view you get. The hotel is literally adjacent to the I4 interstate highway nestling between the exit road and another 6-lane highway and the noise insulation in the hotel is just not good enough. Needless to say we slept pretty poorly while we were there. Second, the breakfasts are truly awful. Unfortunately, we had pre-booked b&b so ended up eating there each morning. On three out of the four days we eat from the buffet which was extremely poor so on the last day we ordered omelettes from the menu - after a 30 miinute wait they arrived and were honestly the worst omelettes I've ever had in my life. Third, the general service from the reception desk was truly under-whelming, there are no doormen/porters and no-one offered to help us with our bags. Fourth, a minor irritation. The concierge desk we discovered is manned by staff who are not employed by Radisson but work for a variety of Florida resorts. On our first day we approached the desk hoping to get some accurate impartial advice about the theme parks, opening times, best mode of transport etc. but what we got was a thinly-veiled sales pitch trying to entice us to book a trip to their vacation resort the following morning in exchange for discounted theme park tickets. We declined and didn't go near them again. So all in all I personally wouldn't stay at the Radisson again because of the intrusive traffic noise and the service not matching my expectations of a four-star hotel. However I guess you get what you pay for and if you're on a budget, this hotel may be for you. If you do stay there, a couple of tips. 1. Book a standard room. We booked a king bed room for our first visit. Only on checking out did we discover that all of the Radisson's king bed rooms are at the front of the hotel nearest to the I4 exit road. So for our second visit (which we'd already pre-booked) we downgraded to a standard room and chose one at the back of the hotel. The advantages of that were reduced traffic noise (but still very noticeable) and a slightly lower rate. The room is the same size but contains two queen beds and only one bedside table. 2. Don't pre-book breakfast. What you get when you arrive is a $20 breakfast voucher for each day of your stay (though I had to ask the receptionist for them). Much better to walk round the corner and get a decent breakfast from one of the local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bayou18
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a two night stay for my mother and myself. I was very pleased with the efficient checkin service. The room was clean and comfortable. I was concerned about how close we were to the InterState, but the room was quiet. The manager was attentive and eager to greet us and make our stay pleasant. I have stayed at many hotels in Orlando, including Disney properties, and I was very happy with my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: kerlinso
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in mid January 2009. This is the second stay here in last few months. The hotel is still immaculate with comfortable spotless rooms at a reasonable rate. Ideal for the parks and shopping- but car is a must (parking free). Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the packages”
Reviews.Author: Syympa
Reviews.Content: Avoid handicap rooms. They do not include Safe box, the rooms are smaller and were given them as first choice without needing them. Be cautious of the breakfast packages, We bought the package with room and breakfast, when we got to the hotel, we noticed it was cheaper just to pay for your own breakfast. the breakfast coupon included with the room is not enough to pay for buffet. in our case he package cost was 30 dollars more that the room alone and with that we only got a 20 dollar coupon!!! so much for a good deal! if you are planning on going to Disney world the shuttle only departs and returns 3 times a day Most of the staff had a bad attitude and instead of trying to help gave dumb excuses for the problems. The Good: The rooms are good size, clean, and comfortable. they include free internet and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agioia
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect at this hotel. The price, the rooms were beautiful, the people really nice. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson extremely comfortable1”
Reviews.Author: Tetzinoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson in Lake Buena Vista Jan. 8th -Jan 13th. Employees were extremely pleasant and helpful. Rooms had the very comfortable sleepnumber beds and 37" Lcd tvs. They were clean, and kept clean by the very early daily maid service. It is about a half mile from Downtown Disney. We didn't rent a car. So instead of taking their bus to Epcot, we walked to Downtown Disney and used the Disney Transportation which is free. It would have been great if they would of had regular transportaion service there. Tons of restaurants close by, within walking distance. Nice pool and hot tub. Pool is not heated and while we had weather in 70's the water was too cold to swim. Would stay again but not with small kids unless you have a car. That walk would be to much for them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Boerozzie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 8 days while visiting the attractions in Orlando. I booked it after reading the Tripadvisor reviews. I can confirm that the positive reviews are correct. We found it clean and very close to the Disney World attractions. Just behind the hotel is a shopping area with a supermarket and several restaurants. The price of the hotel restaurant was very competitive and the food we ate there was good. The hotel has nice touches such as a news paper in front of your door in the morning. The staff were very helpful and professional. The free internet is actually free. Some hotels will advertise free internet but you still have to pay for a connection plan which was not the case at the Radisson. It was slow but did the job. We had a rental vehicle and found it very easy to get to the hotel and attactions even with the u-turns required. Definitely will will stay here again if we are ever in Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “A stopover for some shopping”
Reviews.Author: Big_Daddy_Si
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Hotel Orlando-Lake Buena Vista for 2 nights in December 2008 on the way back home. Cost was a smudge over £100 which I thought was pretty decent value. My room was on the top floor (8th) and had a view out to towards the Orlando Premium Outlets. The only problem I found with this hotel was the fact that it was located right on the I-75 and even with double glazing there was some traffic noise from this extremely busy motorway. Apart from I-75 the hotel is excellently located, very close to Disney Buena Vista and the Orlando Premium Outlets. Other shopping outlets (Millennia, Belz etc...) are no more then a gentle 15 minute drive away. Hotel was clean and check in staff were friendly. I didn’t use the pool (too cold!), it looked ok, but very small and a bit of a token effort but nothing to get too excited about. Plenty of free car parking available though. Room size was good – but I couldn’t get on with the beds! The beds are those were you can inflate/deflate to suit your taste – I just couldn’t get that comfy!!! I didn’t eat at the hotel as there are numerous eateries – e.g. Sizzler, Olive Garden, TGIs just a quick drive down Vineland Avenue. The hotel had free wireless broadband, but I couldn’t access it in my room, so had to use my phone in the lobby. I previously stayed at the Crown Plaza - slightly more £s - but I gave that 4* rather than the 3* I gave the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Carmans
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Radisson met our expectations and more. The hotel was absolutely spotless, modern and very comfortable. We liked the convenience to all attractions and shopping. The staff went out of their way to assist us in any way they could whether it was advising on great restaurants, local shopping or serving us in the restaurant or bar. Although the hotel is located close to the freeway we heard none of the traffic noise once in the room. Pool was great with upscale loungers with cushions. All in all this is definately a place to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsjrose
Reviews.Content: The Radisson had everything we needed in a hotel. The room was in excellent condition. Everything clean and neat. The housekeeping staff were wonderful. They paid attention to every detail. The only small complaint was with the room's (#217) location. It was right over the kitchen and got a little noisy between 5 and 10pm. I alerted the front desk, who wanted to move us on the spot, but we didn't mind it all that much. The hotel itself was in a good location. Everything close by, including the enterance to Downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Really recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: CamiCami1
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at this brand new hotel. Although my fiancé and I were visiting Orlando for Disney Fun, we were not looking forward to noisy hotels or children running up and down the corridors. So the hotel was very silent, the room had large and comfortable queen beds with adjustable mattresses (it can be soft or hard, you adjust it with a remote control), a great plasma screen, internet connections, great tub. And its location is excellent too! Just a few miles from Walt Disney World, Outlets.. I really recommend the Radisson at Lake Buena Vista!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ocalag8tor
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, nice room. Breakfast buffet at restaurant was exceptionally expensive. Cost us about $16.00 a plate (even for kids) Suite wasn't quite what I expected however. Overall though good room for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Radisson Lake Buena Vista Hotel was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Princess035
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando and wow what a grewta hotel close to Disney, Universal and Seaword. The sleep number beds were great after the atractions. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Will return to the Radisson Lake Buena Vista”
Reviews.Author: jmirabile1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando and this time we stayed at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista. What a treat!! Living in Florida gives the opportunity to visit this wonderland as often as we like so we have tried numerous hotels, motels and resorts through the years. The Radisson was by far the best one we have ever stayed in. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room was spacious and decorated beautifully. I slept better than I have in a long time on the sleep number bed. I want one of my own now!! It seemed to be booked pretty full and there were several young soccer teams in the lobby but it did not make it seem chaotic or noisy as other places have been. The lobby bar was nice and served Starbucks coffee in the morning. Not one thing was negative here. I must say it was a perfect stay and I won't be looking elsewhere the next time we visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: MsAmer1693
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from Disney property/entry to the parks. It's clean, close to restaurants, and not too expensive. Free and convenient parking. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Not a lot of kids staying at property. They serve Starbucks coffee at the bar in the morning. Can use the internet for free in lobby. Lobby bathrooms are neat. Hotel is located next to a shopping center that has a Chevys, Red Lobster, Perkins, pizza place, etc. The only minor issues: rooms/bathrooms are narrow and we were not huge fans of the sleep number beds but not a big deal. Entry door to room is thin as you can hear a lot of noise at all times of the day/night. As the other reviews say, the bathroom sink is set up odd and water goes all over the place but you get used to it. OH, and within 30 seconds of checking in, the "concierge desk" tried to get us to visit a timeshare, and one of them kept asking us if we already had our Disney tickets and when we said yes, he didn't seem to believe us and asked us how we got them, where, etc. It was kind of odd, like he didn't believe us. Neon lighted store next door is tacky and diminishes the appeal of the hotel. All in all, great value for the price, and location is perfect. We drove down International Drive, and around the surrounding area, and we really didn't see a better place to stay off of the Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for our money & Helpfull Staff”
Reviews.Author: marianmorcillo
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to see how comfortable was our room, not only for the beds, but also for the size of our room (very spacious). Easy reach to the Parks and Dining Plazas, and also to the Outlets. Staff at the Front Desk have been so helpful; they tried their best to fulfill our needs, and we are very thankful for that (sorry that I cannot recall their names)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Very Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: SWOR_Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 8 days and felt we got very good value for the money. The hotel is fairly new, the beds are extremely comfortable and the management and staff are top notch. You can't get a getter night sleep than with the sleep number beds at this hotel - very nice after a long day at the parks. There is a very nice restaurant in the hotel where we ate both a breakfast and a lunch - both were great meals. There is an Olive Garden and Red Lobster within a short walking distance and a Joe's Crab Shack in close proximity. The hotel offered shuttle service to and from Epcot (where you can take the boat to Hollywood Studios or the Monorail to Magic Kingdom) but we opted to drive ourselves. Parking, internet and refrigerators are free at the Radisson - each of those items cost $12 extra at one of the Disney hotels we stayed at last year. These "extra cost" savings of $36 plus the significantly lower cost versus the Disney hotel we previously stayed at make this a great deal. With respect to the location being somewhat difficult to get in and out of - we recommend taking Hotel Plaza Blvd to Buena Vista Drive in order to get to the Disney parks and come back on I-4 - this eliminates making a lot of unnecessary U-Turns.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel-stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Nonhairybiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights mid November, having chosen the hotel based on the preceding reviews. I'm glad to report they were correct. We had a premier king room and as with the rest of the hotel, it was immaculate and spotlessly clean. I do believe the cheaper two queen bedded rooms are exactly the same though. Car park and grounds are also well kept and the plentiful spaces with two main entrances meant there was never far to walk. Despite interstate 4 across the way, we never found the noise intrusive in fact the aircon unit disturbed us more. There is a large tacky eyesore of a gift shop across from the hotel but the surrounding area seemed safe. A short walk takes you to several choices of places to eat and a supermarket. Everywhere else you'll want to go is easily reached, I cannot fault the location. Staff were exceptionally courteous and very pleasant and helpful. The reception staff allowed us unconditional use of internet terminal. Unless you have your own laptop, there is no other option. There is a ticket sales desk in the lobby but we were not overly pressured as is usually the case. We used the pool and hot tub, both excellent. We never ate in the full restaurant but the menu looked extensive if a little expensive. So, in summary have no fears, this is a great palce to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Disney World”
Reviews.Author: figero40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 8 nights and loved it. It was very clean, quiet, comfortable and affordable. The hotel staff is helpful and friendly. We had a front door parking space every night and a short walk to our room. That was appreciated after walking in the parks all day! The location is convenient to the Disney World parks, to shopping and to many, many restaurants. We stayed in a family suite and enjoyed the extra space for our family of 5. The value can't be beat. In the room there is a good sized fridge, coffee maker and microwave. The tv is great with lots of channels to entertain the kids. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: D76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Radisson Hotel Lake Buena Vista. The hotel's facilities and rooms are very nice and the price of the room was a real bargain. Our room was very big, clean and quiet. In terms of location the hotel is very convenient for those who want to visit the Disney resort (they also provide a free shuttle to Epcot but we did not use it) and it is not far from the Universal studios. There are few restaurants nearby, including a good steakhouse. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located with restaurants close by.”
Reviews.Author: N0BODY
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located right of Interstate 4. Rooms are modern and upgraded with a 30"+ flat screen television and sleep number beds. There is no wireless internet in the rooms. There is only wired internet, you have to get a cable from the front desk or bring your own. One nice gesture is that they included to complementary bottled waters in the mini-fridge. It is hard to get around with the car because there is only 1 way to get into the hotel with a car. So if you are coming from the other direction you must go past the hotel under the interstate and make a u-turn. But there is a variety of restaurants within walking distance. Oh by the way the night before we arrived there was an attempted armed robbery of the hotel. http://www.wftv.com/news/17332847/detail.html

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but a terrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: chris fairley
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing change, a hotel that lives up to its review. This hotel is an asset to the radisson chain. The front desk were welcoming and very very helpful and the customer service/vacation planning desk personel were friendly and to their credit not pushy ( which i have found in other hotels) The room we had was 621 facing away from the I4 and was quiet and the room was excellent , clean, well maintained with plenty of space to walk around. A bit short on actual drawer space but we worked around it, but the drawer space would be a bit pushed for 4 persons so maybe a small chest of drawers would help and not take up to much space. We had an issue with the WC but this was sorted by the staff in approx 15mins (very impressed by the service attitude) as was the safe, which had been left locked, also sorted. The fridge was excellent and microwave easy to use as was the iron and board. The flat screen TV was excellent and the signal only froze once but again maintaince were there at top speed (all they did was unplug it and plugged it back in,easy when you know how) . The ice machine and the soft drinks machine on the same floor were good and the drinks not over priced. The only real problem we had was with the restaurant. We arrived on the Saturday evening and noted that the buffet breakfast on Saturday and Sunday was USD 14.50 per person and had "10 hot items". We usually try the breakfast on the first day at the hotel, as this gives us a guide to the standard. After all the American buffet breakfast is standard to all hotels. Oh boy did we regret this option, at 0930 on a Sunday the place was deserted (we should have realised then that is was not that good). The 10 "hot" items ranged from pancakes,oats,grits( i think),corned beef hash, hash browns,sausages,tomatoes, bacon,scrambled eggs and 1 empty space which i found out later was for fried eggs with broken yokes. Nothing was labled so it guess what is time. Hot was not a word i would have used, luke warm was closer to the mark. The tables did not have the usual bottle of ketchup (you had to askfor it) and the quest for the syrup to go with the pancakes, well you had to ask for that as well. When we got the bill we found that fruit juices were NOT included in the basic price and they wanted 15% service charge on top for a self service buffet!! We paid and left never to return. Thankfully the Cross Roads shopping plaza had an excellent Perkins for breakfast (hot and tasty and service with a smile) as well as the usual Macdonalds and a Red Lobster and another steak house. The road entrance to the hotel is a bit of a draw back but I understand from the front desk staff that they may, in the future, be a road connection from the Cross Roads plaza, I hope so as it would make it a lot easier and safer.But all in all not a real issue. The front desk staff and room service were excellent and we would stay again and recommend this property , just avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: Katmssktty
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, from the front desk to the restaurant. Sleep number beds are wonderful, bedding is very up to date. Very CLEAN, we loved our stay and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for adults”
Reviews.Author: travel65
Reviews.Content: The hotel just opened so everything is new and clean. The rooms are a good size and include a frige, micro-wave, and coffee maker. The pool and hot tub are small but good for adults. It was perfect for three women who wanted to walk to dinner yet be close to downtown Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel, close to loads of attractions”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed near Orlando for 2 nights with my partner, on our extended trip around Europe & the USA. It was the end of the summer season & quietening down a little, but we were still able to visit a lot of the surrounding areas, & enjoyed ourselves a great deal. We booked our accommodation via the hotel website directly, & confirmed a place to stay for the duration of our holiday. On our arrival (via rental car), we discovered that the hotel was a large complex, close to Disneyworld & loads of restaurants & other attractions within a very close (driving) distance. Our room was really nice (great value for money), with 2 queen beds, private bathroom (with shower over small bath), massive flatscreen TV, free broadband internet, microwave, fridge, coffee maker, & alarm clock/ipod docking station – awesome! There is parking outside the hotel (within the complex) & also a fitness centre, swimming pool & spa. There is a bar/cafe where you can buy food (including breakfast), but I think that there are better deals elsewhere. Within the same complex there is an attractions-booking desk, a large souvenirs store & a waffle house. The air conditioning in the rooms was excellent, although a little noisy. There are two large lifts, so this hotel would suit older people who may have trouble with stairs, & it would also suit large groups. We were very impressed with the hotel compared to the standard of hotels we had stayed in in other cities for the same amount of money. The service was also excellent, & the staff went to great lengths to ensure our stay was perfect. We didn’t go to any of the Disneyworld attractions, but it appears that there is a free shuttle from the hotel to many of the parks. We spent our time at the Kennedy Space Centre, which is about an hour or so away (the pick up centre for internet tickets is only about a 2 minute drive away – very convenient). Overall, we thought this hotel was excellent! All in all, if you are after a great hotel with a few luxuries for your money, then this is the hotel for you. It’s close to a lot of amenities & is not expensive. If we are ever in the Orlando area again we would definitely stay here. Thanks for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic experience at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Eszti
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights whilst visiting Disney world. The location was great, only a few miles drive from the hotel to Disney world resort. The hotel also has a complimentary shuttle service to Epcot park in Disney. I can honestly only say good things about this hotel; The reception staff was very nice and helpful. It was also great value for money and for the first time in the US the money that we paid for the booking covered all the hotel taxes just like it stated in our Expedia statement. The room was very spacious, clean and nicely decorated (exactly as shown on the website). The bathroom was also stylish, clean and had a great shower. There are some good diners and fast food restaurant very near the hotel (walking distance) however, there is a good size fridge and microwave in the room so you can make a simple dinner at the room too. Ice machines are situated on each floor and there is an ice bucket in the room. The swimming pool is probably a bit small for such a big hotel but I think most people who stay at this hotel chose it for the great location for Disney world. However, you can most probably enjoy the sunshine and relax by the pool provided that it is not too crowded. There is also a small but well equipped gym on the ground floor of the hotel. The breakfast menu is very nice with generous portions and they serve Starbucks coffee. I would certainly recommend this hotel to other people and I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future. Few tips; If you take the hotel shuttle service to the resorts (takes you to Epcot) and you intend to use the Disney world bus shuttle service between resorts during the day, make sure that allow plenty of time to get from one resort to the other as it takes you around in circles and it is really difficult to figure out how to get from one resort to the other.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grfter
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here from 28/09 to 05/10 with my wife and two teenage daughters and had a great time. Best bits Beautiful room, very clean, excellent TV, with fridge and very comfortable beds. Lots of space. Superb location just off I4 and close to Disney. Doing a U turn wasnt a problem!! Free Shuttle to Epcot...very efficient. Free internet access in lobby. Pleasant staff. There were no really bad points apart from a very pushy sales woman in the ticket area (I guess not employed by Radisson). I had to say a number of times that I did not want to go for a presentation of some resort in return for a free breakfast / free tickets...I'm on vacation and in the end I bought them elsewhere. There was some noise from the main roads which surround the hotel, but I am a light sleeper...my kids didnt hear a thing. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good as I would have hoped”
Reviews.Author: farmdog
Reviews.Content: Hotel is hard to get in and out off. Only entrance is off I-4 going into the disney area and you are unable to get back to it leaving disney area unless you go under I-4 and make a U-turn at the first traffic light on the other side which is not easy in heavy traffic. Hotel is sitting on a hill with paving stones instead of paved and it is really easy to trip which I might add I did. I might add this happened while I was waiting for my room to be ready and the staff did not actually seem to care much but did offer a tisue to wipe off the blood and a couple of band aids. DO NOT get a room that is setup for the handicapped unless you are. I reserved a Delux King and got a handicapped room that would be nice if I were in a wheelchair but not so nice if your not, no place to put anything in the bathroom and I would guess the previous guest had a problem since it had a very bad oder. Most of the cleaning staff spoke only spanish so you might not want to engage one in conversion unless you speak spanish. The general desk staff was OK and tried to be as helpful as possible, but not one of the better places I checked into. To recap (Problems - Not easy entrance or exit. Not a very seasoned staff, but in all fairness it was a newer hotel. Rooms not great but OK, should be better for newer hotel. Must be real careful when walking in the parking lot, paving stones have settled and some are sticking up while others are missing. Good Points) Prices was OK. Close to downtown disney Have nice TV's in room and the hotel in general looks real nice. I think you could do worst but I would not book a room here again when there are better places to stay like the Hilton or other hotels on hotel row.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Elegant Radisson.”
Reviews.Author: FLVICK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Radisson Lake Buena Vista from 9/28 to 10/5. We loved it. Very luxurious stay. The moment that you go into the Lobby you will find that the floors are a beautiful gray and black marble with shiny and clean accents. . The front desk person greeted us and welcomed us to the hotel with a pleasant smile and answers to all of our questions. The only negative were that you have to do a U-turn to get to the hotel if coming from Downtown Disney area (no big deal). Cannot tell you if it is good for children as we do not have any, but the ones we saw there were very happy. Hotel layout - The moment that you go into the Lobby you will find that the floors are a beautiful gray and black marble with shiny and clean accents. Toward the left is the Customer Service/Timeshare desk and directly beside it is the Front Desk. Long corridors with carpeted accents and a very nicely detailed lobby area for each floor with a coke machine and an ice maker. Security cameras everywhere. The elevators have a shiny pattern to it and are extremely well kept with modern accents and a nice green glow to the buttons once activated, they were always fast. The Room – We stayed in room 619 which gives you a view of the Cross Roads Shopping plaza (in this case this is one of the best views of the hotel because all you mostly see is a nice big American flag and the beautiful Florida Foliage). Room 619 was amazingly clean, very luxurious bathroom and reasonably spacious, we booked for 1 king bed but they were not available and were given a double room, no big deal because the size of the 2 queen beds was just right. The bathroom is elegant with black granite and marble floor and tiles, a good huge mirror and a spacious shower with toiletries that you would expect to receive at a Diamond class hotel. Plenty of towels and toiletries. Housekeeping staff was extremely detailed in their job. A very spacious closet with Iron and ironing board with a safe in the wall. There was a fridge in the room as well as a microwave. Here are some of the pros and cons about the whole experience. Pros - - Rooms are spacious and clean, with beautiful accents and plenty of bright lighting. - Comfy sleep number beds. - The bathroom is amazing and has all the ameneties you will need. It also has extra towels under the sink. Beautiful sink and huge mirror. Water pressure was excellent as well as water temperature. - The location is excellent, located just I-4 and FL535 with a 5 minute drive to Downtown Disney. Note- if walking Downtown Disney is somewhat of a far walk. - All the staff is courteous, efficient and helpful. - Pool is clean and lounge chairs are very comfortable. - Walking distance to many restaurants, mini-golf, supermarket and gas stations with convenience stores. - Despite location the rooms are extremely quiet. - Hotel does NOT charge for parking or a resort fee as many other 5 star resorts do. - The hotel is very new and you will feel it. Cons - TV had a bad signal for most channels all the time, we were told by the Maintenance person that the cable has been very spotty and that they were working on it. It was never solved. Not a big deal as we only spend a very small fraction of our day at the room. - Buffet food on Saturdays and Sundays is extremely expensive for the kind of food offered. My wife and I ate there once and got sick. Will not try their buffet again. - Pool temperature was cool but still tolerable and is somewhat small for the size of the hotel. We also never saw the Tiki bar open. - Drawer space needs to be bigger. I guess it needs to be that way for the comfort and size of the room. I would recommend bigger drawer space. One small note worth mentioning is that the front desk goes out of their way to help you with any request, my wife sent out some postcards on our 3rd day of arrival and the front desk offered to take them and mail them free of charge. These are small but worthy of mention details that make the Radisson Lake Buena Vista a very good place to stay. We cannot wait to go back to the Disney Area and stay at this wonderful elegant and well appointed 5 star hotel for the price of a 3 star. When planning your vacation read the reviews and understand that some of the complaints are very small issues that people ponder on which really have no importance. We would definitely stay here again. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Hotel Lake Buena Vista - a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mssdb
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here during a long week-end to Disney World. I was a little apprehensive about booking a room sight unseen ...but based on reviews I read on tripadvisor as well as researching prices on comparable hotels, we decided to go for it. What a pleasant surprise! The lobby was very appealing with extremely helpful front desk agents. However, the room was the best surprise of all - two queen size beds, a flat screen television on the wall and a very modern bathroom. I couldn't believe my fortune to get a great room for such a great price. The hotel is in very close proximity to Disney World as well as being within walking distance to various eateries. All in all, it was a great stay. The only thing that could have made my stay better would have been a place to do laundry and transportation provided from the airport. But even that is really no big deal. I understand theme hotels offer more of a "Disney" experience but I never felt we missed out on anything. I would definitely recommend this for anyone, even those with kids. After we left Disney World, my kids wanted to know when were we going back to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: CRose8
Reviews.Content: This is a good nice family hotel, we stayed for 2 weeks and had a great time. Rooms are nice and large and well appointed. its in a good posistion for eating out, there are 30+ restuarants within 1 mile. Nearby supermarket for all the things you forgot, and a nice pool to cool off in when the day is done. The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were always cleaned to a high standard. We never had a Hire car and relied on the hotel shuttle bus to get to Disney or cabs (most of the time for less than $10). If I was to be picky I would point out that the poolside bar we never saw open in 2 weeks. The main bar was always shut at 10-10.30pm and the biggest problem for us was no laundry. (Although we were offered use of one at a sister hotel 1 mile away). Overall, good hotel we would stay again and enjoy the good standard of amenities and posistion in Orlando

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel Orlando - Lake Buena Vista
HotelInfo.Address: 12799 Apopka Vineland Rd, (also known as SR 535), Orlando, FL 32836
